story:
Making a dream come true

After barely escaping the Rwandan genocide in 1994 where a million people were killed in 100 days, Anselme and Therese had two things – a deep faith in God and a dream to emigrate to a country where they could safely live again.

After living as stateless citizens in Kenya for 20 years, their prayers were answered when they emigrated with their three children to Canada. 

They need help now to finish making the dream come true. 

Imagine hiding in a tree, watching helplessly as your family is literally butchered by a crowd of machete waving fanatics. Not far away, your future wife was running through the woods as roving marauders were shooting anybody they could see. A million people were killed in 100 days during the 1994 Rwandan genocide. 

Eventually, Anselme Nkurunziza and Therese Mukamugema met up in Kenya, where for 20 years, they lived as stateless persons. They married, had three children, found a way to attend and finish college, and mostly dreamt of emigrating to Canada. 

What We Need 

Join our Indiegogo effort to help them get started in their new home just outside Montreal. Equipped with strong faith and determination to create a good life for their children, they left Kenya with a suitcase apiece, and no money. They need what every family needs as they start a new life: basic appliances, furniture, household goods, clothes for school in the fall, and hopefully, enough for a down payment on a vehicle. 

Since getting to Canada in April, they’ve survived on the goodwill of another refugee who earlier had made it to Canada. Anselme had to borrow money so they could get on the plane to Montreal. 

Because Anselme arrived very sick and had to spend two weeks in a hospital getting treated for a months-old severe inner ear infection, he hasn’t been able to begin working. He owes more than $5,500 for the special antibiotics that he has been taking after leaving hospital. (Hospital care is free in Canada, but the drugs needed afterwards are not.)

Because their host's home is very crowded, Anselme and Therese have been forced to live apart. Their son lives with Anselme; the daughters are with Therese. This is not a good way to start the school year.

The Impact

Margaret Mead said: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.

There are countless organizations that you can contribute to. 

There are times when we find ourselves in over our heads. We get behind on bills, plans don't quite work out, we lose a job. Most of us have some security net or community to fall back on.

Extending your resources to help Anselme and family provide that community support they need to start a new life.

For the past few years, they have been able to survive with the help of a few friends in the United States. Now that those resources are dwindling, we are asking for your support to help them start anew. Your donation of $25, 50, $100, or more will help reunited them and get them started on their new lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has the financial resources to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Share the link on social media and with your friends.
  • Keep Anselme and his family in your prayers, along with refugees around the world seeking a safe place to live and rebuild lives.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
There is a community outside a small town called Rusape in Zimbabwe where people are trying to live a normal life. There is a school that is in desperate need of help to get stationary,lighting and clean water. There is a river 2km from the school and homesteads so the people walk including the children twice a day everyday to fetch water. There are nearby fields where crops could be grown to supply food and work for the community. There are also a number of orphans that need desperate support.

The money that is raised will be used to furnish the school and to get water to the school and fields. It will also be used to start a cropping program to supply food and work. The second phase once this has been achieved would be to install solar power to the school.

story:
My name is Jane Ratliff, Founder and Executive Director of Bluehair Technology Group (BHT), a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to teaching older adults how to maintain connections with their families and friends; access information from the world around them; and be inspired to change the way they age through the power of technology.


Based in Atlanta, BHT is committed to the principle that older adults possess limitless potential to develop as individuals and that they have the capacity to continually enrich their lives and make valuable contributions to society. Among our activities we hold seminars on topics such as:

  • Computer Basics
  • Tablet Basics
  • Facebook Basics
  • Windows 10 Basics
  • Smartphone Basics
  • Top Applications

IMPACT

According to a 2012 study by the Pew Research Center, 59% of seniors in the United States reported that they “go online,” and 47% indicated that they have a high-speed broadband connection at home. That figure may be higher now, but a large segment of seniors still remain unconnected. These non-users are generally older and less affluent than the seniors who have access to online platforms and often have significant challenges with health or disability issues. They are largely disconnected from valuable digital tools and services, both physically and psychologically, and are not taking advantage of online news and information, government services, health resources, and opportunities for social support that can be so helpful in during the aging process.

WHAT WE NEED

I am currently reaching out on Indiegogo for support. The donations we receive will help us cover our administrative and infrastructure costs, maintain our current seminars, and expand our programs.


It is very important to live a life of continuous learning, but many older people have a hard time learning new skills, not necessarily because of their age, but because they either believe that they are too old to learn or they have no one to teach them. We believe that it’s never too late to stimulate learning! We deliver seminars for seniors at Independent Living Communities, Senior Living Communities, Country Clubs and other private and public locations. Our instructors use a fun, relaxed, patient and hands-on approach so that older participants will enjoy learning and will begin to eagerly apply their new skills.

If you would like more information about Blue Hair Technology Group, please visit www.bluehairtech.org – or better yet, call me at 770-696-9808 so that I can share our vision, describe our programs in more detail, and discuss how your donation will make a difference in a senior’s life! I look forward to hearing from you and welcome your feedback, your involvement, and your support!

Sincerely,

Jane Ratliff, Executive Director

story:
"What the heck is Dynamizer™?"

Hi there! We are Marvin, Michelle, and Josh — the creators of Dynamizer™.

For years, we've worked with adults in organizations of all sizes, helping them learn to discover and develop their strengths. As you might imagine, this approach completely transforms workplaces!

But as we kept doing this work, we realized we weren't starting EARLY enough.

We thought: what would happen if YOUNG PEOPLE could learn about their strengths much, much earlier in their lives?

Here's a few things to ponder...

  • What would happen if young people knew which activities made them feel dynamic and energized before they started looking for a career?
  • What would happen if young people could be more comfortable and confident being themselves?
  • What would happen if young people knew how to appreciate and celebrate the differences of the other young people around them?

(You can see the possibilities now, right?? Yeah, we do, too.)

The. World. Would. Be. Changed.

Thus, Dynamizer™ was born!

We started testing it out in a number of different environments, including perhaps most notably as a foundational element of Camp Rise Above (see Erin's testimonial below!). The initial results were SO off-the-charts encouraging, we decided to move it into production.

NOW WE NEED YOUR HELP!

//

"What are strengths?"

We define strengths as things that energize us, make us feel strong, and come very naturally. And this next part is super important: Dynamizer doesn’t just focus on things young people are “good at” or can "do well," but also on the things that will truly energize their best life, and help them find their most engaging career someday! This is NOT just a "career assessment," but a new, innovative way to identify a young person's true inner strengths and help them focus on the things that will energize them most throughout their whole lives! 

"Does it work??"

Great question! Short answer: YES. But you don't have to take our word for it; here are a few quotes from people who have used Dynamizer™ out in the real world:

"Our campers get so much from using Dynamizer! Living with serious illnesses and disabilities often causes these children to feel defined by their weaknesses. However, Dynamizer allows them to identify their individual strengths and talents. As they step away from being labeled by their illness, these wonderful children have the opportunity to overcome obstacles and grow in their capabilities. The focus of Dynamizer on individual strengths builds confidence and changes the way children perceive themselves for years to come." — Erin Marie Ulmer, Executive Director, Camp Rise Above

"I have witnessed first-hand how Dynamizer provides an opportunity for young people to understand their own unique strengths and the strengths of others, helping them accept and respect differences as being positive and wonderful." — Gene D’Agostino, Board of Directors, Oceanside Collegiate Academy

"As an executive coach and consultant, I find great value in identifying, understanding and leveraging one’s strengths. Dynamizer accomplishes this with young people in such a way that they can gain strategies early to live and thrive with a continuing picture of the best version of themselves. This has profound immediate and long-term implications for greater productivity, stronger relationships and effective direction. I strongly recommend Dynamizer for each and every child in your life." — John Carroll, Author, The Great Big Book Of Goal Setting And Getting

"What's the difference between a 'deck' and a 'box?'"

A single deck is perfect for a dynamic discussion with 1 young person (or even 2 if you pair them up to share a deck!). The Dynamizer™ box contains 15 full decks, so it's perfect for groups up to 30 young people!

//

"What can I do with it?"

Share the power of energizing strengths with a young person in your life, and help...

  • Grow a young person's Self-Awareness — Dynamizer™ boosts self-awareness and self-esteem by providing deep personal insights about intrinsic motivators

  • Improve a young person's Relationships — Dynamizer™ improves communications and relationships by helping young people understand where other people are coming from

  • Build a young person's Self-Confidence — Dynamizer™ helps young people stand up to negative peer pressure by building self-confidence and resilience

  • Address Conflict & Bullying between young people — Dynamizer™ teaches how to constructively address interpersonal conflicts and helps prevent bullying by respecting differences

//

"Sounds great! What do you need me to do?"

It's pretty simple — we need funding to pay for the first-run production of Dynamizer™!

This project is a labor-of-love side-project for the three of us. We know it needs to exist, and we need your help to turn it into a real, tangible thing.

We're raising $19,500 to start — this will get us 1000 of the 15-pack Dynamizer boxes you see in the photos. This multi-pack will allow a teacher or youth leader to use just one box and teach 15-30 kids at a time about their strengths!

As you can imagine, there have been quite a few "out of pocket" expenses that the three of us have been self-funding just to get this thing going (product design, initial manufacturer costs, website design, game testing, legal fees, bank fees, etc.). Some of the $19,500 will pay us founders back for our initial investment, and the rest will go right back into creating more Dynamizer™ products to serve more kids!

//

"Why would I want to help with this?"

*Cue "We Are The World, We Are The Children..." music*

If even a little part of you believes that our children really are our future, we hope you'll donate and share. Everything about this project been designed to help young people everywhere learn about and utilize their strengths, because when a young person can LIVE in their strengths, everything about their life gets a little bit better...!

//

"Is it possible this WON'T get made and I won't get one?"

Short answer: no. We've already committed to this first order — they'll actually be arriving on the U.S. soil quite soon! 

Put another way: if you donate for a perk that includes a Dynamizer box, you WILL get one, guaranteed! 

"What will it cost when it's released?"

When it's made publicly available, the 15-pack Dynamizer™ box will be $79.95.

"What's that I hear about a 5% Give-Back Program??"

For every 100 Dynamizer™ boxes sold, we’ll donate 5 Dynamizer™ boxes to schools in income-challenged areas or community centers in income-challenged communities to help young people in all social situations learn more about their energizing strengths!

//

"Is donating money the only way I can help?"

Of course, we'd really appreciate a donation, even if it's $5 — a donation from everyone who sees this would likely exceed our goal! So please consider forgoing your weekly latte and helping a young person learn about their strengths.

That said, if you just can't donate, we understand!

In that case, please share this webpage with your network — you can share it with your local church youth pastor, someone who volunteers with the youth group, an instructor working with after school programs, a teacher or administrator at the school your kids attend, someone you know who works with Boys & Girls Clubs, Girl Scouts / Boy Scouts, or anyone else you know who cares about or works with young people ages 11+.

//

"What's next??"

We see Dynamizer™ as a movement, not a product, and we hope you'll join us on our mission to bring strengths to young people everywhere! After this product gets launched, we have a LOT more ideas for how to help young people utilize their strengths better and more powerfully in the world around them.

The ultimate goal of this project is to help make sure your kids (and everyone else's kids) end up in a career they love. And before then, a young person knowing their strengths will help them interact better with their classmates, stand up to peer pressure, and even help prevent bullying. 


Please, donate and share this video with someone today!

story:
WHY URGENT,

We are taking this initiative to help children in the orphanage get back school next academic term which starts in September 2017 and we can’t achieve our goal without you. The donation is taking care of the kids’ school fees, food and clothing for two years. We need your support. Every bit helps, so please give to make this initiative a success!

 

The Home

The Save Orphanage Home was established in the year 2000 with the aim of developing orphans and children with physical disabilities. The home has no support from the government but rely solely on donations from Blue-Med Africa staffs, volunteers and donors. The home has 41 kids who are all enrolled into school. We are working on reintegrating the kids to their families within the next  two years whiles we continue to support them with their school fees, food and school supplies.

story:
"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world"

By Nelson Mandela

"Every Child has Right for Education"

Frank Swai and Rev. Joshua laiser are the founders of Pambazuka Naisinyai School. The idea of starting Pambazuka Naisinyai School came to the mind of Frank and Joshua after seeing the challenges facing Maasai communities in Tanzania. Rev. Joshua is a Maasai by tribe and he was born and raised in the Maasai communities so he knows much about the challenges facing his communities.He says "Education has been severe challenge in the Maasai communities as most of families don't know the importance of education for future life of their children. So we are working hard to educate parents and community in general so that they can know the importance of education. So the Pambazuka Naisinyai School is for Maasai children and nearby communities. Please join us and donate something to support this project!!

Our School Started under the tree

Our school started under the tree as we do not have resources to help us for building classes for the Maasai children. Education should start with their parents to educate them so that they can know the importance of education to their children. Some of the parents are now aware about education to their children so they are allowing them to attend school. We are still talking to the parents so that they can give us a good cooperation.

Students and their teacher having class session under the tree

 

Early Marriage and circumcision for the young Maasai girls.

Imagine a world where every child is educated and can contribute to the development process!!

So many times parents in Maasai  areas tend to give away their young girls for marriage in exchange for just a kilogram of sugar, a goat, a cow , some tea leaves and sometimes for salt. These young girls are then subjected to domestic violence, torture, early child birth and many times girls have died while giving birth because their bodies are never ready to experience child birth.

Many times the parents to these girls need to be empowered with information about the benefits of keeping their children in school until they complete their education. Once these girls have acquired the education, they can provide all the above mentioned items to their parents for the rest of their lives. All that parents need to to practice some bit of patience and sacrifice a little in order to enjoy the fruits of their children.

Circumcision for the women is prohibited but Maasai societies they still circumcise their young girls. We are working hard to educate them so that they can stop this.

Its time to reach out to the parents in the Maasai land settings and sensitize them if we want a better future for girls. A future where they can participate in leadership positions. A future where they can make informed choices and start up families the the men of their choice.

The time is now. Lets teach the Parents because they need this knowledge.

Maasai girls

Young Boys:  Young boys normally are send to keep cows and goats far away from home and come back evening everyday. Others they like to go to school but not allowed to go!!

Young Maasai Kids in the bush keeping cows

Education: Most of Maasai children don't go to school due to the environment they are living. Their parent don't understand the importance of their children to get better education. So we are trying our level best to educate these Maasai societies so that they can allow their children to go to school. Also there are scarcity of nearest school in their areas so we are working hard to build school near them to attract and convince their parent to allow them to attend school.

Our effort made us to start building Pambazuka Naisinyai School http://www.pambazuka.sc.tz  for which this school started under the tree but with our own effort we have managed to build some two classes and bought some desks so we need to work hard to make it happen!!

 

WHY THIS CAMPAIGN IS IMPORTANT

We decided to start a school in Maasai society so as to convince the Maasai on Education. Maasai society is leaving a life with no permanent settlement, thus not getting a chance for schooling. Also the society lives a life of animal husbandry which is difficult for parents to allow their children in distant schools due to they depend of them for rearing animals. Therefore starting a school within Maasai society will convince parents allowing their children to attend school near by them. That is the school I started within Maasai society is purposely to help the Maasai children. It is called PAMBAZUKA NAISINYAI PRE & PRIMARY SCHOOL         http://www.pambazuka.sc.tz   . Already our school has grade one (1) with 65 pupils , grade two with 55 and grade three with 35  pupils and 4 teachers who use most of their time teaching the children for most of them can’t speak neither Swahili nor English, but Maasai language.

Student doing class work on the ground

 

 NEW TWO CLASSES

Through our own efforts we have managed to build two classes where grade one and two are using for studying. We have more 10 acres where we want to build more classes as we have more students coming soon. We want to build more classes up to seven classes, we also need to build kitchen, toilet as the one we have is not enough, computers and computer lab, well for keeping water as there is scarcity of water, desks, books, office for teachers, salaries for teachers.

Our two New Classes

Our future plans are to have secondary school up to university among Maasai society in order to have education nearby so as to fight poverty by getting good education.

  The importance of this campaign is to construct a school within Maasai society, also helping Maasai society withdraw from ignorance and illiteracy so a t cope with the changes of the world.

Under Construction please help a bit

What We Need 

We need to do the following so that we can get our school off the ground; Seven more classes, computer room, Library, computers, Office for the staff, Kitchen, Good toilet, Reading books, tank for water storage and bin maize and beans storage, lunch for the teachers and students, salaries for teachers, Scholarship and to build fence around the school. The estimation costs is $150,000.  "Every bit will help"

 

Desks: We have managed to buy some desks for one class so class one will not sit on the ground again. Please support us so that we can buy more desks and build more classes!!

THE FOLLOWING ARE THE REASONS AS TO WHY MY PROJECT IS VALUABLE TO DONORS AND THE WORLD

  This project is very important to donors and world at large for it will connect us with Maasai society for they shall be able to communicate with different people of different nations of the world. Also this will give chance for donors to come and visit Maasai society and learn the real life and culture of Maasai. Apart from that it also helps to eradicate the number of illiterates in the world.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

1. Due to studying environment being of low standard life, it is difficult to get skilled teachers and faithful constructors.

2. Another challenge is teacher's salaries, where by in order to get good trainers you also have to pay them well.

3. Another challenge is that , the pupils are fluently speaking Maasai native language, while their teachers don’t know the language and thus difficult to teach them

4. Due to that parents couldn’t get education, and then they find no importance to take their children to school.

Men at work bringing  clean water at Pambazuka School, Please help

 

 

 HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES

1. Improving the teaching environment so as to encourage trained teachers to come and teach in our school. Also getting enough trusted constructors for constructing the building.

2. Increasing teacher's salaries so as to motivate the coming of more teachers.

3. Educating parents’ house by house on the importance of taking their children to school.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!

Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!

Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

 

What you get once you support us (The Perks!!)

T- Shirt (Will send your size and different color with different images)

 

Maasai Children Photo!!

 

Big 5 Photo!! ( We will send you one photo of Big 5)

 

Maasai Shuka ( There are of different types for men and women) will send one pair.

 

Hat with Kilimanjaro word or any other photo of wildlife in Tanzania

School website: www.pambazuka.sc.tz

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/Pambazuka-Naisinyai-Sc...

Twitter:   https://twitter.com/PambazukaSchool
story_txt: "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world"By Nelson Mandela"Every Child has Right for Education"Frank Swai and Rev. Joshua laiser are the founders of Pambazuka Naisinyai School. The idea of starting Pambazuka Naisinyai School came to the mind of Frank and Joshua after seeing the challenges facing Maasai communities in Tanzania. Rev. Joshua is a Maasai by tribe and he was born and raised in the Maasai communities so he knows much about the challenges facing his communities.He says "Education has been severe challenge in the Maasai communities as most of families don't know the importance of education for future life of their children. So we are working hard to educate parents and community in general so that they can know the importance of education. So the Pambazuka Naisinyai School is for Maasai children and nearby communities. Please join us and donate something to support this project!!Our School Started under the treeOur school started under the tree as we do not have resources to help us for building classes for the Maasai children. Education should start with their parents to educate them so that they can know the importance of education to their children. Some of the parents are now aware about education to their children so they are allowing them to attend school. We are still talking to the parents so that they can give us a good cooperation.Students and their teacher having class session under the tree Early Marriage and circumcision for the young Maasai girls.Imagine a world where every child is educated and can contribute to the development process!!So many times parents in Maasai  areas tend to give away their young girls for marriage in exchange for just a kilogram of sugar, a goat, a cow , some tea leaves and sometimes for salt. These young girls are then subjected to domestic violence, torture, early child birth and many times girls have died while giving birth because their bodies are never ready to experience child birth.Many times the parents to these girls need to be empowered with information about the benefits of keeping their children in school until they complete their education. Once these girls have acquired the education, they can provide all the above mentioned items to their parents for the rest of their lives. All that parents need to to practice some bit of patience and sacrifice a little in order to enjoy the fruits of their children.Circumcision for the women is prohibited but Maasai societies they still circumcise their young girls. We are working hard to educate them so that they can stop this.Its time to reach out to the parents in the Maasai land settings and sensitize them if we want a better future for girls. A future where they can participate in leadership positions. A future where they can make informed choices and start up families the the men of their choice.The time is now. story:
Short Summary

While writing our book called Heal Addiction with Bhakti Yoga and Stay High Forever, i found the knowledge to be great help to my recovery from addiction to many things. This book Godliness Love and Sexuality seemed to automatically emerge first. The natural desire and energies around sexuality and pleasure is very important to understand, accept and manage, especially if related to addiction. God is not separate from sexuality and all pleasure of this world. 
We want to help people be happier with themselves in their spiritual lives. 
The unique knowledge from the Bhakti Yoga scriptures will eventually satisfy the Lord and everybody who practices it. 
What We Need & What You Get

For only USD 5$, we will email the pdf of this book you. 

The Impact

  • This knowledge will help many negative feelings about sexuality to dissipate, to go away and make this world a better place. We know this because it was very helpful to me and another person who learnt some of it. If the Lord desires, from our other research and experiences we know it will help many people.
  • How does somebody who had an abortion live with themselves? Why should sex addicts not feel bad about themselves, but rather engage in Bhakti Yoga. What is spirit and matter and how does it relate to sexuality? What is love and lust? What are the different effects?
Risks & Challenges

Sex and religion are very personal subjects and what we present will surprise some people, especially about how closely sexuality and all pleasure is related to the Lord. We don't mean to disturb anybody however we are just presenting the Bhakti Yoga scriptures. When by the Lords mercy a person begins to see the all pervasiveness of the Lord, then they can more easily accept things.Young intelligent people will be able to get most benefit from the knowledge. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell others about this book, and join our Facebook page, search for Godliness Love and Sexuality https://www.facebook.com/pages/Godliness-Love-a...?

IMPORTANT

Email your Full Name, "it" Invite Link and Receipt of your contribution to igrowglobalteam@gmail.com

This iGrowGlobal Team fund will go towards the Ad Campaign for our 30 second "it" video (currently being edited) which will be promoted on both Facebook and YouTube aggressively over the next 6 months. 

The campaign will reach GLOBALLY and bring in "it" users which will be distributed through our COOP to each person based on the number of shares in the COOP they have purchased. The more shares you own, the more time your "it" link will be on the rotator.

This will be an ongoing campaign and contribution will continue through the next 6 months. Based on cost comparisons recently done, we feel we have enough funds right now to reach 1 million people on YouTube with our video. We are expecting to reach hundreds of thousands of views every month for the next 6 months!!! 

This is a HUGE movement that we are kicking off now so we can dominate the FB and YouTube space as a team, before others catch on and try the same thing. If you are serious about building your iGrow Network business big, then lets team together and leverage our resources! 


10$ = 2 shares
50$ = 15 shares
100$ = 40 shares

Thank you for all your support!

story:
Dear Fellow Indiegogoers,

My name is Stavros Velissaris and I am a Final year Medical Student at St George’s University of London. As a student who’s about to finish his degree, I am involved with many things such as:

· Going on ward rounds in various hospital departments and converse with people with a whole magnitude of conditions/illnesses.

· Involved with Final Year Research and Audits

· Writing articles about diseases in order to enable non-medical folks gain a clearer understanding of various conditions

· Teaching clinical skills to first year medical students, embarking on their new academic life

Additionally to my studies, I have also been cooking for the past 7 years. As I know from personal experience the many demands of student life, I am preparing a simple recipe book targeted at fulfilling dietary needs of fellow students worldwide. With this, students will be able to eat more healthily without much requiring extra effort or additional cash for needless take-away buys.

As planned, this book will:

  • Contain recipes for students of all dietary preferences
  • Have Before & after images of dishes
  • Include a section of simple tips for swifter and tastier cooking

Unfortunately my sources are drying up due to the ongoing & deepening Greek economic crisis.  If I don’t manage to collect the required money on time, I won’t be able to graduate by March 16'.

Any contribution from your part will be invaluable. Just with a 1 pound donation you will recieve 3 recipes from my new book. (Officially out by the summer of 2016)

Even if you don’t have anything yourselves to offer, you can contribute a great deal by informing someone else about this campaign!

It goes without saying that although this book will be primarily targeted at students, it's will be suitable for anyone who doesn't want to spend excess time in the kitchen!

Thank you for taking your time to look at my page. :)

Stavros 

Ramen burgers - noodles instead of bread!

story:
Special Needs is a community and we need to communicate with each other: share our challenges and our successes.  Therefore, here, at the Factory, we are creating a space where families can interact with each other, because no one should face these challenges alone.

This is our dream: to be an informative, educational and fun source to all Special Needs families. We want to make successful behavioral therapies available to everyone.

In order to bring our dream to life, we need you and your support. We have built the foundation for our website and have the pieces of the puzzle ready to go. Now we are seeking donations to complete the production process and get this running.. Our goal is to make this the very best for our families and this amazing community of people. 

We would like to thank our donors by giving the option of being included in a SNH(Special Needs Hero) list on our website in acknowledgement of your generosity and belief in us. 

We care and are committed in this effort.  We hope you will join us in building something that the Special Needs community needs and deserves.

Meet Vince, the man behind Hocus Focus Factory-

Vincent Severen has been working in the field of behavioral therapy for almost 12 years. He has worked in both the school and home settings. While in this field, he has worked with children of all ages and disabilities, included but not limited to: Autism, Down Syndrome, Cerebral Palsy, ADD, ADHD, Asperger’s Syndrome, Angelman Syndrome, and brain injuries. He is trained in ABA Therapy (Applied Behavioral Analysis) and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention). During his career in the field of behavioral therapy, Vincent has had the opportunity to see a variety of techniques and learn how to use them in different environments, taking a great deal of knowledge from those experiences and applying that knowledge to his own repertoire. His goal is to help children succeed and thrive to their full potential. Not all children work in the same way. Vincent believes that individualizing the style of therapy, yet making it adaptable to a much wider range of personalities is critical, in order to ensure that as many people as possible can benefit. This is his dream and he would like to share it so that families have a place to get help, tips, information, and knowledge to better serve their child.

What we will be offering:

  • Online academy with 7 modules and over 30 different lessons focusing on behavioral therapy and strategies for children of all ages and skill levels
  • Weekly as well as monthly worksheets, activities, and games geared towards children of all ages
  • A private community for parents of special needs children where they can share their challenges and successes with other families
  • Along with the academy, we will be offering one on one Skype consultations to give some extra help when needed.

 

Questions regarding Payment Processing through IndieGoGo:

*All payments made through IndieGoGo are secured through their Https:// website. 

 

Thank you all so much for your support!

story:
Thank you for joining Dr. Steve Folmar and Wake Forest University's "Students for Nepal" as we rally to provide relief in the wake of Nepal's recent earthquake. Proceeds from this page will benefit the International Commission for Dalit Rights, a respected NGO that promotes the physical and social well-being of Nepal's most marginalized caste group. 

How You Can Help

This campaign is seeking small denominations and aiming to reach a large amount of prospective donors. We realize that most people can’t give a hefty amount of cash at one time, and are asking for only small amounts, or whatever you feel compelled to give.  Any amount you can donate will contribute to relief for Dalit communities near the epicenter of the quake.

If you can’t donate, we understand! Help us get the word out, so more people can generously spare some change for this cause. Please share this with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, or listservs. We sincerely appreciate your time and support, whether you directly contribute or rally around the cause.

Who Is Handling this Campaign, Anyways?

My name is Kristen Gentry and I am a project coordinator for ethnographic research in Nepal. I am collaborating with Dr. Steven Folmar, Phyllis D'Agostino and a Wake Forest University student organization, Students for Nepal. Everyone involved with this campaign has lived with Dalits in Nepal. Dr. Steven Folmar is supporting the management of this campaign, as he and the ICDR have been involved in several development projects near the epicenter and have productive partnerships with community-based NGOs. 

Finally, the Perks!

Electric Peak Creative, a Nashville-based visual arts company, has generously donated their time and talent to support All for Nepal. For each donation of $30 or more, donors will receive high resolution digital photos courtesy of Electric Peak Creative. These photos can be enlarged to display on your mantle, bedroom, or office, and make great gifts for those who love the country of Nepal and/or travel photography.

Please, provide us with your email and desired photo titles at the time of donation.

Please, provide us with your email and desired photo titles at the time of donation.

story:
THANK YOU TO ALL OUR WONDERFUL CONTRIBUTORS!!

Together we did it 


In a nutshell... 

We, the Deep Democracy Institute (DDI) international student community are reaching out to you for your support. We are raising travel and accommodation funds for 10 participants from conflict zones and currency disadvantaged countries to attend the DDI annual 10 day leadership intensive training “Power, Love, War and Miracles” with 100+ participants from all continents, from 2nd to 11th October 2015 in Barcelona.

Your contribution will help people learn, practice and take deep democracy facilitation and conflict resolution capacities back home.  We believe that by investing in extraordinary grass roots and local leaders closest to the action, we are directly influencing a better world. 

DDI is matching travel with tuition

We've got great news! For every $3,500 we raise for one participant's travel and accommodation, the Deep Democracy Institute is giving a full tuition scholarship. 

Who are we?

We are business and nonprofit leaders, artists, scientists, politicians, farmers, coaches and therapists, change managers and community leaders.  We work in fields as diverse as health, media, agriculture and environment, psychology, research, education, finance, and social work.  We represent different religious affiliations and political directions. 

We share a common belief that awareness and facilitation can make our personal development and the development of organizations and nations less difficult and more effective and enjoyable.

Our challenge

We have 60 days to achieve our target of $28,430. This will fund travel and accommodation for ten participants from conflict zones and currency disadvantaged countries to attend the DDI annual intensive training. 

Travel and accommodation for each participant costs $3,500, a total of $35,000. We have independently raised $6,570 towards the funds. In this crowdfunding campaign we need to raise the remaining $28,430 for ten participants. Please donate as soon as possible to ensure time for visa arrangements and best travel deals!

Thank you!

Your contribution

Please join with us to reach our target, person by person. You can sponsor the travel and accommodation cost up to $3,500 for a single participant or give a smaller amount according to your means and interest. Every contribution counts! 

Other ways you can contribute

We appreciate any help you feel moved to offer. Apart from financial support, we are also grateful if you:

  • Send a personal email to people in your network about our campaign 
  • Give frequent flyer airline miles to assist travel
  • Use social media to link your friends and networks to the campaign
  • Lets us know if you or someone you know has skills or knowledge to help fund-approved participants in some other way

Do you have ideas? Please tell us!
Contact Julia at jhwolfson@gmail.com

Ripple effect

Help local leaders, practitioners and community builders  facilitate improvements in health, education, business development, entrepreneurship, housing, employment opportunities, gender equality, cultural innovations, good governance and political renewal.  

You are enabling those working in the midst of political unrest and war, where economies are less affluent, to share their richness and wisdom with international partners, and get encouragement, new methods and renewal for transformational work back home. 

The Deep Democracy Institute 

Drs. Ellen and Max Schupbach are co-founders and co-leaders of the Deep Democracy Institute, an International Conflict Resolution Think Tank active in the USA, Europe, Russia, Ukraine, East Africa and Middle East. The Institute facilitates public open forums in conflict zones, as well as large group work in corporations and grassroots movements. DDI has training programs, consulting groups and publishing ventures, with main centers in San Francisco, Amsterdam, Kyiv, Nairobi, and Moscow.

DDI Leadership Intensive

The intensive is an opportunity to learn processwork and deep democracy methods to enhance personal and professional development, and:

  • Lead and facilitate diverse teams of up to 30 people for better and more effective collaboration, resolve conflict, and achieve high impact.
  • Lead and facilitate diverse groups of up to 1000 people through conflict into common ground and new initiatives.

Our DDI expert faculty are seasoned human beings and provide an inspirational learning environment through life experience, theory, practice and peer learning, in small and large groups.

This year, our 4th 10-Day Intensive Course in Deep Democracy and Worldwork facilitation is focusing on solutions with a creative twist, in:

  • highly diverse large groups
  • startups full of vision, and lacking resources
  • complex conflicted team constellations
  • multiple stakeholder processes without agreed upon ground rules
  • regional and national conflicts
  • the inner lives of creative change agents
  • co-operatives and grassroots movements trying to get their act together without compromising their egalitarian visions of collaboration.

To learn more about the DDI intensive, please check out our website.

What participants say 

“Life changing. It amazed me how people from different parts of the world could connect on such a deep level, and it inspired me to work with diverse communities.” – Fartun, Kenya

“It’s like a small world!! People from all over the world learning together, sharing their different points of view, and supporting those who are in need of help. It was a unique environment of collective learning!” – Ahmad, Palestine

“At the intensive I realized facilitation is my thing that I want to master – anywhere, any time, in projects, the family, with friends, on the street… And I wish and hope that in the future facilitation will be taught from kindergarten.” – Xenia, Russia

“My biggest learning was not the theory, which was extremely profound, but the diversity I encountered. What a group we had – people from 21 countries all in one room for 10 days! Well, this experience of diversity helped me a lot in finding my own style as a facilitator.” – Anton, Ukraine

“It was a nourishing experience to spend ten days in the community of amazing people who have dedicated themselves to awareness, Deep Democracy, and working on their issues.” – Holger, Germany

“I came back home and saw myself and my life with new eyes.” – Maryanne, Kenya

“The inner work was so stimulating and in some cases brought resolution. It wasn't just a seminar, it was a fresh community revealing itself day by day in a here and now spirit.” – Zina, Italy

“The time was full of fun, learning and it gave a chance to reflect. I saw my life from different angles, and went back home with feelings that I trust my abilities and understand them in a way I never did.” – Rola, Palestine

“Particularly exciting for me was the incredible community learning experience. Through the structure of the large group, small groups, triads & innerwork we became a collective multi-leveled learning experience. It was an incredible model for learning & a powerful demonstration for living.” – Paul, Spain

“This is the best and the most powerful facilitation training for leaders throughout the world.” – Yuliya, Ukraine


Do you think this campaign contains prohibited content? Let us know.

story:
In 2014, 94 minors were recovered from sex trafficking along the Front Range. This is great for those recovered, but reveals how tremendous the issue of human trafficking is in this area. A Face to Reframe (AFTR) is a human trafficking prevention organization in Fort Collins, Colorado that educates the community on this issue through participatory arts, training, and community building. Our passion is to inform and empower others in order to prevent exploitation through trafficking in our community and beyond. We have been doing this since 2009, and it is time to expand in order to better meet the needs of our community and to make a greater impact in combatting this crime. We are hiring a Development Coordinator and need help to fund her position for the first three months until consistent funding comes in from grants and community partners. Please help us to expand our impact in this way.

The Problem

AFTR exists because of the need in our community to address human trafficking.

  • A sting operation in Fort Collins in spring of 2015, led to 18 men being charged for solicitation.
  • The stabbing at a Fort Collins hotel in January was connected to a sex trafficking operation. The traffickers were indicted in April 2015.
  • In January, six minors were recovered at the National Western Stockshow.
These are only a few of the stories of success within our community, but the problem is much bigger.

  • Homelessness is the largest risk factor for the commercial sexual exploitation and sex trafficking of minors
  • In 2013, 921 youth were reported homeless in and around Denver.
  • Nearly 25% of the homeless in Fort Collins are under 18.
  • In Colorado, 30% of youth who run away will be recruited to trade sex for food and other necessities within 48 hours of leaving home.

How You Can Help

To address this vast and complicated issue, AFTR runs the following programs:

Prevention and Intervention Training

  • In partnership with U COUNT Campaign, we facilitate prevention training at local high schools (health classes, clubs, peer ambassadors, etc.) and youth programs.
  • We also train direct service providers most likely to encounter trafficking victims such as law enforcement and health care professionals.
  • Since February of this year, we have trained over 300 individuals.

Power Art Program

  • Power Art is a sex trafficking youth prevention program that uses art to expose, educate, equip and empower at-risk youth to be peer influencers.
  • Our goal is to pilot the program in five locations, with nine facilitators having already been trained.

Community Organizing and Activating

  • In partnership with many community agencies, we facilitate the Larimer Anti-Trafficking Community Response Team for those providing direct services to potential victims such as teachers, healthcare professionals, and law enforcement. The team meets regularly in order to spearhead a unified response to the issue in our community.
  • With Zonta International, we have launched the Concerned Citizens Against Human Trafficking for those in our community who are raising awareness or funds to combat human trafficking.

AFTR has increased the scope of our programs immensely since the start of this year, and in order to maintain what we have and to reach even farther, we need to expand our staff as well. Please support us in this growth and in continuing our work in the community.

Every dollar is greatly appreciated. If you would like to be a recurring donor, visit us at A Face to Reframe: Donations and select Development Coordinator under programs. Even if you are unable to donate at this time, please help us by spreading the word and sharing this campaign. Thank you for joining us in preventing human trafficking in our community. We could not do this without you.

Perks

To thank you for you support, we have included some sweet perks. Every donor will get a hand-written thank you card, but in addition to that you can have a personal Facebook acknowledgement, a button, or a t-shirt.

T-shirts and sizes are limited (8 men's XL, 6 women's XL, 5 women's L, and 4 women's M), so be quick claim your reward.

story:
EMNH Athletics

For those of you reading this, I'd like to start by saying thank you for simply taking the opportunity to do so. My name is Andre Williams and I'm a young and aspiring man looking to bring as much change as I can. I'm a passionately dedicated basketball player and the game is all I want to be around. I've played college basketball and am still doing so. I look to pursue to a career to keep playing after college as well. However, while I'm still chasing my dreams to make it professionally, I want to help someone else who wants the same. I figure I should do it now while I'm young and have all the resources necessary now. I already have an elite training group known as GymRatzPerformance. Seven days a week we train players from small kids to professionals and have over 600 clients. With that being said, I want to present to the world EMNH athletics in which I can have a facility to do all things required to get every athlete a scholarship to attend college for free. God has blessed me to be able to get a full athletic scholarship through hard work and most importantly the strongest support system for my parents. Not every athletes has that. So many of my teammates who were far much better than I was, never had the chances I've had because of that void with no support system. Which then led them to doing things that resulted into jail or sadly incidents surrounding death. I don't want that to happen anymore and I will be able to prevent it as much as possible by opening up a gym guaranteeing scholarships for education. I want equal opportunity for all and I'm willing to be the politician to speak for that. I'm determined and motivated. 

"EMNH" is a acronym that stands for "Easy Money Nuttin' Honey." It's something my father used to say at all of my games and that has stuck with me for years around all of my teammates and peers. Basically what it means is that whatever you want in life is achievable if you fully believe in your ability to conquer all obstacles. Nothing in life will be hard if you continue to work towards a dream.

The main goal of my campaign is to get every athlete free college education and potentially opportunities to play professionally. With a facility to do so, my team and I can train at all hours and have many colleges and scouts welcomed to the gym to spectate on future athletes. We can host NCAA certified events and expose all opportunities to those looking to cease them. There are far too many kids with so much potential to be great yet they lack the resources. Furthermore, in preparing athletes for competition, I look to also use the facility to shelter kids from problems they may be facing. I want it to be their great escape. A large sports facility can help bridge the gap between many who play sports for their schools, yet don't know how to obtain all the scholarship money for their athletic potential. Not many schools within the area or surrounding areas help student athletes as well. Athletes must travel out of their way to get the decent exposure that might land them in college. Therefore, I want to fill what's missing that's keeping so much talent out of school.

With the help of contributors who believe in my idea, I think this will be all very successful. My goal is to obtain 100,000 dollars to start the offer on a commercial sized building. I will then reach out to a board of angel investors to help with any other funds. Please help me create this dream so I can also help create the dream of many others. Sometimes all a person needs is a chance to prove they are worth something major. A simple investment shows how much you are willing to give someone a chance.  Share my campaign and story. Feel free to contact me via email at andrewilliamsjr00@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone! We are excited to be raising money for the Saxum Conference Centre being built in the Holy Land. Saxum provides a place where pilgrims and tour guides can fall in love with the Holy Land and explore this rich area so full of history and life. We are asking all our friends and family to be an integral part of this mission by concretely donating money for building supplies. And just think, if you were to visit Saxum, you would go with the knowledge that you contributed to making this dream a reality!! The Saxum Project affects more than just pilgrims and tourists as it contributes towards the local infrastructure and economy.  Please help us as we seek to promote unity and harmony in a substantial way. 
What We Need & What You Get
We will provide you with entertainment through our YouTube channel and you will provide the world with a conference centre!! Sounds like a pretty good deal...
  • $10.00 = 1 bag of concrete 
  • $20.00= 1 brick 
  • $50.00= 1 pallet of tiles

Risks & Challenges

You may not find our show funny (that would be awkward) but regardless of our inability, please donate. We will do our best to entertain you, please do not be stingy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate monetarily, please consider sharing the project:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Saxum.
  • Visit saxum.org for more information about the project and ways you can help! 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Mobile mentoring is a new business with massive possibilities. We are developing a series of two minute videos which we believe will enable people who download them to shift and transform their lives.

Coaching is generally unaffordable - presenting it in mobile format makes it accessible to all. Our first contract will provide access to 160 million people.

We require funding to produce our second tranche of video content.

story:
Qui nous sommes? 

Awacamenj Mino est une base de plein air à but non-lucratif qui est en opération depuis 1955 offrant aux groupes de jeunes et adultes des expériences extérieures positives dans la région d’Ottawa-Gatineau.  Notre terrain de 750 acres est géré par la Société Scogestion.  Nous accueillons des groupes scolaires, des scouts et autres organismes pour les jeunes, des équipes sportives ainsi que des évènements privés. 

Who are we? 

Awacamenj Mino is a Not for Profit camp that has been in operation since 1955 providing youth and adult groups with positive outdoor camping experiences in the Ottawa-Gatineau area.  Our 750 acre facility is managed by la Société Scogestion.  We cater to school groups, scouts and other youth organizations, sport teams as well as private functions. 

Qu’avons-nous de besoin?

Nous cherchons à recueillir une somme de 8 000$ afin de revitaliser notre piste commando.  Cette piste sera composée de douze à quinze obstacles de difficultés variées, sur terre comme dans les airs, qui permettront aux jeunes de 8 à 15 ans de vivre une expérience extérieure stimulante.  On s’amuse en se salissant. 

Tous les fonds ramassés serviront à nettoyer la piste existante, remplacer les anciennes structures avec de nouveaux filets, murs et cordes ainsi que construire de nouveaux obstacles sur un nouveau terrain. Tous montants dépassants notre objectif serviront à améliorer notre bloc sanitaire.  Considérez cela comme étant un investissement envers la protection de l’intérieur de votre voiture.

What do we need?

We are looking to raise $8000 to revitalize our Commando course.  The course is composed of twelve to fifteen obstacles of various degrees of difficulty, both on the ground and up high that allow campers ages 8 to 15 with a challenging outdoor experience.  The cleanest dirty fun you can have.

Funds raised will go toward clearing the overgrown existing course, replacing the tired old structures with new nets, walls and ropes as well as building new obstacles on a new site.  Any funds raised beyond our goal will go towards upgrading our shower facilities. Think of it as an investment in protecting your car's interior.

Impact

Chaque année, un grand nombre de jeunes ont l’occasion de visiter notre base.  Se rendre au camp l’été est aussi canadian que le sirop d’érable au déjeuner. 

  • L’estime de soi se développe en surmontant des obstacles et étant fier de nos réussites.  Une piste comme celle-ci aidera à développer l’estime de soi chez les enfants qui est nécessaire pour grandir et devenir des adultes forts et confiants dans le futur. 
  • Tous les jeunes au camp auront l’occasion de se lancer le défi de ce parcours – il est disponible pour tous sans frais additionnels.  Votre contribution permettra que ça continue. 

Impact

Every year thousands of youth enjoy our facilities.  Camp is as much a part of the Canadian summertime experience as Maple syrup is at breakfast. 

  • Self-esteem is built by overcoming obstacles and taking pride in our accomplishments.  A course like this will help in building the self-esteem kids need to thrive and become confident and strong adults in the future.
  • Every youth attending camp will have the opportunity to challenge themselves on this course – it is open to all with no additional costs to the group.  Your contribution will continue to make this possible.


Risques et défis

Nous avons plusieurs bénévoles qui donnent beaucoup de leur temps et énergie au camp dans le but de minimiser les coûts qui sont transférés aux groupes visitant le camp.  Ces bénévoles sont prêts à donner un peu plus pour ce projet en particulier mais nous savons aussi que ce projet prendra un peu de temps à compléter.

Votre contribution sera investie directement envers les équipements et matériaux nécessaires pour la construction de la piste commando et non aux coûts relatifs à la main d’œuvre. 

Risks & Challenges

We have very dedicated volunteers that give many their time and energy to the camp in order to minimise the costs that would be transferred to the groups visiting our camp.  These volunteers are ready to give extra time on this particular project but we know that it will take time to complete. 

Your contributions will go directly towards the equipment and materials needed to build the commando trail and not on labor costs. 


D’autres moyens de nous aider

Votre contribution, grande ou petite, est la bienvenue.  Aidez-nous en double en distribuant l’information de ce projet aux autres qui se souviennent de s’avoir amusé à des camps pendant l’été et voudrait faire vivre l’expérience à d’autres enfants.

·  Envoyer le courriel dans vos réseaux en demandant qu’ils considèrent notre campagne.

·  Partager la campagne sur vos réseaux sociaux

·  Souvenez-vous que nous n’avons que 60 jours.


Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions big or small are welcomed.  Help us twice as much by connecting us to others who remember the joys of summer camp and getting dirty and would like many kids create those memories as well:

  • Forward on the email to your networks asking them to consider our campaign.
  • Share our campaign on social media
  • Remember there's only 60 days!

story:
My specific neurological condition is rare, untreatable, and severe, and means I can't work. I'm trying to raise money to fund my trip to the Green Party conference to make sure my my policy on Employment and Support Allowance passes, but to ensure that the voices of financially excluded and disabled people are heard.

The Green Party has an access fund for this purpose, but the funds are so limited (up to £45 for travel and £45 for accommodation) it won't even get me to the conference venue, let alone the accommodation I need due to my disabilities! Two single train tickets to Bournemouth from Sunderland comes to £120, for example.

Any money given will be used to fund the conference trip (first travel and accommodation, then basic things like food) and anything left will be donated 50/50 to Disabled People Against Cuts and the Citizen's Advice Bureau of Sunderland.

Text of my policy motion:

Synopsis: There are over 5,000 people with chronic, frequently permanent or progressive, disabilities that are placed in the Work-Related Activity Group of ESA despite no realistic prospect of improvement. This motion calls for such people to be placed into the more appropriate Support Group.

Motion:

Insert into ROPS [Record of Policy Statements]

"Employment and Support Allowance [ESA] for long-term disabilities

There are over 5,000 people in the Work-Related Activity Group of ESA despite being assessed as "unlikely to be able to work in the longer term". These are people with chronic, often permanent or progressive, disabilities that have no realistic prospect of improving to the point they will be assessed as 'fit to work'. They are, in essence, made to prepare for work while being told they are unlikely to be able to work in the foreseeable future.

The Green Party believes that denying these people the relative safety and security found in the Support Group of ESA is cruel and pointless given that even the Work Capability Assessment also believes they will not benefit from the mandated activities of the WRAG.

The Green Party therefore calls upon the Government to allocate these people, and any future people in this situation, to the Support Group or its replacement in Universal Credit.

Conference also calls upon Greens at all levels of Government to be cognisant of this 'loophole' when dealing with constituents and offer any assistance that may be necessary to help these people, and to advocate for their inclusion in the Support Group or the equivalent group of Universal Credit."

story:
Our Story...Quick Kine...

Youth Led Multimedia - Hawaii LLC. is a multimedia production studio that focuses on mentoring teens and young adults. Founded with the Mission of "Positively influencing the youth to transform media" with the vision "To help teens / young adults realize their full potential through media" through media literacy.

the 2015 summer program group (3 boys, all from (Waimanalo) decided to create a subsidiary business to create more products with kids in their community (Waimanalo).  Which leads us to the Na Ali'i Documentary Series...

What We Need To Do This!

Our big goal is to raise $15,000 for equipment that could last us a few years.  In the long run, buying equipment will be more cost effective, and productive than renting our equipment when the suppliers have them available.  Here are our "wish list" that we will be using the money for.

Sony - Prosumer FDR-AX100 4K HD Flash Memory Camcorder - x2 - $1,699.99/each
Sony ECM-VG1 Electret Condenser Shotgun Microphone x1 - $219
Sony ECM-AW3 - Bluetooth Wireless Microphone System for Video Cameras x2  - 199/each
Microsoft Surface Pro 3 Bundle pack (SP3+SP type cover+Folio Cover+ Office 365+ Accident protection+wireless display adapter.) -  x2 - $1807.95/each
Adobe Creative Cloud Access prepaid one year - x2 - $1679.76 (a year)
Vello V-Rig 4.1" Triple shoe bracket x3 - @29.95/each
Vidpro Professional Photo & Video LED Light Kit - x2 - $144.90
The rest will be for production supplies, travel to neighbor islands (through our mokulele airlines corporate account), food/water for cast, emergency expenses, and insurance.

The Impact

FROM OUR DIRECTOR/MENTOR

These 3 boys have learned a lot this past summer.  Not just about Hawaiian History, but themselves as well.  A lot of challenges were put in front of them, but they lived out Queen Liliu'okalani's motto of "Onipa'a (be steadfast, firm, resolute).  It began as curiosity, and now has become a passion. One an actor, one director of photography, and the other an editor.  Your help will help them achieve what they discovered about themselves during this past summer. That this media production is a passion they want to continue with.   - Zane - 

Our goal with these documentary is to provide future 'opio (youth) with resources that will be readily available to through mobile media (youtube, facebook, etc...) Here's our reasons why we are doing this. 

  1. Most children born in the millennium have never known a world without internet, cell phones, or television.
  2. Before the age of six (6) most children spend about two (2) hours per day with screen media.
  3. Nearly all children have products  based on characters from TV shows, movies, or comic books.
  4. Social media, satire news shows, and digital news sources are now the preferred way to gather news/info. with this younger generation, mostly with a mobile device.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is not getting the money we need (duh).  With careful planning, we do have multiple backup plans to finish this product with whatever we are able to obtain.  Our plans also include finishing up this project with just the one camera, one microphone set-up we have now.

Other challenges we have are traveling to the different Islands to get their stories about our past ali'i.  We would like to use as little money as possible.  The biggest would be paying for flights and ground transportation. We will also save money by staying with family and friends on the various islands.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Also use the Indiegogo share tools! Super easy and super awesome to help us out!
