honesty. So I must say I cannot offer any tangible perk to people who donate to
this fundraising campaign. Since I have never received any money for helping
others, for this work that I have been doing, for the last 13 to 14 years. But
I have also given everything that a human being could possibly give into
this work for both time and money. As I believe time is everything when it
comes to helping people that are being trapped in devastating suffering. This
is why I have nothing much to offer to my friends, but many of them still have
done the best that they could do to help me over the years, by giving me moral,
instrumental, or financial support, until there is nothing more that they could
give me. For the reasons above, I hope you can forgive me for unable to offer
any tangible perk to anyone who donates. But I believe the intangible perks
that my campaign offers are still valuable. As these perks will offer
people a chance to voice their opinions and enough public opinions can
sometimes be enough to get some schools or universities to create necessary
changes to help students. So your opinion(s) might help more students
than you could imagine. 
Please note, any perk that is related to paying for an instructor to offer a
relationship science lesson or workshop to students, can only be fulfilled, if
the total donations that I receive cover the cost of creating a service for
students. 
The List of Professors that are supporting what I think that can help
lots of students
Even though my work including this
fundraising project has received no institutional support from the University
of Toronto, but a number of U of T professors have agreed to help me on their
own. Below are the professors whom I interviewed on film in connection
with my idea of bringing relationship education to high school and/or
elementary school students:
Dr. David Bruce Cook - Political Science Professor and (when he was being
interviewed by my movie) he was also the Principal of Victoria College, one of
the oldest and most highly respected colleges at U of T 
 Dr. Mary Sheila Cook  - Professor of Education, Coordinator of
the Vic Concurrent Teacher Education Program and Coordinator of Vic One Ryerson
Stream in education Victoria College, U of T 
Dr. Michel Ferrari  - Associate Professor of the Human Development and
Applied Psychology Department at the Ontario Institute for Studies in Education
(OISE), U of T
Dr. Ivan Kalmar  - Anthropologist & Associate Professor of
Anthropology at U of T
Dr. Hywel Morgan  - Professor of Psychology from North Park University 
Dr. Jordan Peterson  - Clinical Psychologist and Professor of Psychology
at U of T who was a Former Harvard Psychologist that has taught at Harvard
University for 6 years. He is also very well known for always being a guest or
going on talks on Television (TVO). 
Dr. Roman Tafarodi  - Social Psychologist and Associate Professor of
Psychology at U of T
Dr. Geoff MacDonald  - Relationship Psychologist and Associate
Professor of Psychology at U of T
Dr. John Vervaeke  - Professor for the Cognitive Science Program and
the Buddhism, Psychology and Mental Health Program at U of T
© Godwin Chan and the Indiegogo campaign Help End Loneliness at Schools and
Universities, 2015. Unauthorized use and/or duplication of this material
without express and written permission from this site’s author and/or owner is
strictly prohibited. Excerpts and links may be used, provided that full and
clear credit is given to and Godwin Chan and the Indiegogo campaign Help End
Loneliness at Schools and Universities, with appropriate and specific direction
to the original content.

story:
Hi you all!

 My name is Paola Munda, music has always been my dream and passion since I can remember. Recently I decided to go back to school and study again. 
I know, I am not the usual student that would normally ask for help to go to college. I am a 33 year old Berklee College of Music student whom has decided to follow her dream. I am not exactly a “freshman”. Before coming to Berklee in September 2014, I was already a school teacher in Italy. 

I was born and raised in Sicily, in a family full of artists. I learned to paint and sing even before I was able to write!

At 10, I started my musical life, becoming part of the children’s choir in one of the main theaters in Italy. After 8 years singing Puccini and Bizet, Mozart and Britten, I was forced to stop because something personal came up in my life and I had to leave music completely. 

I spent almost 8 years far away from the greatest passion of my life, and 5 years ago I finally found the courage to tell myself that I couldn’t live without music anymore, so I decided to study again the thing that I felt I was born to do! 

After two bachelor degrees in psychopedagogy and education, two specializations in teaching methods for children with special needs and a masters in Infantile Glottodidactics, I decided to follow my dreams and come to Berklee.

Thirsty for learning always something new, I finally started studying what I was born to do and I am trying now to find a path to bridge my interests between theatre, the stage and the classroom.

I’ve had the chance to know Joey Blake and Circle Singing; a soulful kind of music brought in the USA from Africa, thanks to Bobby McFerrin. Now I’m studying to specialize in this type of music.

I am taking a sabbatical from teaching to advance my studies at Berklee. A few months ago, I was accepted in the Artist Diploma Program!! If you would help me reach my goal; I will be able to get my Diploma next spring semester; while also exploring my songwriting abilities.

I’ve been awarded with a Scholarship, but still is not enough for me to accomplish my dream since I have been given a second chance in my life!! 

I I truly believe it’s never too late to do what you are deeply passionate about, and I believe in the power of our dreams. I hope you will consider helping and supporting me in this journey! If you are not able to, please share this request to someone who would be willing to help! 


Thank you all! 

A hug and a thankful smile! ^_^

Paola

~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - 

Ciao a tutti! 

Mi chiamo PaolaMunda e la musica è sempre stato il mio sogno e la mia passione da che mi ricordi.
Recentemente ho deciso di tornare tra i banchi di scuola e rimettermi a studiare per questo sogno.

Lo so, non sono esattamente la "solita" studentessa che normalmente potreste vedere in cerca di supporto economico per finire l'Università.
Oggi sono una studentessa della Berklee di 33 anni che ha deciso di inseguire il suo sogno.
Non sono precisamente una "matricola". 
Prima di partire per frequentare la Berklee lo scorso Settembre 2014, ero già una docente di ruolo in Italia.

Sono nata e cresciuta in Sicilia, in una famiglia piena di artisti. Ho imparato a dipingere e cantare prima ancora di sapere scrivere!

A 10 anni ho cominciato la mia vita musicale, entrando a far parte del coro dei bambini in uno dei principali teatri italiani. Dopo 8 anni trascorsi cantando Puccini e Bizet, Mozart e Britten, sono stata costretta a smettere per cause personali sopraggiunte nella mia vita e ho dovuto mollare il canto del tutto.

Sono stata 8 anni lontana dalla mia più grande passione, e finalmente 5 anni fa ho trovato il coraggio di dire a me stessa che non potevo vivere più senza musica e ho deciso di ricominciare a studiare ciò per cui sento di essere nata! :)

Dopo essermi laureata e specializzata per diventare docente di sostegno e per insegnare inglese nelle scuole, ho deciso di seguire il mio sogno piuù grande e frequentare la Berklee.

Essendo desiderosa di conoscere cose sempre nuove, finalmente ho cominciato a studiare ciò per cui sono stata creata e adesso sto cercando di costruire un ponte tra i miei interessi legati al teatro, al palcoscenico e alle classi di scuola.

Ho avuto l'opportunità di conoscere il maestro Joey Blake e il Circle Singing, un tipo di musica che esprime un'intima e profonda ricchezza di sentimenti e che grazie a Bobby McFerrin è stata portata dall'Africa, il suo paese d'origine, negli Stati Uniti.
È in questo genere che mi sto specializzando.

Ho preso un periodo di aspettativa dal mio lavoro per studiare a Berklee e qualche mese fa sono stata accettata in un prestigioso programma di studi chiamato "Artist Diploma Program"!

Se vorrete aiutarmi a raggiungere il mio obiettivo, potrò laurearmi il prossimo Maggio 2016, continuando nel frattempo ad esplorare le mie abilità di cantautrice.

Sono stata onorata con una Borsa di Studio da parte del College, ma purtroppo non è abbastanza economicamente perchè io possa portare a termine questo percorso verso il mio sogno che è la mia seconda possibilità nella mia vita!

Credo fermamente che non sia mai troppo tardi per fare ciò che ci appassiona profondamente e ancora di più credo nella forza dei nostri sogni.
Spero che considererete la possibilità di aiutarmi e supportarmi in questo viaggio!
Se non potete, vi prego di condividere con ogni mezzo che potete questa richiesta con qualcuno che potrebbe volermi aiutare!

Grazie a tutti!

Un abbraccio forte e un sorriso grato! ^_^

Paola

story:
'I LOVE TO TAKE CLEAN PHOTOS'- Me


Die Hand  | हाथ  | The Hand

Hi,

I am Ani Banerjee, 22, from India. Student of pure science. Diverting myself towards photography.  Allow me to begin by telling you the jist.

(Facebook Page- https://www.facebook.com/artwithanirban )

Back in 2003, when my father sold his favorite watch to buy me a 32 mm, 1:5.6 Canon Prima Junior DX. My granddad aka my Godfather helped me that time also. For this long 10 years, I craved for a SLR camera every moment.  I had showcased some photos of mine in two little exhibitions.

Here's one from my 'Indian Devis' Project.

Priya Tuki, Arunachal (Province)

 In 2010, I started to teach pupils in junior grades and saved money and bought a Nikon Coolpix (S8100) myself. That day was one of my happiest moments in my entire life. 

In 2014, I got graduated with a B.Sc. degree.

Published: BBC (15/09/2013)

*Why & Where* Would I Spend This Funding?

              Knowing that many grand master photographers didn't have a *degree* to carry their wish on, I started this fundraiser aka iBegging to accomplish the dream to pursue Masters in Fine Arts in Photography from CalArts or School of The Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC). I had a chance to be a part of an incentive art program arranged by *IOWA State University but I want it for a long term which ends up with the Master's. EVERY GOOD THING COMES WITH COST and education is no exception. Scholarship examination, I need help raising funds so to buy a Digital SLR, Books, Application Fees and Materials, Transportation Cots in order to complete the portfolio before even considered for scholarship

*Letter from ISU

CalArts- https://art.calarts.edu/programs/photography-and-media

SAIC- http://www.saic.edu/academics/graduatedegrees/mfas/ 

[SAIC has Grad Portfolio Day on Sunday November 8. If I get to manage a successful fundraiser, I would be avail to submit one but arts like photography doesn't come with a commercial aspect. Heart deals with camera here.] 

I have been notified by CalArts, that if I present a strong and  a decent portfolio of my shots, I would get a 75% financial award from Cal Arts Edu. This is a big thing and it's a big shot wroth trying 100 times. times. https://calarts.edu/academics/registration/finalize-aid


                Being in the US from India is like a huge growth. Say it in monetary or the landscapes or the society or the quality of life. Probably for the top of line adjustment among the other developed countries.

    Product photo shoot for Beschle, Switzerland (2012)


Now, the chance has come. I do a ton of researches by going to shop to shop before I shell the money out and I need $2500 in total for six reasons within 1 and half of a month. Time is getting passed each moment so I had to kind of expedite the things up.

Requirements and Budget Disbursement-

· 1) A DSLR body (D5500, a 24x16 sensor sized camera) - $800 + Tax in India

· 2) A Lens (A 10mm prime lens as my sensor will be a cropped one) - $550 + Tax

· 3) Study books and materials - $280 (approx & without PDF books) for Indian Subcontinent

· 4) Application fees for two Universities and one Art School - $220

· 5) Fees for TOEFL/ IELTS Tests - $260

· 6) *Travelling costs to build a decent portfolio - around $600

*I got to say one thing here. I have  managed to loan of $540 for the total investments. Hope that I WOULD BE ABLE TO RAISE THE MONEY as I KEPT THE AMOUNT pretty minimal.

**This is the part may seem dubious but believe me, India isn't that cheap anymore. Especially for an Indian. A photo can come out from my own home but being out opens a broad aspect. Chasm of nature.

***Alternative Way** - Camera and lenses are expensive in India for it's taxation and red tape problems. If a well wisher thinks of other ways, it would be GLADLY APPRECIATED.

LinkedIn - https://in.linkedin.com/in/inthechannel 


           A 3D Logo (Company name : Incubator)

Myself with Savitri Devi, in Darjeeling, India ( An excursion arranged by college authority)

The Goal?

A camera and a lens are enough to capture what you love. Heart and eyes tell the last things. People can get skeptical sometimes but as I Ani Banerjee, a human, saying that I would never betray your trust. I sure blabbered a lot but I have let myself know! After the fund gets raised, I will personally thank EACH ONE and friendship for life. Almost forgot, I am thanking astronomer Scott W. Roberts for supporting me from the very beginning. A great enthusiasm giver he is. My other two teacher Ratna Roy and Supriyo Ghosh. Not to mention Pink Floyd's High Hopes and Gilmour's Pedal steel guitar. 


All photographs are shot by Nikon S8100.

Sharing is caring

(Contact for any further queries-tototalfreaked@gmail.com)

story:
Be Confident, Organised, Eloquent
When You Speak In Public

Learn how to control nerves, organise your information, choose the correct words, and keep your audience interested during your public presentations! This audio guide will teach you how to be a confident and competent public speaker!

This project is a result of the many people who have seen me speak across the world asking "Where did you learn to speak like that?" The answer is that it took me 25 years of research, work and practical experience. I have assisted hundreds of people on their public speaking journey, and now is the time to make this knowledge available to a wider audience so that you too can benefit.

Public speaking is easier than you think if you know the correct techniques. I will teach you that public speaking is something that should be enjoyed and not feared. I will share my 2.5 decades of public speaking experience in 2.5 hours.

Photo: Speaking at Nordic Travel Market, Helsinki. Courtesy of Andrew Chow (@IdeasAndrew)

This is an audio guide with ten lessons. I chose an audio guide because there are some public speaking concepts that are very difficult (if not impossible) to explain in writing - especially vocal variety.

Much of the work is complete!

With the early written drafts and recordings already concluded, editing is currently underway to best present the ten lessons that cover writing, rehearsal and delivery of an effective presentation.

The ten topic areas are covered below, though the titles may change slightly.

Lesson One: Nerves Are Your Friend
Lesson Two: Know Your Audience
Lesson Three: A Strong Structure
Lesson Four: Memorable Speech Writing
Lesson Five: The Power of Stories
Lesson Six: Evoking Emotions In Your Audience
Lesson Seven: How to Keep Your Audience Interested
Lesson Eight: Being at Home on Stage
Lesson Nine: Correct Use of Visual Aids
Lesson Ten: Handling Questions With Ease

These lessons vary in length depending on the information and their importance.

Photo: Test recording to check for sound levels.

Why Should You Support This Project?

The cost of getting an audio book or audio guide professionally recorded and distributed are prohibitively high. Unlike selling a book or eBook, one must use a company with audio book experience to obtain a strong distribution network. I don't have the funds, but I have the voice and experience to record and distribute this product myself.Public speaking is a task we all have to perform at some point in our lives. You too can become a confident, competent public speaker by learning the correct techniques. This campaign will allow the guide to be produced and promoted so that this important knowledge can be available to a wide audience.

You can make the task of producing this audio guide easier for me, as the money raised will provide a new computer in order to easily edit the sound files. My current computer is hopelessly inadequate. Extra funds will go to other promotional costs, and the already purchased professional audio recorder (as seen in the above photograph).

By supporting this project at this time, you will obtain a great discount and have access to extras that will never be made available again.

Delivery Period

In March 2016, this public speaking audio guide will be available to you via download. If you request a copy on a USB, this can be provided for an extra fee to cover costs of the device and postage.

Testimonials

"I once asked a speaking champion about a coach to help me make my speech a winning speech, so Shane Dallas’ name came up. Shane, I’m really grateful to you for helping me become a professional speaker. I speak to public and corporates, and this year I became a speaking champion. I call you 'The Champions’ Coach'"
Ali Alfarai - Professional Speaker - http://www.johncmaxwellgroup.com/alialfarai

"Shane Dallas is a skillfull storyteller, superb communicator, and fantastic photographer to boot. Learning how to use simple words to creatively elevate a phrase is just one of dozens of lessons I've learned from Shane. I've learned so much more about public speaking in a single session with him than I've learned in all my years giving talks at conferences."
Lola Akinmade Åkerström - Award Winning Travel Writer and Photographer  - http://www.lolaakinmade.com/

"I had the privilege of watching Shane performing his fantastic speeches twice and I can assure you he is the owner of some of the most inspiring words on earth. When I saw him doing public speaking training, I felt so confident about myself. And I'm not talking about public speaking only, but also to chase my goals. I wish the world would have more people like Shane Dallas to get more and more people seeking their dreams!"
Andre Motta - Travel Blogger - http://www.viagemcriativa.com.br/

"During the many years in which I was fortunate to have Shane as my mentor in Toastmasters International, I found him to be motivating and always supportive in his role to improve me as a public speaker. He is an engaging and inspiring speaker who draws on his vast life experience to engage his audience and teach others about the importance of effective communication. Shane’s enthusiasm and passion for teaching speakers of all abilities is his greatest asset and I thank him for his guidance and education."
Leonard Scuderi - Distinguished Toastmaster (DTM)

Here Are The Skills You Can Learn

This is a presentation entitled "Once Upon A Time" that I delivered at Malaysia Social Media Week in February 2014. You need not follow this style, you will have your own, but all the techniques employed here are taught on the audio guide.


If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, please share it with others on Social Media. Any support or mentions you can give is greatly appreciated :-)
story_txt: Be Confident, Organised, EloquentWhen You Speak In PublicLearn how to control nerves, organise your information, choose the correct words, and keep your audience interested during your public presentations! This audio guide will teach you how to be a confident and competent public speaker!This project is a result of the many people who have seen me speak across the world asking "Where did you learn to speak like that?" The answer is that it took me 25 years of research, work and practical experience. I have assisted hundreds of people on their public speaking journey, and now is the time to make this knowledge available to a wider audience so that you too can benefit.Public speaking is easier than you think if you know the correct techniques. I will teach you that public speaking is something that should be enjoyed and not feared. I will share my 2.5 decades of public speaking experience in 2.5 hours.Photo: Speaking at Nordic Travel Market, Helsinki. Courtesy of Andrew Chow (@IdeasAndrew)This is an audio guide with ten lessons. I chose an audio guide because there are some public speaking concepts that are very difficult (if not impossible) to explain in writing - especially vocal variety.Much of the work is complete!With the early written drafts and recordings already concluded, editing is currently underway to best present the ten lessons that cover writing, rehearsal and delivery of an effective presentation.The ten topic areas are covered below, though the titles may change slightly.Lesson One: Nerves Are Your FriendLesson Two: Know Your AudienceLesson Three: A Strong StructureLesson Four: Memorable Speech WritingLesson Five: The Power of StoriesLesson Six: Evoking Emotions In Your AudienceLesson Seven: How to Keep Your Audience InterestedLesson Eight: Being at Home on StageLesson Nine: Correct Use of Visual AidsLesson Ten: Handling Questions With EaseThese lessons vary in length depending on the information and their importance.Photo: Test recording to check for sound levels.Why Should You Support This Project?The cost of getting an audio book or audio guide professionally recorded and distributed are prohibitively high. Unlike selling a book or eBook, one must use a company with audio book experience to obtain a strong distribution network. I don't have the funds, but I have the voice and experience to record and distribute this product myself.Public speaking is a task we all have to perform at some point in our lives. You too can become a confident, competent public speaker by learning the correct techniques. This campaign will allow the guide to be produced and promoted so that this important knowledge can be available to a wide audience.You can make the task of producing this audio guide easier for me, as the money raised will provide a new computer in order to easily edit the sound files. My current computer is hopelessly inadequate. Extra funds will go to other promotional costs, and the already purchased professional audio recorder (as seen in the above photograph).By supporting this project at this time, you will obtain a great discount and have access to extras that will never be made available again.Delivery PeriodIn March 2016, this public speaking audio guide will be available to you via download. If you request a copy on a USB, this can be provided for an extra fee to cover costs of the device and postage.Testimonials"I once asked a speaking champion about a coach to help me make my speech a winning speech, so Shane Dallas’ name came up. Shane, I’m really grateful to you for helping me become a professional speaker. I speak to public and corporates, and this year I became a speaking champion. I call you 'The Champions’ Coach'"Ali Alfarai - Professional Speaker - http://www.johncmaxwellgroup.com/alialfarai"Shane Dallas is a skillfull storyteller, superb communicator, and fantastic photographer to boot. Learning how to use simple words to creatively elevate a phrase is just one of dozens of lessons I've learned from Shane. I've learned so much more about public speaking in a single session with him than I've learned in all my years giving talks at conferences."Lola Akinmade Åkerström - Award Winning Travel Writer and Photographer  - http://www.lolaakinmade.com/"I had the privilege of watching Shane performing his fantastic speeches twice and I can assure you he is the owner of some of the most inspiring words on earth. When I saw him doing public speaking training, I felt so confident about myself. And I'm not talking about public speaking only, but also to chase my goals. I wish the world would have more people like Shane Dallas to get more and more people seeking their dreams!"Andre Motta - Travel Blogger - http://www.viagemcriativa.com.br/"During the many years in which I was fortunate to have Shane as my mentor in Toastmasters International, I found him to be motivating and always supportive in his role to improve me as a public speaker. He is an engaging and inspiring speaker who draws on his vast life experience to engage his audience and teach others about the importance of effective communication. Shane’s enthusiasm and passion for teaching speakers of all abilities is his greatest asset and I thank him for his guidance and education."Leonard Scuderi - Distinguished Toastmaster (DTM)Here Are The Skills You Can LearnThis is a presentation entitled "Once Upon A Time" that I delivered at Malaysia Social Media Week in February 2014. You need not follow this style, you will have your own, but all the techniques employed here are taught on the audio guide.If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, please share it with others on Social Media. Any support or mentions you can give is greatly appreciated :-)

story:
Books are printed and read for you! Visit  http://babybare.net for more information and to get yours! 

 

 

 

Hello, I'm Stephanie Johnson and I'm the founder of Baby Bare: A bottom up approach to building strong brains and bodies. Baby Bare was inspired by the parents of the children I treat in my private practice in Minneapolis. The clients I see are struggling with attention and learning challenges often accompanied by anxiety and/or depression. The treatment model I use is a developmental movement modality that focuses on the development of the nervous system between the ages of 0-18 months. I assess what movement stages may have been incomplete or skipped altogether and then revisit those stages with clients to reorganize their brains and bodies to reduce symptoms and help them do their best in school. Through the years I've heard so many parents say to me "I wish I would have known this when my child was a baby!" 

And so, Baby Bare was born! I began teaching classes to parents and teachers about the important role early movement has on brain development and realized there was a real need and desire for this information. 

Baby Bare offers materials for everyone blessed with the important role of caring for babies: Parents, daycare providers and early educators.

1. For parents I have written an accessible book that reveals the stages of development and their bridges to later learning. I have partnered with Megan Pate Photography to capture each stage beautifully and the book is full of imagery, simple theory and easy tips to help babies do their important work! Author and child development expert Carla Hannford says of the book, 

        "Stephanie, with her bottom up approach, has elegantly presented current research from developmental experts on what assures whole brain development and learning success throughout life, starting from the very beginning."

2. For daycare providers I have created a certificate program that trains daycare providers on how to best facilitate optimal brain development in their setting. So often when I work with new parents they worry they will not be able to find childcare that offers a bottom up experience for their baby. Since most American babies are cared for by daycare providers or nannies, it is important for families to have a resource in which to find care providers that understand the role of unrestricted movement in brain development. Certified providers will become part of our database directory so new parents can easily find Baby Bare Certified care for their babies. 

3. For early education teachers, advocates, administrators I have created curriculum kits that give educators everything needed to share our bottom up approach with the families they serve. After doing staff trainings for educators I often get stopped by teachers wanting to know where they can get my photos or brain model that I use to teach the concepts. It became very clear that teachers need more than a 2-hour introduction to this work; they want to feel confident in teaching it to the families they serve. The curriculum kits come with everything they need to do just that!

I am lucky to have the support of Wise Ink Publishing during this process! To learn more about Wise Ink click here.

For more information about Stephanie click here!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to start a movement, and we need information to be in the hands of parents, teachers and daycare providers in order to to that. Our combined funding goal is $68,500.
Publishing costs: $26,500
Creative costs (design/photography): $15,500
Writing support (editing/technical writer/translation): $9,300
Marketing and PR: $12,500
Indiegogo fees/perks: $4,700
 
Our perks will bring a smile to your face and get the word out about the Baby Bare movement! They range from cute items for baby, to getting books into the hands of teenage moms, to training and certifying daycare providers. We have something special to thank every level of donor. 
If we don't reach our funding goal, we will revise the launching strategy and use the funds we've raised to launch each category separately. First we will publish the book for parents, Baby Bare: A bottom up approach to building strong brains and bodies, followed by the Baby Bare Certificate Program for daycare providers, and third, the Baby Bare Curriculum Kits for educators as funds allow. However, we feel strongly that launching all three components at once is the best way to really make an impact in the lives of babies who are being cared for by a community of loved ones. We want everyone in the community on board with this movement! Please help us reach our goal by donating and sharing, sharing, and sharing some more! 
The risks that Baby Bare faces
One risk we face as a grassroots movement is our voice not getting heard in a climate where parents are being bombarded by all the things they need to do and buy to be a good parent. We have partnered with experts in the field that support our movement and are willing to use their platform to share what they agree is a very important and missing piece of our collective understanding of child development. Our three-part market of parents, educators and daycare providers was designed especially to make a broad impact and create a community of "bottom uppers" so parents are not navigating this new approach on their own but rather have a community of educators and care providers who are learning alongside of them and can support their efforts as parents to provide a bottom up childhood for their babies! 

Sharing is key

We understand that donating at this time is not possible for everyone. If you are interested in helping the movement please take a moment and share the campaign with your community. We need to drum up some noise for this cause and sharing is as important as donating, so please do what you can! Use the Indiegogo share tools to help you!

story: Nuevo Amanecer Latino Children's Services (NALCS) understands that foster youth need the proper tools and resources in order to go on to live successful lives after foster care. Since 2009, and independent from DCFS, NALCS has been providing its youth with Independent Living  Life Skill training's. NALCS ILP training's cover the following components: College 101, Financial Aid ,Housing, Money Management, Employment, Gang Awareness, STI Prevention and Safe Sex, Drug Awareness, and other available resource for eligible ILP youth. ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTABLE.

story:
When the first black residents of South Florida arrived in the 1880s from the Bahamas to work at the Peacock Inn on Biscayne Bay, they established West Coconut Grove, Florida. By the early 1900s the neighborhood was thriving.  Today, due to many years of decline and lack of investment, our beloved community is in disrepair and the residents, including our youth are struggling as re-gentrification looms.   

We have a strong desire to cultivate the whole child. Thus, as Educators born and reared in West Coconut Grove (Florida), we submit this campaign on behalf of The  Striving To Attain Remarkable Teens Program (The START Program). We are passionate about helping to cultivate the youth of our community, As adolescents, six of the seven facilitators were provided with the opportunity to participate in a youth servicing program geared towards college readiness.  Due to this experience, we have recognized the importance to instill, expose, and further develop an understanding of the following within our youth:

-Character Building
-College Readiness
-Community Service
-Continual Knowledge
-Environmental Responsibilities
-Financial Literacy 
-Goal Attainment
-Health & Fitness
-Independence
-Inter-dependency
-Networking
-Time-management

We understand as part of our efforts to create an initiative that best supports the youth of the community in which we serve, we seek to extend our services to include a START Lab. The START Lab is our “Community Resource Initiative” in which we have strategically planned to offer the disadvantaged youth of the community with opportunities to learn & access technology that drastically reduce the achievement gap crisis. Our facility will be outfitted with a plethora of technology daily, which would help aid in the effort to foster academic growth among the youth in the area. This is in direct relation to Miami-Dade County Public Schools Digital Convergence Plan: An initiative "to close the digital divide...[this] transformation will not only provide greater digital content in mobile technologies, but will help create a new culture of learning by promoting blended learning environments & increasing 21st century learning opportunities." In addition, it "will aid in developing independent, self-initiated learners; provide for collaboration & communication between students & teachers; and extend student learning beyond the classroom."

What We Need & What You Get
According to a recent study, only 56% of residents owned a computer, 28% owned a printer and 51% of these residents had access to the internet (Village West Community Needs Assessment Survey Responses, 2013). Of the households surveyed, approximately 37% of the parents are unemployed or underemployed.  Often times, parents are unable to provide the proper resources in order to properly nourish and meet their child’s academic needs. 

We wish to provide our Community Resource Initiative with approximately 40 laptops/tablets, 2 desktops, 2 color printers/scanners, 1 SMART television, and 1 Promethean/SMART Board among a number of miscellaneous items required to assist in the effective function of this initiative. This will help aid in the effort to offer support to those students who do not have access to technology, thus increasing their prospects of bettering their grades in school. Our site has two State Certified Instructors certified in Exceptional Student Education, Mathematics, Accounting, Reading K12 and Middle Grades English Language Arts and one county certified instructor who specializes in Reading Intervention.  
In order to secure the aforementioned items, we submit the following budget:

                 

                                          Estimated Project Budget 2016*

*In the event that we do not reach our entire goal, the funds received will be applied to our list of needs and we will continue to seek funding.  Emphasis will be placed on purchasing as many materials from each line item as contributions will support.

**These items include but are not limited to paper, ink cartridges, and other miscellaneous items as needed.                                  

Proposed Timeline

August - September  2016

- Focus - Purchase Supplies, Setup and Schedule 

September 2016

-Focus - Community Kickoff Event
October 2016

-Focus - Gathering Local School and Universities Support and Commitment to assist 
November 2016

-Focus - Pay It Forward activities and events
December 2016 

-Focus - Cyber Bullying Awareness. 
January 2017

-Focus - Cyber Safety

February 2017

-Focus - Research and Writing.

March 2017

-Focus-Presentations.

April 2017

-Focus- Applying for colleges and grants.

May 2017

-Focus- Global Communication.

June 2017

-Focus - Global Interaction.

Measurement Tools

-Community Meetings
-Daily Learning Journals
-Monthly Teacher Progress Reports
-Needs Survey (Pre & Post Assessment) 
-Parent Survey
-Student Survey

A brief background of our organization

The START Program. Established August 2014, we are a nonprofit organization who strives to provide a safe, structured afterschool learning environment where students can develop the character and academic skills necessary for lifelong success. We offer a plethora of diverse services to the community which includes, (1) Writing Assistance for High School and College Students (2) Health & Fitness Workshops and Training and (3) Assistance with College Preparation. We work with select students each week who demonstrate the need for diversification in the academic, social, and health and fitness process. We wish to cultivate the whole child. We have identified 3 criterions in which to provide support: [1] Environmental Responsibilities: Self & Community [2] Goal Attainment: Workforce Preparation & Career Development [3] Health & Fitness: Mind & Body. 

Each month, we have provided our participants with the opportunity to experience a cultural, academic, or creative field trip:

-Art Basel
-Breast Cancer Walk
-Close-Up Program (Visited Washington D.C. Museums and Memorials)
-College Tour
  -George Washington University
  -Howard University
-Literacy Movement (Reading to children between the ages of 2 & 10 in the Overtown community)
-Provided a Fit Kids day to the community in collaboration with a former City of Miami District 2 Commissioner
-Restoration of a Neighborhood Butterfly Garden

story:
Perhaps nothing is more important for you children's education than good communication between parents and teachers.

Our hectic lifestyles make good communication between school and home a real challenge. That's where we come in.

We are CLASS CHALK, a company dedicated to improving the school experience and getting the most out of parent-teacher communication.

Our mission is to enhance the educational experience and provide a means to increase parental involvement and participation.

Because the smartphone and the computer are the most effective ways to communicate these days, our goal here at Class Chalk is to develop a user-friendly app through which teachers, students and parents can safely and easily communicate.

For example, teachers can use our app to notify parents and students of important dates, homework assignments and much more.

Teachers will also have the option to send personal messages to parents regarding their students' behavior and classroom achievements.

Parents can use the app to get answers from teachers regarding upcoming school events or to relay any concerns they may have regarding their children.

Moms and Dads will be notified on their phones when a teacher sends a new message, a date     has been added to the class calendar or when their child's behavior has been logged for the day.


Imagine a school with nearly 100% parental involvement Sounds great, huh?


 Now imagine how you can help us…


Here's the pitch: We need to raise 65-thousand dollars to pay for the technical work, design work,

server costs, along with customer service and general business fees.

With their combined fourteen years of teaching proficiency, Shannon and Rebecca know that open communication between school and home can play a vital role in student success. Chalk it up to experience. They're ready to roll up their sleeves and get to work.

 

As contributors, you would be helping create a revolutionary application that could give parents, teachers and students a common area to collaborate, share and interact with ease and enjoyment.

 

Be a part of something wonderful, something important. Please send your contributions to CLASS CHALK @ Indiegogo.com

 

 

And thank you for your time!
story_txt: Perhaps nothing is more important for you children's education than good communication between parents and teachers.Our hectic lifestyles make good communication between school and home a real challenge. That's where we come in.We are CLASS CHALK, a company dedicated to improving the school experience and getting the most out of parent-teacher communication.Our mission is to enhance the educational experience and provide a means to increase parental involvement and participation.Because the smartphone and the computer are the most effective ways to communicate these days, our goal here at Class Chalk is to develop a user-friendly app through which teachers, students and parents can safely and easily communicate.For example, teachers can use our app to notify parents and students of important dates, homework assignments and much more.Teachers will also have the option to send personal messages to parents regarding their students' behavior and classroom achievements.Parents can use the app to get answers from teachers regarding upcoming school events or to relay any concerns they may have regarding their children.Moms and Dads will be notified on their phones when a teacher sends a new message, a date     has been added to the class calendar or when their child's behavior has been logged for the day.Imagine a school with nearly 100% parental involvement Sounds great, huh? Now imagine how you can help us…Here's the pitch: We need to raise 65-thousand dollars to pay for the technical work, design work,server costs, along with customer service and general business fees.With their combined fourteen years of teaching proficiency, Shannon and Rebecca know that open communication between school and home can play a vital role in student success. Chalk it up to experience. They're ready to roll up their sleeves and get to work. As contributors, you would be helping create a revolutionary application that could give parents, teachers and students a common area to collaborate, share and interact with ease and enjoyment. Be a part of something wonderful, something important. Please send your contributions to CLASS CHALK @ Indiegogo.com  And thank you for your time!

story:
FATCUT UPCYCLING is a collaborative network of more than 20 persons that experiments, creates and trash-forms seemingly useless objects (garbage) in order to give them greater sustainability and re-purpose them into useful products and educational toys (upcycling*). It is also a laboratory workshop of ideas and know-how freely available to everyone, giving solutions to everyday needs.


Cardboard, newspapers, plastic bags, pallets, soda caps, damaged water heaters and other “garbage”...everything is being processed in order to postpone its arrival to the dump or junkyard and to increase its span of life. It is a way to minimize the already oversized mass of garbage and reduce the energy cost of consumption. It is an alternative to the traditional recycling of materials, which is not CO2 efficient and which involves the huge cost of blue bins and the lack of state management.

FatCut UPCYCLING was founded 5 years ago.

  • During these years we have set up "CADO PARADISO" (Trashcan Paradise), the first upcycled playground in Athens (Greece), where we are currently based
  • We have published the #1 issue of "The TRASHFORMERS" comic series in order to pass the message of upcycling through the visual culture of comics. We are currently illustrating the #2 issue to be published in April 2016.
  • We have participated in upcycling exhibitions, touring the Mediterranean Sea with an upcycled sailing boat "MYSTIC BLUE" EcoSailing & Diving.
  • We are organizing several Upcycling Workshops to educate people of all ages how to build ecological stoves out of used heaters, how to make glasses out of beer bottles and educational toys out of plastic cups etc.

WHAT IS UPCYCLING?

The main idea of upcycling is to reuse discarded materials and make them useful again and give them a new identity and ecological value. As a consequence, upcycling helps to reduce the consumption of new raw materials in order to manufacture new products. To reduce consumption leads to a reduction of the required energy wasted for their construction. By upcycling, we minimize the contamination of air, groundwater and the emissions of greenhouse gases.

  • Downcycling refers to processing materials and products into new materials of inferior quality.
  • Upcycling on the contrary, uses the entire product, in order to either make it useful again or give it a new identity and value.

OUR UPCYCLED PLAYGROUND

Our space 'CADO PARADISO' ('Trashcan Paradise') is dedicated to play-based learning. It has been constructed entirely DIT (do-it-together) by our team and is based in a 240 m2 old factory in Athens, Greece.

It’s 90% UPCYCLED. Flying automatic dragons, castles and trampolines made from tires, huge plastic bottle puzzles, PVC tube slides, trash-formed bicycle games, optical toys and marble run walls are, among others, the scenery that aims to trigger the fantasy of the visitor. A series of workshops including DIY toys, arts & crafts for children, geography, physics, biology games are introduced to the kids while and through playing.

The play and therefore the child are not spared from the collective fantasy of perpetual growth, where 'space-time' for free creative happiness does not fit in nor is part of one’s daily busy schedule. One’s career starts early enough so as to ensure, more and more, the lack of imagination in the game and later in life.

Although the industrialization of the 'play' and the 'lamination' of toys is something relatively recent, the times when children had their time and space to create their own games, seems something distant, long gone and forgotten. We want to break contemporary parents' motto: 'I don’t have time, you don’t have time, let’s buy it'. We aim to introduce an educational space-time that will cultivate solidarity, respect towards diversity, participation in decision making and autonomy. The joy of learning cannot be scored!


OUR WORKSHOPS SPACE

One floor above our upcycled playground we have set up FatCut Upcycling workshops space. It is here that we construct the toys for our playground and where our Upcycling workshops are taking place every week. For the time being, it is equipped with:
  • a carpenter's room for re-purposing wood to toys and wooden constructions
  • tools for upcycling metal scrap
  • tools for upcycling bottles into glass products
  • 2 sewing machines for the making of dolls for kids
  • a metal press to upcycle waste paper into briquettes
  • storage tubes for plastic & paper
  • warehouse to store collected items

HOW CAN YOU SUPPORT?

FatCut UPCYCLING members belong to vulnerable social groups (unemployed persons, immigrants, single parents). Our collective gives our members the possibility to have decent working conditions. In general, it is a non-budget effort. Therefore, by supporting our effort you help us to:

1. Sustain our Playground & Workshops Space
- basic operational expenses of the space (rent, bills)
- maintenance expenses (paint, flowers and plants, papers & markers)
- fees & legal services for our cooperative (lawyer, accountant etc)

2. Buy Equipment
- Basic tools & work suits for our upcycling workshops

3. Develop a Website, Social Media & Promo Material
- Design of a website / e-shop, etsy shop and printing of brochures & posters

4. Buy a Transport Vehicle
- A small van or tricycle for collecting & transporting items from the street

5. Organize Events
- Educational events for children & grown-ups that promote the idea of upcycling

6. Enhance our payment
- All members of our collective are working under the same working hour fee. Our monthly salaries are currently depending on the income of the upcycled playground. The income is evenly divided to our members, depending on their work hours. However our monthly income is still very limited and we have to work a lot without payment. In order to be able to perform and create better products and ideas we need your support...

Dear Friends,
We invite you to support our efforts, so we can reclaim the space-times of freedom and fantasy for the children! By supporting us you also support the need for a creative, out-of-the-box education! Remember, you are our only communication sponsors, so please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Spread the news as smoke-signs, to everybody interested, as everyone is valuable.

Sincerely,
FatCut Upcycling
Sotiris, Noha, Takis, Vivi, Dimitris, Nikos, Kostas, Kyriakos, Roxani, Eleni, Katerina, Vani, Victor, Stella, Eimen, Mihalis, Mashinisa, Irene, Myrto, Aggeliki...

Athens, February 2016

LINKS
FatCut Upcycling
Cado Paradiso Upcycled Playground
Trashformers
Mystic Blue


Η FATCUT UPCYCLING είναι ένα συμμετοχικό δίκτυο άνω των 20 ατόμων με νομική μορφή κοινωνικής συνεταιριστικής επιχείρησης (ΚΟΙΝ.Σ.ΕΠ.). Πειραματίζεται, δημιουργεί και μεταποιεί μέσω της άμεσης ανακύκλωσης (upcycling*) φαινομενικά άχρηστα αντικείμενα, προκειμένου να τους προσδώσει μεγαλύτερη βιωσιμότητα και να τα μετατρέψει σε χρηστικά προϊόντα ή εκπαιδευτικά παιχνίδια. Παράλληλα, η ομάδα είναι ένα ανοιχτό εργαστήριο ιδεών και τεχνογνωσίας που διατίθεται ελεύθερα στον καθένα, δίνοντας λύση σε καθημερινές ανάγκες.

Χαρτοκούτες, εφημερίδες, πλαστικές σακούλες, παλέτες, καπάκια, πόρτες και παράθυρα, μικροσκόπια εώς θερμοσίφωνες και άλλα «σκουπίδια», μετά από επεξεργασία, αναβάλλουν το ραντεβού τους με τη χωματερή και αυξάνουν το μέσο όρο ζωής τους. Είναι ενας τρόπος ελαχιστοποίησης του ήδη υπερμεγέθη όγκου σκουπιδιών και μειώσης του ενεργειακού κόστους της κατανάλωσης. Είναι μια εναλλακτική στην παραδοσιακή ανακύκλωση η οποία  δεν έχει επιτύχει να αποδεσμευτεί από τις εκπομπές διοξειδίου του άνθρακα και περιλαμβάνει το τεράστιο κόστος κατασκευής των μπλέ κάδων καθώς και την ανεπάρκεια της κρατικής διαχείρισης.

Η FatCut Upcycling δημιουργήθηκε πριν 5 χρόνια.

  • Μέσα σ' αυτά τα χρόνια λειτουργίας έχουμε κατασκευάσει το "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" τον πρώτο ανακυκλωμένο χώρο εργαστηρίων για μικρούς και μεγάλους στην Αθήνα, όπου και βρισκόμαστε σήμερα.
  • Έχουμε εκδόσει το #1 τεύχος του κόμικ "TRASHFORMERS" για να περάσουμε το μήνυμα της άμεσης ανακύκλωσης μέσω της οπτικής γλώσσας των κόμικ. Αυτή τη στιγμή προετοιμάζουμε την έκδοση του 2ου τεύχους για τον Απρίλιο του 2016.
  • Έχουμε συμμετάσχει και πραγματοποιήσει εκθέσεις, εκδηλώσεις και περιοδείες σε Ελλάδα, Ιταλία και Γαλλία, με όχημα ενα upcycled ιστιοφόρο, το Mystic Blue Eco-Sailing.
  • Έχουμε πραγματοποιήσει εργαστήρια τεχνογνωσίας (workshops) για την επανοικειοποίηση πρώτων υλών που πετιούνται. Στα εργαστήρια αυτά ασχοληθήκαμε με τη κατασκευή οικολογικών σομπών, ποτηριών, πρεσών για μπρικέτες και εκπαιδευτικών παιχνιδιών μεταξύ πολλών άλλων.


ΤΙ ΕΙΝΑΙ ΤΟ UPCYCLING?

Η κυρίαρχη ιδέα του upcycling είναι η επανάχρηση πεταμένων υλικών ώστε να ξαναγίνουν χρήσιμα και να αποκτήσουν μια νέα ταυτότητα και οικολογική αξία. Σα συνέπεια, το upcycling βοηθάει στην μείωση της κατανάλωσης νέων πρώτων υλών και στη μείωση της απαιτούμενης ενέργειας που σπαταλιέται  για την κατασκευή νέων προϊόντων. H άμεση ανακύκλωση είναι ένας καλός τρόπος να βοηθήσουμε την ελαχιστοποίηση της ατμοσφαιρικής μόλυνσης, της μόλυνσης των υδάτων και των εκπομπών του θερμοκηπίου.


  • Το Downcycling είναι η συμβατική ανακύκλωση, δηλαδή η διαδικασία μεταποίησης υλών και προϊόντων σε νέα υλικά κατώτερης ποιότητας, αυξάνοντας ταυτόχρονα τις εργοστασιακές εκπομπες διοξειδίου του άνθρακα (CO2) στην ατμόσφαιρα.
  • Το Upcycling, αντίθετα, χρησιμοποιεί εξ'ολοκλήρου το προϊόν, είτε καθιστώντας το εκ νέου χρήσιμο, είτε προσδίδοντάς του νέα ιδιότητα και αξία, μειώνοντας το ενεργειακό κόστος και τις εκπομπές ρύπων και αυξάνοντας την εφευρετικότητα και τη δημιουργικότητα του ανθρώπου.

 ΤΟ ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ

Ο χώρος μας ονομάζεται "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" και είναι αφιερωμένος στη μάθηση μέσω του παιχνιδιού. Κατασκευάστηκε αποκλειστικά από μέλη της ομάδας μας σε μια διαδικασία D.I.T (do-it-together). Πρόκειται για έναν χώρο 240τ.μ., στην οδό Εριγόνης 3, στα Κάτω Πετράλωνα της Αθήνας, που φιλοξενεί παιδιά όλων των ηλικιών, προκειμένου να παίξουν, να απασχοληθούν δημιουργικά και να εκπαιδευτούν σε τεχνικές κατασκευής upcycled παιχνιδιών και χρηστικών αντικειμένων.

Ο παιχνιδοχώρος "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" είναι κατα 90% κατασκευασμένος από ανακυκλωμένα υλικά. Ιπτάμενοι δράκοι, τεράστια πάζλ από πλαστικά μπουκάλια, μεταποιημένα παιχνίδια με ποδήλατα, μουσικά παιχνίδια και τσουλήθρες απο σωλήνες pvc, κάστρα και τραμπολίνο απο ρόδες αυτοκινήτων και πολλά άλλα θα συνθέσουν μια φαντασμαγορία για τις 5 αισθήσεις παιδιών και μεγάλων. Στον χώρο λαμβάνουν μέρος μια σειρά εργαστηρίων δημιουργικής απασχόλησης όπου η γνώση θα προκύπτει πάντα μέσα απο την χαρά του παιχνιδιού. Τα εργαστήρια περιλαμβάνουν κατασκευές παιχνιδιών, κουκλοθέατρο, μουσική, εικαστικά, χοροθέατρο, φυσική, βιολογία, γεωγραφία, βοτανολογία, πολιτική αγωγή.

Το παιχνίδι και συνεπώς το παιδί δε γλίτωσαν απ' τη συλλογική φαντασίωση της αέναης ανάπτυξης, όπου ο χωρο-χρόνος της ελεύθερης δημιουργικής ευτυχίας δε χωράει, ούτε είναι μέρος του καθημερινού ασφυκτικού προγράμματος. Η "καριέρα" ξεκινάει νωρίς ώστε να εξασφαλίζεται η ολοένα και περισσότερη απουσία φαντασίας στο παιχνίδι και μετέπειτα στη ζωή.

Παρόλο που η «πλαστικοποίηση» και η εκβιομηχάνιση του παιχνιδιού είναι κάτι σχετικά πρόσφατο, η περίοδος όπου τα παιδιά είχαν το χωρο-χρόνο τους για να δημιουργούν τα παιχνίδια τους, φαίνεται κομμάτι κάποιου απροσδιόριστου μακρινού παρελθόντος. Θελουμε να "σπάσουμε" τη λογική "δεν προλαβαίνω, δεν προλαβαίνεις, ας το αγοράσουμε...". Θέλουμε να αναβιώσουμε εναν χώρο εκπαίδευσης που θα καλλιεργεί την αλληλεγγύη, τον σεβασμό στη διαφορετικότητα, την οικονομία με την πρωταρχική της σημασία, τη συμμετοχή και την αυτονομία. Η χαρά για τη γνώση δεν βαθμολογείται!


Ο ΧΩΡΟΣ ΕΡΓΑΣΤΗΡΙΩΝ UPCYCLING

Στον 1ο όροφο πάνω από το ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ εγκαταστήσαμε το χώρο εργαστηρίων μας. Εδώ κατασκευάζουμε τα παιχνίδια του παιχνιδοχώρου και οργανώνουμε σε εβδομαδιαία βάση τα εργαστήρια upcycling για ενήλικες. Ο χώρος είναι εξοπλισμένος με:
  • ξυλουργείο για τη μεταποίηση ξυλείας σε παιχνίδια και χρηστικά αντικείμενα
  • εργαλεία ανακύκλωσης μεταλλικών αντικειμένων
  • εργαλεία ανακύκλωσης γυάλινων μπουκαλιών σε χρηστικά αντικείμενα
  • 2 ραπτομηχανές για την κατασκευή παιδικής κούκλας και άλλων αντικειμένων
  • μια μεταλλική πρέσσα για την κατασκευή μπρικέτας από χαρτί
  • αποθηκευτικοί χώροι για πλαστικό, χαρτί, κουτιά αλουμινίου
  • αποθήκη για τα πεταμένα αντικείμενα.

ΠΩΣ ΜΠΟΡΕΙΤΕ ΝΑ ΒΟΗΘΗΣΕΤΕ?

Τα μέλη της FatCut UPCYCLING ανήκουν σε ευαίσθητες κοινωνικές ομάδες (άνεργοι/ες, μετανάστες/τριες, μονογονεϊκές οικογένειες). Η συλλογικότητά μας προσπαθεί να διαμορφώσει τη δυνατότητα μιας σωστής εργασιακής συνθήκης. Είναι μια προσπάθεια που δεν έχει προϋπολογισμό. Η στήριξή σας, μας βοηθάει να:

1. Διατηρήσουμε τον Παιχνιδοχώρο & τον χώρο εργαστηρίων
- πάγια έξοδα του χώρου (ενοίκια πρώτου καιρού λειτουργίας, λογαριασμοί)
- έξοδα συντήρησης (χρώματα, καθαριστικά, φυτά & χώμα, χαρτικά, είδη υγιεινής)
- λειτουργικά έξοδα του συνεταιρισμού ΚΟΙΝ.Σ.ΕΠ. (δικηγόρος-λογιστής κλπ)

2. Αγοράσουμε εξοπλισμό
- Βασικά εργαλεία & φόρμες εργασίας για τα εργαστήριά μας

3. Αναπτύξουμε ενα website, social media και υλικό προβολής
- Σχεδιασμός website / e-shop / etsy shop και εκτυπώση φυλλαδίων & αφισών

4. Αγοράσουμε ενα μεταφορικό όχημα
- Ενα μικρό βάν ή τρίκυκλο για τη συλλογή & μεταφορά αντικειμένων από το δρόμο

5. Οργανώσουμε εκδηλώσεις & bazaar
- Eκπαιδευτικές εκδηλώσεις για μικρούς και μεγάλους για την ιδέα της άμεσης ανακύκλωσης (upcycling) και της αυτοδιαχείρισης.

6. Ενισχύσουμε τις πληρωμές μας
- Όλα τα μέλη της ομάδας μας εργάζονται με την ίδια εργατο-ώρα. Οι μηνιαίες πληρωμές μας αυτή τη στιγμή εξαρτώνται από το εισόδημα του παιχνιδοχώρου. Το γενικό εισόδημα μοιράζεται ισόποσα στα μέλη μας, ανάλογα με τις εργατοώρες τους. Παρ' όλ' αυτά το συνολικό μας εισόδημα είναι ακόμα αρκετά μειωμένο και αναγκαζόμαστε να δουλεύουμε αρκετές ώρες χωρίς πληρωμή. Για να μπορούμε λοιπόν να αποδίδουμε και να δημιουργούμε καλύτερα προϊόντα και ιδέες, χρειαζόμαστε την υποστήριξή σας...

Αγαπητοί φίλοι/ες,

Ελάτε να ξαναδημιουργήσουμε τους χωρο-χρόνους φαντασίας και ελευθερίας που μας έχουν κλέψει! Στηρίξτε την προσπάθειά μας για μια φαντασιακή-δημιουργική εκπαίδευση! Είστε οι μοναδικοί χορηγοί επικοινωνίας μας, γι' αυτό σας προσκαλούμε να διαδόσετε το νέο αυτό εγχείρημα σα σήματα καπνού, σε όποιον νομίζετε ότι θα ενδιαφέρεται, καθώς όλοι είμαστε πολύτιμοι.

Με εκτίμηση και προσμονή,

FatCut Upcycling
Σωτήρης, Νούχα, Τάκης, Βιβή, Δημήτρης, Νίκος, Κώστας, Κυριάκος, Ρωξάνη, Ελένη, Κατερίνα, Βανή, Βίκτορ, Στέλλα, Εϊμεν, Μιχάλης, Μασινίσα, Ειρήνη, Μυρτώ, Αγγελική..

Αθήνα, Φεβρουάριος 2016

LINKS
FatCut Upcycling
Cado Paradiso Upcycled Playground
Trashformers
Mystic Blue

OUR WORKSHOPS SPACEOne floor above our upcycled playground we have set up FatCut Upcycling workshops space. It is here that we construct the toys for our playground and where our Upcycling workshops are taking place every week. For the time being, it is equipped with:
a carpenter's room for re-purposing wood to toys and wooden constructions
tools for upcycling metal scrap
tools for upcycling bottles into glass products
2 sewing machines for the making of dolls for kids
a metal press to upcycle waste paper into briquettes
storage tubes for plastic & paper
warehouse to store collected items

 
HOW CAN YOU SUPPORT?FatCut
 UPCYCLING members belong to vulnerable social groups (unemployed persons, immigrants, single parents). Our collective gives our members the possibility to have decent working conditions. In general, it is a non-budget effort. Therefore, by supporting our effort you help us to:1. Sustain our Playground & Workshops Space- basic operational expenses of the space (rent, bills)- maintenance expenses (paint, flowers and plants, papers & markers)- fees & legal services for our cooperative (lawyer, accountant etc)2. Buy Equipment- Basic tools & work suits for our upcycling workshops3. Develop a Website, Social Media & Promo Material- Design of a website / e-shop, etsy shop and printing of brochures & posters4. Buy a Transport Vehicle- A small van or tricycle for collecting & transporting items from the street5. Organize Events- Educational events for children & grown-ups that promote the idea of upcycling 6. Enhance our payment- All members of our collective are working under the same working hour fee. Our monthly salaries are currently depending on the income of the upcycled playground. The income is evenly divided to our members, depending on their work hours. However our monthly income is still very limited and we have to work a lot without payment. In order to be able to perform and create better products and ideas we need your support...
Dear Friends,We invite you to support our efforts, so we can reclaim the space-times of freedom and fantasy for the children! By
 supporting us you also support the need for a creative, out-of-the-box 
education! Remember, you are our only communication sponsors, so please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Spread 
the news as smoke-signs, to everybody interested, as everyone is valuable.Sincerely,FatCut UpcyclingSotiris, Noha, Takis, Vivi, Dimitris, Nikos, Kostas, Kyriakos, Roxani, Eleni, Katerina, Vani, Victor, Stella, Eimen, Mihalis, Mashinisa, Irene, Myrto, Aggeliki...Athens, February 2016LINKSFatCut UpcyclingCado Paradiso Upcycled PlaygroundTrashformersMystic Blue

Η FATCUT
 UPCYCLING είναι ένα συμμετοχικό δίκτυο άνω των 20 ατόμων με νομική μορφή κοινωνικής συνεταιριστικής επιχείρησης 
(ΚΟΙΝ.Σ.ΕΠ.). Πειραματίζεται, δημιουργεί και μεταποιεί μέσω της άμεσης ανακύκλωσης (upcycling*)
 φαινομενικά άχρηστα αντικείμενα, προκειμένου να τους προσδώσει 
μεγαλύτερη βιωσιμότητα και να τα μετατρέψει σε χρηστικά προϊόντα ή 
εκπαιδευτικά παιχνίδια. Παράλληλα, η ομάδα είναι ένα ανοιχτό 
εργαστήριο ιδεών και τεχνογνωσίας που διατίθεται ελεύθερα στον καθένα, 
δίνοντας λύση σε καθημερινές ανάγκες.Χαρτοκούτες, εφημερίδες, πλαστικές σακούλες, παλέτες, καπάκια, πόρτες
 και παράθυρα, μικροσκόπια εώς θερμοσίφωνες και άλλα «σκουπίδια», μετά 
από επεξεργασία, αναβάλλουν το ραντεβού τους με τη χωματερή και αυξάνουν
 το μέσο όρο ζωής τους. Είναι ενας τρόπος ελαχιστοποίησης του ήδη υπερμεγέθη 
όγκου σκουπιδιών και μειώσης του ενεργειακού κόστους της κατανάλωσης. Είναι μια εναλλακτική στην παραδοσιακή ανακύκλωση η οποία  δεν έχει επιτύχει να αποδεσμευτεί από τις εκπομπές διοξειδίου του άνθρακα και περιλαμβάνει το τεράστιο κόστος κατασκευής των μπλέ κάδων καθώς και την ανεπάρκεια της κρατικής διαχείρισης.
Η FatCut Upcycling δημιουργήθηκε πριν 5 χρόνια.

Μέσα σ' αυτά τα χρόνια λειτουργίας έχουμε 
κατασκευάσει το "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" τον πρώτο ανακυκλωμένο χώρο εργαστηρίων για μικρούς και μεγάλους στην Αθήνα, όπου και βρισκόμαστε σήμερα.

Έχουμε εκδόσει το #1 τεύχος του κόμικ "TRASHFORMERS" για να περάσουμε το μήνυμα της άμεσης ανακύκλωσης μέσω της οπτικής γλώσσας των κόμικ. Αυτή τη στιγμή προετοιμάζουμε την έκδοση του 2ου τεύχους για τον Απρίλιο του 2016.
Έχουμε συμμετάσχει και 
πραγματοποιήσει εκθέσεις, εκδηλώσεις και περιοδείες σε Ελλάδα, Ιταλία 
και Γαλλία, με όχημα ενα upcycled ιστιοφόρο, το Mystic Blue Eco-Sailing.

Έχουμε πραγματοποιήσει εργαστήρια τεχνογνωσίας (workshops) για την 
επανοικειοποίηση πρώτων υλών που πετιούνται. Στα εργαστήρια αυτά 
ασχοληθήκαμε με τη κατασκευή οικολογικών σομπών, ποτηριών, πρεσών για μπρικέτες και εκπαιδευτικών παιχνιδιών μεταξύ πολλών άλλων.



ΤΙ ΕΙΝΑΙ ΤΟ UPCYCLING?Η κυρίαρχη ιδέα του upcycling είναι η επανάχρηση πεταμένων υλικών ώστε να ξαναγίνουν χρήσιμα και να αποκτήσουν μια νέα ταυτότητα και οικολογική αξία. Σα συνέπεια, το upcycling βοηθάει στην μείωση της κατανάλωσης νέων πρώτων υλών και στη μείωση της απαιτούμενης ενέργειας που σπαταλιέται  για την κατασκευή νέων προϊόντων. H άμεση ανακύκλωση είναι ένας καλός τρόπος να βοηθήσουμε την ελαχιστοποίηση της ατμοσφαιρικής μόλυνσης, της μόλυνσης των υδάτων και των εκπομπών του θερμοκηπίου.

Το Downcycling είναι η συμβατική ανακύκλωση, δηλαδή η διαδικασία 
μεταποίησης υλών και 
προϊόντων σε νέα υλικά κατώτερης ποιότητας, αυξάνοντας ταυτόχρονα τις 
εργοστασιακές εκπομπες διοξειδίου του άνθρακα (CO2) στην ατμόσφαιρα.
Το Upcycling, αντίθετα, 
χρησιμοποιεί εξ'ολοκλήρου το προϊόν, είτε καθιστώντας το εκ νέου 
χρήσιμο, είτε προσδίδοντάς του νέα ιδιότητα και αξία, μειώνοντας το 
ενεργειακό κόστος και τις εκπομπές ρύπων και αυξάνοντας την 
εφευρετικότητα και τη δημιουργικότητα του ανθρώπου.

 ΤΟ ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟΟ χώρος μας ονομάζεται "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" και είναι αφιερωμένος στη μάθηση μέσω του παιχνιδιού. Κατασκευάστηκε αποκλειστικά από μέλη της ομάδας μας σε μια διαδικασία D.I.T (do-it-together).
 Πρόκειται για έναν χώρο 240τ.μ., στην οδό Εριγόνης 3, στα Κάτω Πετράλωνα
 της Αθήνας, που φιλοξενεί παιδιά όλων των ηλικιών, 
προκειμένου να παίξουν, να απασχοληθούν δημιουργικά και να εκπαιδευτούν 
σε τεχνικές κατασκευής upcycled παιχνιδιών και χρηστικών αντικειμένων.Ο παιχνιδοχώρος "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" είναι κατα 90% κατασκευασμένος από ανακυκλωμένα υλικά. Ιπτάμενοι δράκοι, τεράστια πάζλ από 
πλαστικά μπουκάλια, μεταποιημένα παιχνίδια με ποδήλατα, μουσικά 
παιχνίδια και τσουλήθρες απο σωλήνες pvc, κάστρα και τραμπολίνο απο 
ρόδες αυτοκινήτων και πολλά άλλα θα συνθέσουν μια φαντασμαγορία για τις 5
 αισθήσεις παιδιών και μεγάλων.
Στον χώρο λαμβάνουν μέρος μια σειρά εργαστηρίων δημιουργικής 
απασχόλησης όπου η γνώση θα προκύπτει πάντα μέσα απο την χαρά του 
παιχνιδιού. Τα εργαστήρια περιλαμβάνουν κατασκευές παιχνιδιών, κουκλοθέατρο, μουσική, εικαστικά, χοροθέατρο, φυσική, βιολογία, γεωγραφία, βοτανολογία, πολιτική αγωγή.Το παιχνίδι και συνεπώς το παιδί δε γλίτωσαν απ' τη συλλογική φαντασίωση
 της αέναης ανάπτυξης, όπου ο χωρο-χρόνος της ελεύθερης δημιουργικής 
ευτυχίας δε χωράει, ούτε είναι μέρος του καθημερινού ασφυκτικού 
προγράμματος. Η "καριέρα" ξεκινάει νωρίς ώστε να εξασφαλίζεται η ολοένα 
και περισσότερη απουσία φαντασίας στο παιχνίδι και μετέπειτα στη ζωή.Παρόλο που η «πλαστικοποίηση» και η εκβιομηχάνιση του παιχνιδιού είναι 
κάτι σχετικά πρόσφατο, η περίοδος όπου τα παιδιά είχαν το χωρο-χρόνο 
τους για να δημιουργούν τα παιχνίδια τους, φαίνεται κομμάτι κάποιου απροσδιόριστου μακρινού 
παρελθόντος. Θελουμε να "σπάσουμε" τη λογική "δεν προλαβαίνω, δεν 
προλαβαίνεις, ας το αγοράσουμε...". Θέλουμε να αναβιώσουμε εναν χώρο εκπαίδευσης που θα καλλιεργεί την 
αλληλεγγύη, τον σεβασμό στη διαφορετικότητα, την οικονομία με την 
πρωταρχική της σημασία, τη συμμετοχή και την αυτονομία. Η χαρά για τη γνώση δεν βαθμολογείται!
Ο ΧΩΡΟΣ ΕΡΓΑΣΤΗΡΙΩΝ UPCYCLINGΣτον 1ο όροφο πάνω από το ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ εγκαταστήσαμε το χώρο εργαστηρίων μας. Εδώ κατασκευάζουμε τα παιχνίδια του παιχνιδοχώρου και οργανώνουμε σε εβδομαδιαία βάση τα εργαστήρια upcycling για ενήλικες. Ο χώρος είναι εξοπλισμένος με:
ξυλουργείο για τη μεταποίηση ξυλείας σε παιχνίδια και χρηστικά αντικείμενα


εργαλεία ανακύκλωσης μεταλλικών αντικειμένων

εργαλεία ανακύκλωσης γυάλινων μπουκαλιών σε χρηστικά αντικείμενα

2 ραπτομηχανές για την κατασκευή παιδικής κούκλας και άλλων αντικειμένων

μια μεταλλική πρέσσα για την κατασκευή μπρικέτας από χαρτί


αποθηκευτικοί χώροι για πλαστικό, χαρτί, κουτιά αλουμινίου


αποθήκη για τα πεταμένα αντικείμενα.



ΠΩΣ ΜΠΟΡΕΙΤΕ ΝΑ ΒΟΗΘΗΣΕΤΕ?Τα μέλη της FatCut
 UPCYCLING ανήκουν σε ευαίσθητες κοινωνικές ομάδες (άνεργοι/ες, μετανάστες/τριες, μονογονεϊκές οικογένειες). Η συλλογικότητά μας προσπαθεί να διαμορφώσει τη δυνατότητα μιας σωστής εργασιακής συνθήκης. Είναι μια προσπάθεια που δεν έχει προϋπολογισμό. Η στήριξή σας, μας βοηθάει να:1. Διατηρήσουμε τον Παιχνιδοχώρο & τον χώρο εργαστηρίων- πάγια έξοδα του χώρου (ενοίκια πρώτου καιρού λειτουργίας, λογαριασμοί)- έξοδα συντήρησης (χρώματα, καθαριστικά, φυτά & χώμα, χαρτικά, είδη υγιεινής)- λειτουργικά έξοδα του συνεταιρισμού ΚΟΙΝ.Σ.ΕΠ. (δικηγόρος-λογιστής κλπ)2. Αγοράσουμε εξοπλισμό- Βασικά εργαλεία & φόρμες εργασίας για τα εργαστήριά μας3. Αναπτύξουμε ενα website, social media και υλικό προβολής- Σχεδιασμός website / e-shop / etsy shop και εκτυπώση φυλλαδίων & αφισών4. Αγοράσουμε ενα μεταφορικό όχημα- Ενα μικρό βάν ή τρίκυκλο για τη συλλογή & μεταφορά αντικειμένων από το δρόμο5. Οργανώσουμε εκδηλώσεις & bazaar - Eκπαιδευτικές εκδηλώσεις για μικρούς και μεγάλους για την ιδέα της άμεσης ανακύκλωσης (upcycling) και της αυτοδιαχείρισης. 6. Ενισχύσουμε τις πληρωμές μας- Όλα τα μέλη της ομάδας μας εργάζονται με την ίδια εργατο-ώρα. Οι μηνιαίες πληρωμές μας αυτή τη στιγμή εξαρτώνται από το εισόδημα του παιχνιδοχώρου. Το γενικό εισόδημα μοιράζεται ισόποσα στα μέλη μας, ανάλογα με τις εργατοώρες τους. Παρ' όλ' αυτά το συνολικό μας εισόδημα είναι ακόμα αρκετά μειωμένο και αναγκαζόμαστε να δουλεύουμε αρκετές ώρες χωρίς πληρωμή. Για να μπορούμε λοιπόν να αποδίδουμε και να δημιουργούμε καλύτερα προϊόντα και ιδέες, χρειαζόμαστε την υποστήριξή σας...
Αγαπητοί φίλοι/ες,Ελάτε να ξαναδημιουργήσουμε τους χωρο-χρόνους φαντασίας και 
ελευθερίας που μας έχουν κλέψει! Στηρίξτε την προσπάθειά μας για μια 
φαντασιακή-δημιουργική εκπαίδευση! Είστε οι μοναδικοί χορηγοί επικοινωνίας 
μας, γι' αυτό σας προσκαλούμε να διαδόσετε το νέο αυτό εγχείρημα σα σήματα 
καπνού, σε όποιον νομίζετε ότι θα ενδιαφέρεται, καθώς όλοι είμαστε πολύτιμοι.
Με εκτίμηση και προσμονή,FatCut UpcyclingΣωτήρης, Νούχα, Τάκης, Βιβή, Δημήτρης, Νίκος, Κώστας, Κυριάκος, Ρωξάνη, Ελένη, Κατερίνα, Βανή, Βίκτορ, Στέλλα, Εϊμεν, Μιχάλης, Μασινίσα, Ειρήνη, Μυρτώ, Αγγελική..Αθήνα, Φεβρουάριος 2016LINKSFatCut UpcyclingCado Paradiso Upcycled PlaygroundTrashformersMystic Blue

story:
Setting the scene for a scientific inquiry into minimalism

My name is Kevin McCourt, and after graduating summa cum laude with a B.A. in Psychology in March, I will be thru-hiking the 2,200 mile Appalachian Trail for, I believe, the perfect backdrop to finish my research into minimalism and write a non-fiction, scientifically-based book describing how the cultural progression of the last 150 years has resulted in an overly complicated lifestyle and the effects this lifestyle has on us as individuals and as a society.

  • I am not raising funds for an AT thru-hike.  Thru-hiking the Appalachian Trail and writing this book have been a dream for several years.  Once I decided to do the former this year, I realized it would give me the time to do the latter. See below for a break-down for which expenses are being raised.
  • I am a skilled academic and non-fiction writer.  Examples of some of my writing pertaining specifically to this project can be seen by following the links to my Facebook page or click here to see a preview of my research and writing on this subject.
  • My data is drawn from peer-reviewed research journals and other reputable sources.
  • My research is multi-disciplinary, including psychology, sociology, philosophy, history, economics, and anthropology, among others.
  • This will not be a book about the Appalachian Trail, but it will use my experiences living in the wilderness for six months focusing on the basic necessities of life as inspiration and example.
  • I have gained well over 1400 followers in the first month of the launch of my Facebook page and website.  This tells me there is interest in my hike and my writing, and I expect this number to continue to grow exponentially as I post hike updates and scholarly articles throughout the hike and the writing of the book.  This means there is a large audience for this type of book, and a large portion of the audience will be aware of the book before it's even finished.
The support I hope to gain
  • I expect I will be the primary investor in this endeavor, and have already spent hundreds on research materials, promotion, and other expenses.  In this campaign, I simply hope to raise enough funds to give this book more of a chance to be a success.  Even the greatest of books go unread if no one knows about them.
  • Expenses include:
  • Lightweight technical equipment for writing, occasional stops to access and sometimes purchase additional research as necessary, and logistic methods to backup my work via wifi or by shipping flash drives home if necessary. Estimated costs: $500
  • Professional editing of the manuscript, formatting for kindle, and professional cover design.  Estimated costs: $1500
  • Promotion: Since I will also be chronicling my entire thru-hike online and publishing short articles pertaining to my research findings, both on my website -- www. appalachianthruhiker.com -- I have already begun self-funding the promotion of the book.  I expect in the end these promotional efforts will run upwards of $1000 and result in a wide audience eagerly awaiting for the book to be published.
  • Since I will be writing the book during my thru-hike in any way I can -- including paper and pencil if necessary -- no funds will go to waste if my goal is not met.  This book has been simmering in my mind for two years, and I will continue self-funded until it is written and published.
  • Lack of funding may result in delays, less promotion of the book, and a less graceful presentation, but it will not stop the research, the writing, or the movement.  Truth doesn't need fancy artwork.
  • Estimated publication date: Since I expect my reader base to continue to grow, I am anticipating 10,000-15,000 Facebook and Website followers by the time I finish my thru-hike.  To avoid losing momentum, the book will be polished immediately upon my return, hopefully professionally edited, and published as soon as possible.  I expect to finish the AT in September 2016, and publish between October and December 2016.

The Impact

  • Culture tends to propagate, from parent to child, from peer to peer, until eventually we forget there is more than one way to live.  A scholarly argument for a simple life may not change the world, but it may change someone's world. Most importantly, it may present an alternative that some have never even considered.

Other Ways You Can Help

If funding isn't an option, check out the facebook page and website.  Challenge my ideas.  Make me think.  Most importantly, spread the word by sharing through social networks.  Most people have responded positively to my research, but they have to have a chance to see it first.
