story:
Worldwide, one in five women will be raped in her lifetime. That’s over 700 million women and girls.

There’s a global epidemic of sexual violence with women at the frontlines.


When Seeking Medical Care, Rape Survivors often Lack Advocates and Support

When rape survivors seek medical care after their assault, most are alone and uninformed about the basic services they require in order to prevent HIV, pregnancy and sexually-transmitted infections.

In many places around the world, medical staff may also be unaware of the specific services that survivors need or they may even be hostile to rape survivors because of cultural attitudes. Even if a survivor is brave enough to show up, she* might not get antibiotics, antiretrovirals or Plan B. Sometimes she* may even be denied care and asked to leave. All of this can increase the risk of a rape survivor developing PTSD, anxiety or depression.

* (We use “she” here, because women are the most common survivors, but it’s important to point out that rape survivors can be any gender and come from any background.)

In some richer countries, rape crisis centers train and organize networks of volunteer rape crisis counselors to accompany and advocate for rape survivors when they come into the emergency room. A growing body of research shows that these services have a significant effect on long-term recovery.

But in most places, the resources to train rape crisis counselors aren’t available. And survivors and their advocates lack access to guidance on how to ensure that a survivor receives the care she needs.


Our Global Coalition of Experts Who Care

I’m Elie Calhoun, a rape crisis counselor, and aid worker and a public health expert at Code Innovation, where we take solutions to problems like this one and digitize them so they can scale.

We’ve worked in Africa and on technology projects for over a decade, connecting people in hard-to-reach environments with education that empowers them to make a difference in their own lives and in their communities.

Now we’re reaching out to bring rape crisis counselor training to everyone who has access to a smartphone. Every year, the affordability of mobile phones and the availability of data is rising.

We’ve brought rape crisis centers around the U.S., including the DC Rape Crisis Center (the oldest in the US) and the Pittsburgh Action against Rape coalition, together with humanitarian, gender-based violence experts, mobile learning specialists, women’s rights defenders and non-profits from around the world to make this happen.


A Rape Crisis Counseling App Available to All

Our Rape Crisis Counseling app will be a mobile version of the training that rape crisis centers provide for their volunteers. This training will be adapted for a range of different health care settings and cultural contexts. It will:

  • Allow anyone, anywhere to train herself as an informal rape crisis counselor who can help rape survivors in her network or community;
  • Be an in-hand resource that helps friends, colleagues and family members know what to do when they accompany a survivor to get medical care;
  • Support a survivor who has to seek medical care on her own  to negotiate asking for and getting the health services she needs;
  • Include resources for LGBTQIA survivors and their advocates, as well information on how to advocate for children and people with disabilities.

We’re betting that smartphones will be in the hands of almost everyone before too long – which means that the resources to begin healing after sexual assault have the potential to reach anyone, anywhere.


Mobile Training Resources for Would-Be Volunteers

All over the world, rape survivors and their communities are responding to the aftermath of sexual violence without access to the full range of information that could help them in their process.

We need to create a real resource that takes the knowledge gained from decades of advocacy at rape crisis centers and put it in the hands of every single person who needs it.

This isn’t counseling, or medical assistance. It’s simple advocacy: information and support for the crucial visit to the hospital where rape survivors get the life-saving care they need to begin recovery.

We’re keeping the app focused only on this important moment, because getting medical care is an early moment when a survivor needs care and support and because the protocol doesn’t change, no matter where in the world a survivor lives.

We hope this resource encourages people to establish rape crisis counselors around the world and that it will help to create a network of healing that extends far beyond the app itself. Our partners in U.S. rape crisis centers are already eager to share their resources and to support volunteers who self-organize and seek to provide more formal services for rape survivors in other countries.


Join Us 

Rape makes even the strongest among us feel powerless, but together we can take a stand so that survivors can access the information they need to take a first step towards healing.

Join us on the journey to create this much-needed resource. We’ll be sending project updates and stories every step of the way.


We have two Stretch Goals that we’d love to see happen if we get more than we’re asking for:


1.  $37,500: Intimate Partner Violence Advocacy and Support Module

Intimate partner violence makes up 15% of all reported crime in the U.S. [URL] and domestic violence is a major issue in every country. Often, rape crisis counselors also serve as advocates for survivors of intimate partner violence when they seek medical care, and this component is something we would partner to build out if we raise additional funds.


2.  $62,500: Intimate Partner Violence Advocacy Module & Digital Resources for Extended Survivor Support and Community Advocacy

This section would help survivors locate additional resources for psychological support and services, by walking them through the process of how to identify quality resources and how to reach out for expert support when it is available. (Please note that we would not create a directory of, or a link to services, because we do not have the resources to evaluate and keep this list active.) Advocacy resources would also include how to self-organize a rape survivor support group, a volunteer network or a crisis hotline. The content would be provided by our partner rape crisis centers and adapted by our global coalition.


FAQs


1.  Is there a need for a Rape Crisis Counseling app? How can you be sure it will be used?

Elie wrote an article last summer, “Shifting the Silence around Rape and Sexual Assault in Aid Culture,” that sparked emails from rape survivors around the world who identified a need for an advocacy resource that would help them to negotiate receiving appropriate medical care. This is where the idea for digitizing the training program of rape crisis counselors originated.

To validate the idea, we reached out to dozens of rape crisis centers in the US, the global network of women’s rights activists and non-profits at Women Living under Muslim Laws, and support groups for humanitarian aid workers, as well as gender-based violence experts.

All of the rape crisis centers who responded were supportive of the idea of creating a digitized mobile version of rape crisis counselor training and adapting it be be used as stand alone training materials and also as an in-hand resource for survivors and their advocates in health centers.

Over a dozen women’s rights activists and non-profits around the world wrote back to offer to join our coalition and support the project. In addition, many of the aid workers and gender-based violence experts we reached out to also offered their guidance and support for the project.

Over 100 people and groups we reached out to were unanimous in their support of the app as a tool to help survivors, their advocates and would-be volunteers to help facilitate getting rape survivors the medical care they need.

There is not yet an appropriate app of this kind to be found on the App store or the Google Play store. While one resource created for the U.S. military is professionally done, most of the apps in our category are inappropriate and are not optimized by experts for use by rape survivors around the world.


2.  Will this app provide formal certification for rape crisis counselors?

No, it will not. Formal rape crisis counselor certification is available only through accredited rape crisis centers after what is usually a 40-hour in-person training. Our resource is for educational purposes only and does not confer any titles or privileges associated with such titles. Our legal disclaimer and introductory content will make very clear that the app content does not make anyone a certified rape crisis counselor and is to be used for informational purposes and at the user’s full discretion. We hope it will encourage people to seek formal training and to support rape crisis counseling centers. But the app itself is for reference only.


3.  Why make an app and not a mobile-ready website?

Apps work without active data or Internet connectivity, whereas websites do not. In addition, we are creating a mobile learning user interface that helps our different users (survivors, advocates or would-be volunteers) through the content sequentially and that branches into different decision trees as needed. This kind of user experience is better suited to a mobile app.


4.  Will the app offer medical assistance or advice?

No, it will not. Qualified medical personnel at the health center where the survivor is seeking care are the ones to provide medical assistance. The app is focused on offering psychological support and advocacy within the medical system, and it will not contain any medical information aside from a reference to the healthcare protocol for sexual assault. The app is also not diagnostic in any way.


5.  How will the app function in low bandwidth contexts where Internet service is poor?

We will limit the download size by restricting the app content to mostly text and ensure that no Internet or data service is necessary for the app to function. Once the app is downloaded, it will not require connectivity to function.


6.  Will having this app on a smartphone identify someone as a rape survivor? Could its visibility cause problems to the people who have it?

Although it can be used as a tool for survivors and their advocates, the app is primarily a training resource for volunteer rape crisis counselors in their communities. It’s title and visual identity will be training-focused for volunteers and not cue or identify the user as a rape survivor.


7.  How will people who don’t own a smartphone be able to access the content?

We are creating a mobile resource for people with access to smartphones because the number of smartphone users around the world is rapidly increasing as the cost of handsets and mobile connectivity drops. While mobile penetration will never reach 100% of the global population, smartphone owners are influencers in their communities.

We faced a similar challenge when Code created our “About Ebola” mobile app in early 2014 and it was downloaded over 12,000 times, mostly by users in West Africa. While not everyone in West Africa had a smartphone, we designed the resource to be used one-to-many, which means that one person with access to the content could use the tool to train or teach others. In this way, the content can still benefit people without their own smartphone.


8.  Could this app be used by predators?

Our app will not collect identifying data from its users, but smartphone use in general carries with it definite risks that are not specific to the app and that need to be carefully considered. For instance, any smartphone can show its location and share sensitive information with predators who have the digital sophistication to access this data. But running our app will not create additional avenues for predators to access vulnerable people.


9.  Rape survivors face different challenges in different contexts. Are you going to make regional versions?

There will be one version of the app that can toggle to different languages. While in the future, we may create regional content if our partners identify the need for this, our initial build will focus on creating a single resource that fits most cultural and health system contexts. This is why our partners’ expertise is so important, because their knowledge of their own cultural issues and health system challenges will help to ensure that the resource is more appropriate for a wide user base, wherever they may be. Naturally, there will be subtle differences in language because of cultural differences in referring to this sort of violence; but the core content will be consistent.


10.  Is there already something like this on the app store?

Dozens of apps already on Google Play and the App Store that present themselves as tools in the fight against sexual violence are inappropriate at best and harmful at worst. Many, you’re meant to download and activate if and when you get raped, pressing a button to alert your friends and family that this is happening to you.


11.  What other languages will you translate the app into?

For now, we have partner organizations willing to translate the content into Arabic, Farsi, French and Spanish, and we would love to include more. If you sign up to support our Ambassador perk, you will support the app to be translated into the language of your choice, which is something we hope will happen!


12. What are the funds being used for?

Here's our project timeline and a breakdown of our costs.


Timeline

Project Milestone

Cost

April-May 2016

· Adapt and sequence training content from the Pittsburgh Action against Rape coalition and other rape crisis centers that we’re partnering with, along with resources from the U.S. Department of Justice. Adaptation includes creation of appropriate user interface and app design.

$8,500

June 2016

· Group process of editing and review between U.S. rape crisis centers and humanitarian gender-based violence experts and global women’s rights defenders and non-profits to help approve final content.

$2,400

July-August 2016

· Coordinate and test translations (currently Arabic, Farsi, French and Spanish, with organizations committed to using the app in their own work).

· Build and test the app in all supported languages.

$6,800

$3,100

September 2016

· App launch on Android and iOS; marketing and publicity; code base maintenance.

$1,700

Total

  

$22,500

Worldwide, one in five women will be raped in her lifetime. That’s over 700 million women and girls.
There’s a global epidemic of sexual violence with women at the frontlines.When Seeking Medical Care, Rape Survivors often Lack Advocates and Support 
When rape survivors seek medical care after their assault, most are alone
and uninformed about the basic services they require in order to prevent HIV, pregnancy and
sexually-transmitted infections.
In many places around the world, medical staff may also be unaware of the
specific services that survivors need or they may even be hostile to rape
survivors because of cultural attitudes. Even if a survivor is brave enough to
show up, she* might not get antibiotics, antiretrovirals or Plan B. Sometimes she* may even be denied care and asked to
leave. All of this can increase the risk of a rape survivor developing PTSD, anxiety or depression. 
* (We use “she” here, because women are the most common survivors, but
it’s important to point out that rape survivors can be any gender and come from
any background.)
In some richer countries, rape crisis centers train and organize
networks of volunteer rape crisis
counselors to accompany and advocate
for rape survivors when they come into the emergency room. A growing body of research shows that these services have a significant effect on long-term recovery.

available. And survivors and their advocates lack access to guidance on how to ensure that a survivor receives
the care she needs.

story:
MAKE A MOVE.SHAKE THE WORLD

*para español, ve al final de la página

Our goal 

Irembo Foundation is established with the aim of breaking the vicious cycle of poverty, tackling the obstacles that restrict the freedom of vulnerable families in Kigali. Because we believe that, if empowered, anybody can be agent of change in their own life.

We want to ensure that every child has access to education and the self-sufficiency of the families en Kacyiru district and surroundings (Kigali, Rwanda) through: 

1. a vocational training program (sewing and shoemaking) for the parents of the families in a vulnerable situation and the opening of Irembo Boutique, the shop where these products with a unique African touch and produced by these families will be sold.  

2. a volunteer program for youth to engage in activities with a positive social impact and the empowerment of women through a single women’s club. 

What we need 

What do we need this 5,000 EUR for?

  • Sewing machines: we aim to purchase at least 13 sewing machines for a group of 25 women. 
  • Rent of the place that will serve as workshop and Irembo Boutique. We need to cover 5 months of rent. We have estimated that after these 5 months, the rent will be paid with the profits obtained selling the products. 
  • House reforms.
  • Materials: beautiful and good quality African fabrics, leather and paint to create our unique products. 
  • Tools: scissors, rulers, blackboards, tables, chairs...
  • Instructors: two professionals will be teaching these men and women and receiving a symbolic payment.

The impact

Collaborating with Irembo Foundation you won't just be making a simple donation, you will become the investor of a social enterprise that will change the lives of many people giving them the opportunity to take control of their own lives. We don't believe in charity, we look for long-lasting and efficient solutions to give these families the opportunities and freedom they deserve. 

After a 5 months training period, this project will become self-sufficient and profits will contribute to our employees salaries and the expansion and development of new activities in the Youth for Youth and Mama Rwanda Project. It will also provide special assistance for those families who still face problems paying for school fees. 

Challenges 

It might not be an easy task but we have made sure we have all the ingredients we need for a successful project: 

  • Market opportunity: increasing number of tourists visiting Rwanda with an interest in having a positive social impact with their visit. 
  • Human Centered Design Approach: our projects are created to suit the needs of the people we help.  
  • Trust: we have been working with families in this district for the last 2 years, proving our commitment and willingness to improve their lives. Our Irembo Foundation President in Rwanda, Bertrand Ishimwe has lived in this district his entire life. 

Other ways you can help us 

Post it, tweet it, share it!! If you know anybody who could be interested in helping a project like ours, let him/her know. And if you are interested in participating in the rest of activities we are carrying out in Kigali, visit our website and leave us a message: www.irembofoundation.org 

We also want to thank the people who have already collaborated with us in this campaign: Juan José Ocaña, Javier San José, Bibiana Gil, Sheila, Luís Javier Acedo, Luciano Lilloy, Marisa Martín, Ramón Marcebo, Daniel Risueño and Amadro Lorente :)

Nuestro objetivo 

Irembo Foundation ha sido creada con el objetivo de romper el círculo vicioso de la pobreza, abordando los obstáculos que restringen la libertad de las familias más vulnerables de Kigali. Porque nosotros creemos que todo el mundo, si se le da una oportunidad, puede ser agente de cambio de su propia vida.  

Queremos asegurar que todo los niños tienen acceso a la educación y la autosuficiencia de las familias del distrito de Kacyiru y alrededores mediante:  

1. un programa de formación profesional (costura y creación de zapatos) para los padres y madres de las familias en situación vulnerable, y la apertura de Irembo Boutique, la tienda donde se venderán estos productos con un toque africano único y producidos por estas familias. 

2. un programa de voluntariado para jóvenes donde llevarán a cabo actividades con un impacto social positivo y el empoderamiento de la mujer mediante un club para madres solteras.   

Lo que necesitamos

¿Para qué necesitamos estos 5,000 EUR?

  • Máquinas de coser: queremos comprar al menos 13 máquinas de coser para el grupo de 25 mujeres con el que estamos trabajando. 
  • El alquiler de un local que será nuestro taller y tienda Irembo Boutique. Necesitamos cubrir 5 meses de alquiler. Hemos estimado que después de estos 5 meses, se hará frente al alquiler gracias a los beneficios obtenidos mediante la venta de nuestros productos.  
  • Reformas del local. 
  • Materiales: bonitas telas africanas de la mejor calidad, cuero y pintura para crear nuestros productos únicos. 
  • Herramientas: tijeras, reglas, pizarras, mesas, sillas...
  • Instructores: dos profesionales estarán instruyendo a nuestro grupo de mujeres y hombres y recibiendo una paga simbólica.  

El impacto

Colaborando con Irembo Foundation no estarás haciendo una simple donación, te estarás convirtiendo en inversor de una empresa social que dará la oportunidad a muchas personas de tomar los mandos de su propia vida. No creemos en la caridad, buscamos soluciones duraderas y eficaces para darles a estas familiars las oportunidades y libertad que merecen. 

Después de 5 meses de formación, este proyecto pasará a ser autosuficiente y los beneficios irán destinados al sueldo de nuestros empleados y a la expansión y desarrollo de las nuevas actividades en nuestros proyectos Youth for Youth y Mama Rwanda. También dará asistencia a aquellas familias que tengan problemas haciendo frente al pago de matrículas escolares. 

Retos 

Puede que no sea una tarea fácil pero nos hemos asegurado de contar con los ingredientes necesarios para que este proyecto sea un éxito: 

  • Oportunidad de mercado: creciente número de turistas visitando Ruanda y con interés en tener un impacto social positivo con su visita. 
  • Enfoque Human Centered Design: nuestros proyectos están creados para adaptarse a las necesidad de las personas a las que ayudamos. 
  • Confianza: hemos estado trabajando con las familias de este distrito durante los dos últimos años, probando nuestro compromiso y disposición para mejorar sus vidas. El Presidente de Irembo Foundation en Rwanda, Bertrand Ishimwe, ha vivido en este mismo distrito toda su vida. 

Otras formas de ayudarnos

¡Postéalo, tweetéalo, compártelo! Si conoces a alguien que pudiese estar interesado en colaborar con un proyecto como el nuestro, compártelo con él/ella. Y si estás interesado en participar en el resto de actividades que estamos llevando a campo en Kigali, visita nuestra web y déjanos un mensaje: www.irembofoundation.org

*para español, ve al final de la página

Our goal 
 Irembo Foundation is established with the aim of breaking the vicious cycle of poverty, tackling the obstacles that restrict the freedom of vulnerable families in Kigali. Because we believe that, if empowered, anybody can be agent of change in their own life.
We want to ensure that every child has access to education and the self-sufficiency of the
families en Kacyiru district and surroundings (Kigali, Rwanda) through: 


1. a vocational training program (sewing and shoemaking) for the parents of the families in a vulnerable situation and the opening of Irembo
Boutique, the shop where these products with a unique African touch and produced by these families will be sold.  
2. a volunteer program for youth to engage in activities with a positive social impact and the
empowerment of women through a single women’s club. 






What we need 
 What do we need this 5,000 EUR for?  Sewing machines: we aim to purchase at least 13 sewing machines for a group of 25 women. 
Rent of the place that will serve as workshop and Irembo Boutique. We need to cover 5 months of rent. We have estimated that after these 5 months, the rent will be paid with the profits obtained selling the products. 
House reforms. Materials: beautiful and good quality African fabrics, leather and paint to create our unique products. 
Tools: scissors, rulers, blackboards, tables, chairs...
Instructors: two professionals will be teaching these men and women and receiving a symbolic payment.    


The impact
 Collaborating with Irembo Foundation you won't just be making a simple donation, you will become the investor of a social enterprise that will change the lives of many people giving them the opportunity to take control of their own lives. We don't believe in charity, we look for long-lasting and efficient solutions to give these families the opportunities and freedom they deserve. 







After a 5 months training period, this project will become self-sufficient and profits will contribute to our employees salaries and the expansion and
development of new activities in the Youth
for Youth and Mama Rwanda Project. It will
also provide special assistance for those
families who still face problems paying for
school fees. 





Challenges   It might not be an easy task but we have made sure we have all the ingredients we need for a successful project:   
Market opportunity: increasing number of tourists visiting Rwanda with an interest in having a positive social impact with their visit.  
Human Centered Design Approach: our projects are created to suit the needs of the people we help.  

Trust: we have been working with families in this district for the last 2 years, proving our commitment and willingness to improve their lives. Our Irembo Foundation President in Rwanda, Bertrand Ishimwe has lived in this district his entire life.     Other ways you can help us  Post it, tweet it, share it!! If you know anybody who could be interested in helping a project like ours, let him/her know. And if you are interested in participating in the rest of activities we are carrying out in Kigali, visit our website and leave us a message: www.irembofoundation.org 
We also want to thank the people who have already collaborated with us in this campaign: Juan José Ocaña, Javier San José, Bibiana Gil, Sheila, Luís Javier Acedo, Luciano Lilloy, Marisa Martín, Ramón Marcebo, Daniel Risueño and Amadro Lorente :)



Nuestro objetivo 
Irembo Foundation ha sido creada con el objetivo de romper el círculo vicioso de la pobreza, abordando los obstáculos que restringen la libertad de las familias más vulnerables de Kigali. Porque nosotros creemos que todo el mundo, si se le da una oportunidad, puede ser agente de cambio de su propia vida.  
Queremos asegurar que todo los niños tienen acceso a la educación y la autosuficiencia de las familias del distrito de Kacyiru y alrededores mediante:  
1. un programa de formación profesional (costura y creación de zapatos) para los padres y madres de las familias en situación vulnerable, y la apertura de Irembo Boutique, la tienda donde se venderán estos productos con un toque africano único y producidos por estas familias. 
2. un programa de voluntariado para jóvenes donde llevarán a cabo actividades con un impacto social positivo y el empoderamiento de la mujer mediante un club para madres solteras.   

Lo que necesitamos

¿Para qué necesitamos estos 5,000 EUR?

Máquinas de coser: queremos comprar al menos 13 máquinas de coser para el grupo de 25 mujeres con el que estamos trabajando. 
El alquiler de un local que será nuestro taller y tienda Irembo Boutique. Necesitamos cubrir 5 meses de alquiler. Hemos estimado que después de estos 5 meses, se hará frente al alquiler gracias a los beneficios obtenidos mediante la venta de nuestros productos.  
Reformas del local. 
Materiales: bonitas telas africanas de la mejor calidad, cuero y pintura para crear nuestros productos únicos. 
Herramientas: tijeras, reglas, pizarras, mesas, sillas...
Instructores: dos profesionales estarán instruyendo a nuestro grupo de mujeres y hombres y recibiendo una paga simbólica.  


El impacto
Colaborando con Irembo Foundation no estarás haciendo una simple donación, te estarás convirtiendo en inversor de una empresa social que dará la oportunidad a muchas personas de tomar los mandos de su propia vida. No creemos en la caridad, buscamos soluciones duraderas y eficaces para darles a estas familiars las oportunidades y libertad que merecen. 
Después de 5 meses de formación, este proyecto pasará a ser autosuficiente y los beneficios irán destinados al sueldo de nuestros empleados y a la expansión y desarrollo de las nuevas actividades en nuestros proyectos Youth for Youth y Mama Rwanda. También dará asistencia a aquellas familias que tengan problemas haciendo frente al pago de matrículas escolares. 

Retos 
Puede que no sea una tarea fácil pero nos hemos asegurado de contar con los ingredientes necesarios para que este proyecto sea un éxito: 


Oportunidad de mercado: creciente número de turistas visitando Ruanda y con interés en tener un impacto social positivo con su visita. 

Enfoque Human Centered Design: nuestros proyectos están creados para adaptarse a las necesidad de las personas a las que ayudamos. 

Confianza: hemos estado trabajando con las familias de este distrito durante los dos últimos años, probando nuestro compromiso y disposición para mejorar sus vidas. El Presidente de Irembo Foundation en Rwanda, Bertrand Ishimwe, ha vivido en este mismo distrito toda su vida. 

Otras formas de ayudarnos
¡Postéalo, tweetéalo, compártelo! Si conoces a alguien que pudiese estar interesado en colaborar con un proyecto como el nuestro, compártelo con él/ella. Y si estás interesado en participar en el resto de actividades que estamos llevando a campo en Kigali, visita nuestra web y déjanos un mensaje: www.irembofoundation.org

story:
Building a new kind of School

Our mission at the Treehouse Project is to empower humanity with sustainable holistic solutions.  Solutions that can be applied anywhere in the world to provide FOOD, CLEAN WATER, SHELTER, ENERGY, COMMUNITY, and ECONOMIC STABILITY. Our vision is to see people live ethically with the environment and each other.  

These Skills Include: Welding, Wood Working, Planting food, Designing Eco Communities, Health & Fitness, and more!


From Founder, Scott Bunn: "Why I Got Into Sustainability"
"I am motivated by  whole system solutions to many of the challenges we face today including food/water scarcity, pollution, climate, and economics.  Human ingenuity can  reduce, eliminate, or comfortably  adapt to these challenges.Chelsea and I have devoted our lives to creating learning centers and programs until the ability to care for oneself  & their community is common knowledge. "
Building + Growing Food + Team Building + Health  = Resilience
Understanding these solutions can be challenging, so we are creating the Treehouse Learning Center. This hands-on training facility is a half-acre permaculture demonstration of food, water shelter, energy, and community development. Treehouse Tools & Training is a educational program within the learning center focused on hands-on, skills and techniques for sustainability.  It is holistic applied learning model, giving students of all ages the opportunity to build community service projects while learning the skills to do so.
Some of the skills covered In TTT include:  construction, metal fabrication, health & fitness, food security, and reforestation.  
The best experience is immersive, where students stay at the Treehouse Learnign Center in an Activated Peer Group
 True empowerment comes through experience-based education, and with education comes economic stability."

Purpose for Funding

1. Materials to finish the Treehouse Learning Center - the half acre permaculture demonstration so visitors and students will understand how to implement permanent improvements to culture in their own communities. 


  • Community Center: an outdoor pavilion with a kitchen, bathroom and garden roof.

  • Greenhouse: including an aquaponics demonstration, hands-on plant propagation, table-top demonstration of the Learning Center that shows how the rain and sun are harnessed to produce energy.

  • Yurt: installed next to the greenhouse as a living space for teachers and visitors

  • Natural Storefront to display products and services as well as several natural building methods

  • Energy Production: We want this entire site to produce more power than it uses!

  • Natural Swimming Pool, serving several functions:
  1.     geothermal cooling for surrounding structures in the summer time
  2.     food production via fish and water plants
  3.     reflection pond for passive solar heating in the winter time
  4.     rain water collection from the main house    
  5.     key point irrigation pond to irrigate the rest of the property
  6.     wet conveyance transportation system teaching element
  7.     oh, and a swimming pool for the ever so important relaxation


What have we done so Far?               

About 30%!

- Obtained land from the neighboring trailer park

- Became Certified in Permaculture Design, and designed the Learning Center

- Developed a fruit Orchard, garden and two ponds

- Build a chicken area with 3 paddocks for rotational grazing

- Installed a reforestation project with Shubhendu Sharma

- Built an Earth Dome, used for a Sanctuary and Demonstration

- Developed Treehouse Tools & Training

- Created the Treehouse Tool Library

We have a good portion of materials and heavy machinery, and most importantly, a devoted team. But we’re asking you to help us raise $57K for the remaining materials needed to complete the Learning Center. 

Wait, that's not all we're doing this year!

We want to run at least 50 people through the monthly Treehouse Tools & Training program, which includes 20 meals + their room and utility expense - $102,350 

The cool part is that you can not only help fund the construction of the Learning Center BUT you and other participants can actually help us build it! Part of the TTT program is actually getting hands-on training through building the Center!

3. We need to cover startup, reward and campaign costs to ensure our success! ($52,000)

TOTAL FUNDING: $211,350

Upcoming Class Schedule:

If you are interested in attending our program or sponsoring someone, see below for a brief list of classes scheduled over the next 6 months! You can find full descriptions and a class schedule through the end of 2016 on our website.

April 4 - 25 - Tiny House in New Orleans, LA

April 5 - Grain Silo Erection

April 7 - Intro to Carpentry workshop - Learn the basic hand and power tools to build any wood framed structure. We will be building a tiny house from a silo during this workshop.  

April 11 - Intro to Permaculture Workshop -  Learn the basic principles and pathways to design your property to create Practical Solutions for a Sustainable Future.  

May 2 - 27 - TLC at the Treehouse Learning Center (TLC) - Join us this month for a variety of useful skills as we complete the Earthen dome, remodel the Greenhouse Roof, Finish the Cobb oven, and complete the Chicken coop and forage area. 

May  2 - Intro to Carpentry & Roof Construction 

May 9 - Intro to Natural Building - We are going to look at cobb construction, lime plaster, and earthen floors as we finish creating the Earthen dome.  

May 21 - Intro to Permaculture - Learn the basic principles and pathways to design your property to create Practical Solutions for a Sustainable Future.  

May 23 - Permaculture Chicken Coop Intro 

June 6 - July 1 - Community Center Construction

June 6 - Intro to Brick Laying and Building a Solid Foundation 

June 11 - Intro to Permaculture 

June 13 - Intro to Post & Beam Construction

June 23 - 24 - Green Roof Construction - Design and build a green roof and grow food in the same square footage as your living space!  Enjoy a day in the garden...on your roof!

June 27 - Rocket Mass stove construction and heater.

July 5 - 29 - Yurt Construction and Geo Thermal cooling - Learn to build a Yurt (a lightweight structure for shelter that can be moved easily. Learn how you can keep it cool in SC using Geothermal cooling from a pond nearby.  

July 5 - Introduction to Yurts and Yurt Construction

July 11 - Introduction to Sewing Machines - Sewing the canvas for your yurt

July 18 - Geo Thermal cooling using a water source nearby

July 25 - Arbor construction - Building an Arbor over the yurt for a solar array!

August 1 - 26 - Natural Swimming Pool - Building a Natural Swimming pool at the Treehouse Learning Center that will function as a rainwater storage for flood irrigation, reflection pond for winter heating, geothermal unit for summer cooling, food production, and a pool for swimming in!

August 1 - Intro to heavy Equipment - Using a mini excavator and skid steer to build ponds and do other beneficial earthworks

August 8 - concrete and brick laying workshop - building the floor and walls of the natural swimming pool

August 22 - Installing the pond liner and plumbing for the geo thermal unit

September 5 - 16 - Building a Treehouse

September 5 - Intro to Tree house Construction - Connections and concerns

September 6 - Welding

September 7 - Wood Framing

September 19 - 30 - Natural Storefront

September 19 - Intro to Natural Building - Cored wood, Cobb, Earthen Floors, Bottle Bricks, Palate walls, and Bamboo roofs

October 3 - 28 - Greenhouse Construction and Tree Planting

October 3 - Intro to Greenhouse Construction - Integrating Chickens and Fish

October 4 - Building a Solid Foundation, and integrating Aquaponics into the floor

October 10 - Greenhouse Frame and Plastic covering 

October 17 - Thermal mass rocket stove and propagation tables

October 24 - Tree and Perennial Planting


The Treehouse Project was built by people who are ready for change. With your help, that change can take root across the globe.

Recently Completed Projects

  • Energy upgrades to our home

  • Planted a fruit orchard

  • Planted a reforestation project

  • Installed two reflection ponds which function as a rain water holding spaces, food production, reflection ponds to assist in heating structures in the winter. 

  • Milled lumber using trees from our site

  • Recycled 6,000 bricks from Clemson University
  • Built an earthen dome
  • Built a tiny house on wheels as a mobile teaching unit

GLOBAL IMPACT

This is a fascinating time in human history – it is crazy to think of how industry has changed the face of the planet. With an exponential population growth, we are all feeling the pressures of climate, pollution, and scarcity. We have to address these issues, and we have to start at the root of the problem.

We, here at the Seneca Treehouse Project, have a dream of permanent global lifestyle change through building sustainable communities and learning centers that implement and teach permaculture, construction, fabrication and ethical cohabitation with the environment and others. So far, over 1,000 people have visited the TTreehouse Project, leaving inspired and with the training necessary to make life change. As we launch our new training program, Treehouse Tools and Training, our goal is to train 50 new teachers every year who can teach 50 more and so on... That’s 6 million teachers by 2020!

We’ve done our research, we’ve built the framework, we’ve tested it in our own home (it works!). Now, it’s time to spread the wisdom, and we need you to be a part of it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to support us in other ways:

  • Like and Follow us on social media! Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram (click on the links or just search Treehouse Tools & Training and Seneca Treehouse Project!) 

  • Share with your friends, family and network! Tweet about us, post about us, or blog about us! You can use the Indiegogo share tools :)

  • Want to get involved? Reach out to us about opportunities or sign up for our newsletter, just go to our website: www.SenecaTreehouse.org

  • Have other ideas? Contact us!

    See image below for a sneak peek of some of our perks!

story:
The Mission

Igneous Foundation is an organization committed to providing artistic direction for children and young adults with special needs and those with traditional functioning skills that are 18 and younger.  Currently, student participation in the performing arts is diminishing in America, and countless opportunities for youth to become artists and musicians, especially those with special needs, is severely on the decline.

The ultimate goal of Igneous Foundation is to help these children fulfill their musical and other artistic passions, despite their income.  It is our Mission to provide artistic training in the musical or art form of their choice (i.e. instrumental, vocal, painting or woodworking, etc.).

We inspire to provide the joy of music and art to youth, empower those with an interest in an artistic vocation, and create a new generation of artists. Igneous Foundation seeks to provide or subsidize the necessary instruments, training and supplies of which an artist could not readily afford.

Igneous Foundation is dedicated to the late Michael Evans Boyd III, who in preceding his passing, and despite his personal special needs challenges, dreamed of such a facility where children and young adults, like him, could flourish in a world of music and colors.  He did not see limitations in people, nor did he discriminate, and neither will The Foundation.


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $10,500 to pay for the minimum musical recording and art materials we will need to furnish a professional quality music program.  The money will specifically go toward the following: 


1. Two Roland F-20-CB | 88 Key Acoustic Touch Digital Piano Contemporary Black 

2. Two Apple MacBook Pros MB990LL/A 13.3-Inch Laptops  

3. Pro Tools - A Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) - Studio Engineering Program

4. An Audio Interface

5. Microphones

6. Microphone Stands

7. Studio Monitors

8. Audio Cables

9. Headphones

10. Pop Filters

11.  Acoustic Treatment

12. Reflection Filters

13. Studio Monitor Stands

14. An Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS)

15. Software Plugins

16. Virtual Instruments

17. A MIDI Controller

18. A DAW Remote

19. A Control Surface

20. Studio Rack Mounts

21. A Power Conditioner

22. A Microphone Preamp

23. A Headphone Amp

24. A Monitor Management System

25. Direct Boxes

26. Snake Cables

27. Digital Converters

28. Digital Master Clocks

29. Analog Hardware

*A variety of new and used woodwind, brass, string, and percussion instruments will be purchased for student use.

**Arts supplies will include paint supplies and woodworking materials (for bird houses and dog houses, because Michael loved being a carpenter).

***In case the entire goal is not reached, any and all donations will go toward the Foundation's costs.


The Impact

Many special needs and displaced children are at a disadvantage in life, and lack opportunities to pursue their artistic aspirations.  The daily struggles they contend with can take away from their ability to dream and build upon their exceptional talents.  

  • Igneous will provide resources and training to those who can't afford it.  We also will provide the young artists with their own professional recordings for personal or professional use.
  • Music and Art changes lives, and the dwells deep within the hearts of those children without access to this type of opportunity.  My nephew, Michael, was on the autism spectrum, but wasn't taken seriously by music teachers.   This hurt him deeply.  Luckily, his uncle knew a little something about teaching music, especially vocal music!  I figured if I could teach him, I could teach anyone.
  • This is not my first Crowd-funding campaign.  I ran a successful one in the Spring of 2013 for my third record "My Christmas Wish."  We were able to raise donations for a portion of production and marketing costs.  And it sounds great!

Risks & Challenges

When developing any goal or cold-funding campaign, risk is inherently involved.  Finding the right studio engineers and teachers, for these particular youth, may be challenging since no two snowflakes are identical, and temperaments vary.  Once the initial equipment is purchased, the foundation will move into a brick and morter space, and begin teaching it's first new artists selected by applications.  We feel it is important not to overload ourselves since many of these kids and young adults will require more comprehensive training and lesson times. 

I personally have my Bachelor of Arts and an Artist Diploma in Music, including three years of teaching vocal lessons, and one year as a middle and high school music teacher.  I also have a Master in Business Management.


Other Ways You Can Help

We are aware that some of you may not be able to simply donate to this campaign, and that is completely understandable.  We just ask that you share the link with family and friends.  You can do this through email and social media (Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, etc).  Also there are a number of convenient Indiegogo share tools!

training in the musical or art form of their choice (i.e. instrumental, vocal, painting or woodworking, etc.).
We
inspire to provide the joy of music and art to youth, empower those with an interest
in an artistic vocation, and create a new generation of artists.
Igneous Foundation
seeks to provide or
subsidize the necessary instruments, training and supplies of which an artist
could not readily afford.
Igneous Foundation
is dedicated to the
late Michael Evans Boyd III, who in preceding his passing, and despite his personal special needs challenges, dreamed of such a facility
where children and young adults, like him, could flourish in a world of music
and colors.  He did not see
limitations in people, nor did he discriminate, and neither will The Foundation.

   What We Need & What You Get
We are asking for $10,500 to pay for the minimum musical recording and art materials we will need to furnish a professional quality music program.  The money will specifically go toward the following: 



1. Two Roland F-20-CB | 88 Key Acoustic Touch
Digital Piano Contemporary Black 
2. Two Apple MacBook Pros MB990LL/A 13.3-Inch
Laptops  
3. Pro Tools - A
Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) - Studio Engineering Program
4. An Audio Interface
5. Microphones
6. Microphone Stands
7. Studio Monitors
8. Audio Cables
9. Headphones
10. Pop Filters
11.  Acoustic Treatment
12. Reflection Filters
13. Studio Monitor Stands
14. An Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS)
15. Software Plugins
16. Virtual Instruments
17. A MIDI Controller
18. A DAW Remote
19. A Control Surface
20. Studio Rack Mounts
21. A Power Conditioner
22. A Microphone Preamp
23. A Headphone Amp
24. A Monitor Management System
25. Direct Boxes
26. Snake Cables
27. Digital Converters
28. Digital Master Clocks
29. Analog Hardware
*A variety of new and used woodwind, brass, string, and percussion instruments will be purchased for student use.
**Arts supplies will include paint supplies and woodworking materials (for bird houses and dog houses, because Michael loved being a carpenter).
***In case the entire goal is not reached, any and all donations will go toward the Foundation's costs.

The Impact
 Many special needs and displaced children are at a disadvantage in life, and lack opportunities to pursue their artistic aspirations.  The daily struggles they contend with can take away from their ability to dream and build upon their exceptional talents.    Igneous will provide resources and training to those who can't afford it.  We also will provide the young artists with their own professional recordings for personal or professional use.

 Music and Art changes lives, and the dwells deep within the hearts of those children without access to this type of opportunity.  My nephew, Michael, was on the autism spectrum, but wasn't taken seriously by music teachers.   This hurt him deeply.  Luckily, his uncle knew a little something about teaching music, especially vocal music!  I figured if I could teach him, I could teach anyone.

This is not my first Crowd-funding campaign.  I ran a successful one in the Spring of 2013 for my third record "My Christmas Wish."  We were able to raise donations for a portion of production and marketing costs.  And it sounds great!
   Risks & Challenges When developing any goal or cold-funding campaign, risk is inherently involved.  Finding the right studio engineers and teachers, for these particular youth, may be challenging since no two snowflakes are identical, and temperaments vary.  Once the initial equipment is purchased, the foundation will move into a brick and morter space, and begin teaching it's first new artists selected by applications.  We feel it is important not to overload ourselves since many of these kids and young adults will require more comprehensive training and lesson times. 
I personally have my Bachelor of Arts and an Artist Diploma in Music, including three years of teaching vocal lessons, and one year as a middle and high school music teacher.  I also have a Master in Business Management.
   Other Ways You Can Help We are aware that some of you may not be able to simply donate to this campaign, and that is completely understandable.  We just ask that you share the link with family and friends.  You can do this through email and social media (Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, etc).  Also there are a number of convenient Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Story

Find an Identity serves as an exploration of the many difficulties and internal struggles adolescents face during their high school years. Inspired by my involvement as the director/producer of the award-winning classic high school cult play, "Dog Sees God: Confessions of a Teenage Blockhead," written by Bert V. Royal, this documentary sits down with students, parents, psychologists, and others to discuss the age-old question, "Who am I?"   I take on the role of documentarian, inviting students from my two hometowns, Los Angeles and Long Island, to share their personal stories about experiences with bullying, whether it be as a victim, bystander, or as the bully themselves.The ultimate goal and wish is for Find An Identity to acquire educational distribution and be used as a tool both domestically and globally for all those who have questioned or know someone who has questioned "Who am I?"  

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is $10,000 with a deadline of 30 days. 
Why $10,000 and what will the money be used for?

1.  In March we finish principal photography and have a scheduled three day shoot on the East Coast using specific locations and talent.

2.  The salaries of our East Coast-production coordinator, DP, and cinematographer during our shoot.

3.  Segun Oduolowu will be providing the Find An Identity Documentary with a V.O. narration.  His narration will be a day and a half recording session in a professional recording studio.

See Segun do his thing on Access Hollywood!:

Segun Oduolowu's Access Hollywood Reel

4.  As a part of the post production process, sound mixing, and editing still have to take place.

5.  Creation of original music and licensing of current music available. 

6.  Festival fees, Screeners and Postage. 

7.  Publicity, Advertising and Merchandising.

8.  All pre-production costs and monies already spent on making Find an Identity over the last 18 months.

Why 30 days?
We are now in the post production phase with a deliverable in May (Mental Health Month) and a promise from two PBS stations to air our film.  One on the East Coast and one on the West Coast.  If we don't meet our fundraising goal of $10,000, we will still use the funds donated to offset our production costs. So please please please support.  Whatever you can donate WILL make a difference.  To thank you for your support, we have an array of perks from posters to Executive Producer Credit, to a night out on the town with the team of Cappricielli Inc.     


More About The Project and CappricielliI Inc.

  • Maria Capp, and the Cappricielli, Inc. team is seeking support to expand the scope of this project. This is a rare opportunity to be a part of something with a positive message, and charitable accountability for something that effects our world everyday. The exposure this is sure to gain will draw attention to important issues that are present and prevalent all across our nation.  

  • Maria Capp and The Cappricielli Inc. Team have successfully funded projects like this in the past.  In September 2014 we surpassed our goal of $7,500 using Kickstarter for our short film Taking a Chance on Love raising $8,360.  Taking A Chance On Love Kickstarter

  •  In December 2014 we partnered with The Trevor Project and The Free Your Mind Projects putting on a Production of "Dog Sees God Confessions of A Teenage Blockhead."  Our opening night gala, red carpet event, our silent auction and the journal ads in our playbill all helped us raise awareness for both charities raising a total of $11,000.  Opening Night Gala of Maria Capp's Dog Sees God Confessions of a Teenage Blockhead

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute fiscally.  Help us through word of mouth, helping spread Find An Identity's powerful voice via Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

You can follow us on twitter here:

https://twitter.com/MariaCCapp

Like us on Facebook here:

https://www.facebook.com/cappricielli/

Also check out what you can share under our Indiegogo share tools.  And be sure to share on any form of social media outlet that best suites you.  Every share, tweet, and like counts! =)

story:
Click Here for Italian!

Funding a one-year criminology master

Help me re-train and pursue my life-long dream to study criminology at the University of Sydney. 

WHY CRIMINOLOGY 

Like most kids, I dreamed of becoming a police officer. Unlike most kids, I started reading criminology and psychiatry manuals with pictures and detailed crime scene descriptions at the age of 10. But when I applied for university at the age of 17, I thought I didn't have the guts to make such a mentally challenging job my life. 

I chickened out and picked the easy option: writing. I liked writing, and I figured that by studying journalism I could uncover crimes without being directly involved with them. Except that there was a thing I hadn't considered: social media. 

Now everybody can break the news. Crime is everywhere: from Twitter to Netflix, the success of shows like Making a Murderer, The Jinx or Serial means that talking about crime, filming it or analysing it is no longer a journalist's prerogative.

WHY I WANT TO STUDY CRIMINOLOGY NOW 

If it's easier to know when crimes are happening, now it's the why that we're going after. We want to know why miscarriages of justice happen, or what brings people like us to commit gruesome crimes. 


The "Eureka!" moment came during the life-changing Undergraduate Awards Summit in 2015, where I won an award in the Media and Journalism category thanks to my paper on how the most followed UK journalists on Twitter used the social network to comment on Margaret Thatcher's death. 

During one of the panels, the incredibly inspiring Cyber-Psychologist Dr Mary Aiken said: “We are living through one of the largest unregulated social experiments of all time,” referring to violent social media content's impact on young minds.  

Because crime is so widely available online, for me reporting it and sharing it is no longer enough. I want to go and do something about it, because all of us, especially kids, are exposed to potentially harmful content online.

WHY I'M RE-TRAINING

I've explored what makes people buy a product, read a story or buy into a campaign. Now I want to go to the dark side and explore the reasons behind crime.

After grabbing all the opportunities the fast-paced London life offered me, I now feel confident enough to follow my dreams. Once I finish my master, I'd like to do a PhD looking at what connects crime, the media and the Internet.

WHY AUSTRALIA

I've been living in London for nearly five years and I'm looking forward to a new challenge. 

I've explored studying in the United States, but criminology MAs + PhDs in there can last up to seven years with equally expensive fees. Plus, Sydney Uni hosts the Sydney Institute of Criminology, a hub of research I really want to be involved with. 

HOW MUCH

Despite working hard and being nice to people for over four years in London, I haven't managed to save enough to go back to university. So I'm trying to raise half of the course's fees through crowd-funding, falling back on my parents' help and on part-time jobs to fund the rest of my degree. 

Therefore, this campaign's budget goal is £15,000, which will help towards paying the remaining half of my tuition fees and the initial living expenses while I look for a part-time job in Sydney. 

Here is a break-down of costs required to study at Uni Sydney (click on the figures to see where they come from):

  • Master of Criminology for international students: $38,000 (£19,610.70)
  • Living expenses for a year: $16,800 (£8,669.55)
I'm trying to raise £15,000 ($29,041.9) of which:
  • £9,815,6 ($19,000) will go towards the remaining half of my tuition fees
  • £5,814.4 ($11,254) will go towards initial living expenses such as rent, transport and food

YOU CAN TRUST ME - I PROMISE!

Before you panic, I'm not just a random person asking for money to go to Vegas. I've already been to Vegas, dressed as Hunter S. Thompson.

It was fun, but now I'm an adult. So here's more information about me.

I am not a fake avatar asking for friends, your selfies or your credit card number. You can find me everywhere online. I write for:

  • My blog Couchsurfer Reviews, which I started just before taking off couchsurfing in the USA alone for two months at the end of my BA 
  • On Italian Kingdom, for which I write the "Cosmopolitalian" column, a the lifestyle guide for Italians in London
  • On the Huffington Post 
You can also find me on Twitter and LinkedIn. 

As I mentioned, I have BA in Journalism from City University London. My undergraduate dissertation won the prize for best dissertation in the course.

I presented my paper at media conference ECREA 2014 in Lisbon and at the International Journalism Festival in Perugia, which helped me win the Undergraduate Awards 2015 for Media & Journalism.

In my free time, I listen to heavy metal and write novels. I'm currently looking looking to publish my fourth book, a story about toxic relationships and society's fascination with bad boys... Which you might get a sneak peek of in case you decide to help with this campaign :)

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

Since I've never studied criminology before, it's hard for me to qualify for most course-specific scholarships. The Italian government doesn't offer student loans and neither does the Australian one. 

With a small donation you can help me study my dream degree and take it further: after the MA, I would like to keep pursuing my criminology studies by earning a PhD, focusing on researching new, unexplored areas of cyber-crime and crime and the media. 

WHAT HAPPENS IF I DON'T REACH MY GOAL?

I've chosen Indiegogo's Flexible Funding option, which means I will still be able to save your contributions and use them towards my degree. Which means that you will still be entitled to all the perks your donation gives you the right to.

Risks & Challenges

I realise helping a random girl on Indiegogo fund her degree might not be your number one life goal. 

However, think about it like this. If we ever meet in a bar, you'll probably find out I'm a huge foodie and an amateur cocktail fan. We would probably end up talking lots and buying each other a drink at some point. 

Although a nice craft cocktail or a pint is always very much appreciated, you would have my eternal gratitude - and one of the perks listed here - if you decided to fund my education instead of my passion for alcoholic drinks.

And if university doesn't leave me too broke, we could always go for that drink and that chat at some point. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We've all been there. We've all been too broke to help - I understand.  But if you do have a Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn or an Instagram profile, I'd be eternally grateful if you could share this campaign for the world to see! 

Over and out.

Italiano

Raccolta fondi per un master in criminologia

Sono un'ex pubblicitaria, una blogger e una studentessa di giornalismo che ha smesso di fare scelte facili. Ho deciso di tornare a all'università e seguire il mio sogno: studiare criminologia con un master all'Università di Sydney. 

Perché passare dal giornalismo alla criminologia

Come la maggior parte dei bambini, un tempo sognavo di fare la poliziotta. A differenza di molti bambini però ho iniziato a leggere manuali di criminologia e psichiatria (con tanto di foto dettagliate delle scene del crimine) quando avevo 10 anni. Ma quando a 17 anni ho fatto domanda all'università, non pensavo di aver la forza di intraprendere una carriera così pericolosa. 

Quindi ho preso una scorciatoia: mi sono messa a scrivere. Scrivere mi piaceva, e ho pensato che studiando giornalismo avrei potuto investigare vari crimini senza esservi direttamente coinvolta. Peccato che non avessi messo in conto una cosa: i social media.  

Ora che grazie a Twitter tutti possono essere giornalisti, tutto quello che mi sentivo di poter offrire era un articolo scritto bene. Il crimine è ovunque: da Twitter a Netflix, il successo di programmi come Making a Murderer significa che parlare di crimini vari, filmarli o analizzarli col plastico a Porta a Porta non è più una gran novità. 

Perché voglio studiare criminologia adesso

Se è più facile quando un crimine viene commesso, ora è il perché che ci interessa. Vogliamo sapere le ragioni dietro un'ingiustizia, oppure vogliamo scoprire cosa porta persone come noi a commettere azioni terribili.

La rivelazione è arrivata durante l'Undergraduate Awards Summit nel 2015, dove ho vinto una medaglia per la categoria di media e giornalismo grazie alla mia tesi, che studiava come i giornalisti inglesi hanno usato Twitter per commentare la morte dell'ex primo ministro Margaret Thatcher. 

Durante una delle conferenze, la Dottoressa e Cyber-Psicologa Mary Aiken ha detto: “Stiamo vivendo dentro uno dei più grandi esperimenti sociali senza regole di tutti i tempi,”riferendosi all'impatto dei social media sulla nostra vita.  

Dato che il crimine è così facilmente accessibile online, per me parlarne e scriverne non è più abbastanza. Voglio poterne capire le ragioni e combatterle, perché ora tutti noi, specialmente i più giovani, siamo esposti al crimine.

Perché torno a studiare

Ho studiato cosa porta le persone a comprare un determinato prodotto, a leggere un determinato articolo o a credere in una determinata causa, ma ora voglio passare al lato oscuro: voglio capire le ragioni dietro determinati crimini. 

Grazie a tutte le opportunità che Londra mi ha offerto però, ora mi sento abbastanza forte per seguire i miei sogni: voglio studiare per assicurarmi un dottorato basato sulla ricerca di cosa lega il crimine ai media e a Internet. 

Sfortunatamente lavorare e studiare a Londra per quattro anni non è il modo migliore per risparmiare. In tutto questo tempo, non sono riuscita a mettere da parte abbastanza per pagare il mio master.

Quanto costa

Per questo vorrei raccogliere la metà dei costi del master attraverso il crowd-funding, chiedendo aiuto ai miei genitori e cercando un lavoro part-time per pagare il resto del corso. 

Questa campagna cerca di raccogliere £15,000 (€19026), che mi aiuteranno a pagare ciò che resta delle rate universitarie e le prime spese mentre cerco un lavoretto a Sydney. 

Ecco quanto costa studiare all'Università di Sydney (cliccate sui numeri per credere):

  • Master of Criminology per studenti internazionali: $38,000 (24771,28)
  • Vitto, alloggio e altre spese per un anno: $16,800 (€10430)
Con questa campagna sto cercando di raccogliere £15,000 ($29,041.9) delle quali: 
  • £9,815,6 (€12450) serviranno a pagare ciò che resta della rata universitaria 
  • £5,814.4 (€7375) serviranno per vitto, alloggio etc. 

Perché l'Australia

Ho vissuto a Londra per quasi cinque anni e dopo questa fantastica esperienza vorrei cambiare aria per usufruire di diversi modi di pensare e diversi metodi di ricerca. 

Ho pensato a studiare negli Stati Uniti, ma lì i master possono durare fino a sette anni con rate altrettanto costose. In più, l'Università di Sydney ospita il Sydney Institute of Criminology, un centro di ricerca con cui vorrei tanto collaborare. 

POTETE FIDARVI, VE LO PROMETTO!

Prima che vi spaventiate, non sono una truffatrice in cerca di soldi per andare a Las Vegas. Sono già stata a Las Vegas, vestita in stile Hunter S. Thompson da Paura e Delirio. 

E' stato divertente, ma adesso è ora di parlare seriamente. Eccovi qualche informazione in più su di me. 

Non sono un profilo fake: potete trovarmi ovunque su Internet. Scrivo per:

  • Il mio blog Couchsurfer Reviews, che ho iniziato prima di partire per un viaggio negli Stati Uniti tramite Couchsurfing
  • Su Italian Kingdom, la guida per Italiani all'estero per cui scrivo la rubrica "Cosmopolitalian" con consigli su bar e ristoranti
  • Sulla versione inglese dell'Huffington Post 

Ho una laurea in giornalismo dalla City University di Londra. La mia tesi su come i più seguiti giornalisti inglesi su Twitter hanno usato il social network per commentare la morte dell'ex primo ministro Margaret Thatcher, ha vinto il premio di miglior tesi del corso. 

Ho presentato questa tesi alla conferenza mediatica internazionale ECREA 2014 a Lisbona e al Festival Internazionale del Giornalismo di Perugia, che mi ha aiutato a vincere un premio nella categoria Media e Giornalismo degli Undergraduate Awards 2015.

Nel tempo libero ascolto metal e scrivo romanzi. Sto cercando di pubblicare il mio quarto romanzo, una storia di relazioni malate e l'ossessione che l'industria dell'intrattenimento ha per i bad boys. Date un'occhiata ai premi della campagna di crowd-funding e magari potrete leggerne qualche pagina :)

Perché ho bisogno del vostro aiuto

Non avendo mai studiato criminologia prima, non ho quello che serve per ottenere una borsa di studio. Il governo italiano non offre finanziamenti per studiare all'estero e quello australiano non offre prestiti come quello inglese. 

Con una piccola donazione mi aiutereste a portare avanti il mio sogno, continuando a studiare e, spero, ad assicurarmi un dottorato di ricerca per studiare gli effetti del cybercrime e la relazione tra il crimine e i media.

Cosa succede se non riesco a raccogliere abbastanza soldi?

Ho scelto l'opzione Funding flessibile di Indiegogo, il che significa che potrò comunque tenere le vostre offerte e usarle per finanziare il mio corso. Per voi, questo significa che riuscirete comunque ad ottenere i premi pubblicizzati qui. 

Perché dare i soldi ad una sconosciuta?

Mi rendo conto che aiutare una sconosciuta ad andare all'università non sia il vostro obiettivo numero uno. 

Pensatela così: se un giorno ci vedessimo in un bar, capireste subito che amo cibi particolari e cocktail dalle ricette mirabolanti. Finiremmo a parlare delle tante cose che ci piacciono e ci offriremmo da bere a vicenda. 

Anche se un bicchiere di birra o un cocktail con l'ombrellino non guastano mai, vi sarei eternamente grata se invece di incoraggiarmi a bere mi incoraggiaste a studiare con una piccola donazione (anche solo £5). 

E se l'università non mi spenna troppo, possiamo sempre farcelo quel drink. 

Altri modi in cui potete darmi una mano

A volte non è proprio possibile spendere soldi. Lo capisco: ci sono passata. Ma se avete un profilo Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn Instagram, me lo date un piccolo share? 

Passo e chiudo.
