Living expenses for a year: $16,800 (£8,669.55)



I'm trying to raise £15,000 ($29,041.9) of which:

£9,815,6 ($19,000) will go towards the remaining half of my tuition fees


£5,814.4 ($11,254) will go towards initial living expenses such as rent, transport and food



YOU CAN TRUST ME - I PROMISE!

Before you panic, I'm not just a random person asking for money to go to Vegas. I've already been to Vegas, dressed as Hunter S. Thompson.

It was fun, but now I'm an adult. So here's more information about me.
I am not a fake avatar asking for friends, your selfies or your credit card number. You can find me everywhere online. I write for:

My blog Couchsurfer Reviews, which I started just before taking off couchsurfing in the USA alone for two months at the end of my BA 
On Italian Kingdom, for which I write the "Cosmopolitalian" column, a the lifestyle guide for Italians in London
On the Huffington Post 

You can also find me on Twitter and LinkedIn. 

As I mentioned, I have BA in Journalism from City University London. My undergraduate dissertation won the prize for best dissertation in the course.


I presented my paper at media conference ECREA 2014 in Lisbon and at the International Journalism Festival in Perugia, which helped me win the Undergraduate Awards 2015 for Media & Journalism.


In my free time, I listen to heavy metal and write novels. I'm currently looking looking to publish my fourth book, a story about toxic relationships and society's fascination with bad boys... Which you might get a sneak peek of in case you decide to help with this campaign :)
WHY I NEED YOUR HELP
Since I've never studied criminology before, it's hard for me to qualify for most course-specific scholarships. The Italian government doesn't offer student loans and neither does the Australian one. 
With a small donation you can help me study my dream degree and take it further: after the MA, I would like to keep pursuing my criminology studies by earning a PhD, focusing on researching new, unexplored areas of cyber-crime and crime and the media. 
WHAT HAPPENS IF I DON'T REACH MY GOAL?

I've chosen Indiegogo's Flexible Funding option, which means I will still be able to save your contributions and use them towards my degree. Which means that you will still be entitled to all the perks your donation gives you the right to.

    Risks & Challenges I realise helping a random girl on Indiegogo fund her degree might not be your number one life goal. 
However, think about it like this. If we ever meet in a bar, you'll probably find out I'm a huge foodie and an amateur cocktail fan. We would probably end up talking lots and buying each other a drink at some point. 
Although a nice craft cocktail or a pint is always very much appreciated, you would have my eternal gratitude - and one of the perks listed here - if you decided to fund my education instead of my passion for alcoholic drinks.


And if university doesn't leave me too broke, we could always go for that drink and that chat at some point. 
    Other Ways You Can Help We've all been there. We've all been too broke to help - I understand.  But if you do have a Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn or an Instagram profile, I'd be eternally grateful if you could share this campaign for the world to see!   Over and out.ItalianoRaccolta fondi per un master in criminologiaSono un'ex pubblicitaria, una blogger e una studentessa di giornalismo che ha smesso di fare scelte facili. Ho deciso di tornare a all'università e seguire il mio sogno: studiare criminologia con un master all'Università di Sydney. Perché passare dal giornalismo alla criminologiaCome la maggior parte dei bambini, un tempo sognavo di fare la poliziotta. A differenza di molti bambini però ho iniziato a leggere manuali di criminologia e psichiatria (con tanto di foto dettagliate delle scene del crimine) quando avevo 10 anni. Ma quando a 17 anni ho fatto domanda all'università, non pensavo di aver la forza di intraprendere una carriera così pericolosa. Quindi ho preso una scorciatoia: mi sono messa a scrivere. Scrivere mi piaceva, e ho pensato che studiando giornalismo avrei potuto investigare vari crimini senza esservi direttamente coinvolta. Peccato che non avessi messo in conto una cosa: i social media.  Ora che grazie a Twitter tutti possono essere giornalisti, tutto quello che mi sentivo di poter offrire era un articolo scritto bene. Il crimine è ovunque: da Twitter a Netflix, il successo di programmi come Making a Murderer significa che parlare di crimini vari, filmarli o analizzarli col plastico a Porta a Porta non è più una gran novità. Perché voglio studiare criminologia adessoSe è più facile quando un crimine viene commesso, ora è il perché che ci interessa. Vogliamo sapere le ragioni dietro un'ingiustizia, oppure vogliamo scoprire cosa porta persone come noi a commettere azioni terribili.La rivelazione è arrivata durante l'Undergraduate Awards Summit nel 2015, dove ho vinto una medaglia per la categoria di media e giornalismo grazie alla mia tesi, che studiava come i giornalisti inglesi hanno usato Twitter per commentare la morte dell'ex primo ministro Margaret Thatcher. Durante una delle conferenze, la Dottoressa e Cyber-Psicologa Mary Aiken ha detto: “Stiamo vivendo dentro uno dei più grandi esperimenti sociali senza regole di tutti i tempi,”riferendosi all'impatto dei social media sulla nostra vita.  Dato che il crimine è così facilmente accessibile online, per me parlarne e scriverne non è più abbastanza. Voglio poterne capire le ragioni e combatterle, perché ora tutti noi, specialmente i più giovani, siamo esposti al crimine.Perché torno a studiareHo studiato cosa porta le persone a comprare un determinato prodotto, a leggere un determinato articolo o a credere in una determinata causa, ma ora voglio passare al lato oscuro: voglio capire le ragioni dietro determinati crimini. Grazie a tutte le opportunità che Londra mi ha offerto però, ora mi sento abbastanza forte per seguire i miei sogni: voglio studiare per assicurarmi un dottorato basato sulla ricerca di cosa lega il crimine ai media e a Internet. Sfortunatamente lavorare e studiare a Londra per quattro anni non è il modo migliore per risparmiare. In tutto questo tempo, non sono riuscita a mettere da parte abbastanza per pagare il mio master.Quanto costaPer questo vorrei raccogliere la metà dei costi del master attraverso il crowd-funding, chiedendo aiuto ai miei genitori e cercando un lavoro part-time per pagare il resto del corso. Questa campagna cerca di raccogliere £15,000 (€19026), che mi aiuteranno a pagare ciò che resta delle rate universitarie e le prime spese mentre cerco un lavoretto a Sydney. Ecco quanto costa studiare all'Università di Sydney (cliccate sui numeri per credere):
Master of Criminology per studenti internazionali: $38,000 (24771,28)
Vitto, alloggio e altre spese per un anno: $16,800 (€10430)

Con questa campagna sto cercando di raccogliere £15,000 ($29,041.9) delle quali: 
£9,815,6 (€12450) serviranno a pagare ciò che resta della rata universitaria 
£5,814.4 (€7375) serviranno per vitto, alloggio etc. 


Perché l'Australia
Ho vissuto a Londra per quasi cinque anni e dopo questa fantastica esperienza vorrei cambiare aria per usufruire di diversi modi di pensare e diversi metodi di ricerca. Ho pensato a studiare negli Stati Uniti, ma lì i master possono durare fino a sette anni con rate altrettanto costose. In più, l'Università di Sydney ospita il Sydney Institute of Criminology, un centro di ricerca con cui vorrei tanto collaborare. 

POTETE FIDARVI, VE LO PROMETTO!
Prima che vi spaventiate, non sono una truffatrice in cerca di soldi per andare a Las Vegas. Sono già stata a Las Vegas, vestita in stile Hunter S. Thompson da Paura e Delirio. 

E' stato divertente, ma adesso è ora di parlare seriamente. Eccovi qualche informazione in più su di me. 
Non sono un profilo fake: potete trovarmi ovunque su Internet. Scrivo per:

Il mio blog Couchsurfer Reviews, che ho iniziato prima di partire per un viaggio negli Stati Uniti tramite Couchsurfing
Su Italian Kingdom, la guida per Italiani all'estero per cui scrivo la rubrica "Cosmopolitalian" con consigli su bar e ristoranti
Sulla versione inglese dell'Huffington Post 

Ho una laurea in giornalismo dalla City University di Londra. La mia tesi su come i più seguiti giornalisti inglesi su Twitter hanno usato il social network per commentare la morte dell'ex primo ministro Margaret Thatcher, ha vinto il premio di miglior tesi del corso. 

Ho presentato questa tesi alla conferenza mediatica internazionale ECREA 2014 a Lisbona e al Festival Internazionale del Giornalismo di Perugia, che mi ha aiutato a vincere un premio nella categoria Media e Giornalismo degli Undergraduate Awards 2015.

Nel tempo libero ascolto metal e scrivo romanzi. Sto cercando di pubblicare il mio quarto romanzo, una storia di relazioni malate e l'ossessione che l'industria dell'intrattenimento ha per i bad boys. Date un'occhiata ai premi della campagna di crowd-funding e magari potrete leggerne qualche pagina :)
Perché ho bisogno del vostro aiuto
Non avendo mai studiato criminologia prima, non ho quello che serve per ottenere una borsa di studio. Il governo italiano non offre finanziamenti per studiare all'estero e quello australiano non offre prestiti come quello inglese. 
Con una piccola donazione mi aiutereste a portare avanti il mio sogno, continuando a studiare e, spero, ad assicurarmi un dottorato di ricerca per studiare gli effetti del cybercrime e la relazione tra il crimine e i media.
Cosa succede se non riesco a raccogliere abbastanza soldi?
Ho scelto l'opzione Funding flessibile di Indiegogo, il che significa che potrò comunque tenere le vostre offerte e usarle per finanziare il mio corso. Per voi, questo significa che riuscirete comunque ad ottenere i premi pubblicizzati qui. 
Perché dare i soldi ad una sconosciuta?Mi rendo conto che aiutare una sconosciuta ad andare all'università non sia il vostro obiettivo numero uno. Pensatela così: se un giorno ci vedessimo in un bar, capireste subito che amo cibi particolari e cocktail dalle ricette mirabolanti. Finiremmo a parlare delle tante cose che ci piacciono e ci offriremmo da bere a vicenda. Anche se un bicchiere di birra o un cocktail con l'ombrellino non guastano mai, vi sarei eternamente grata se invece di incoraggiarmi a bere mi incoraggiaste a studiare con una piccola donazione (anche solo £5). E se l'università non mi spenna troppo, possiamo sempre farcelo quel drink. Altri modi in cui potete darmi una manoA volte non è proprio possibile spendere soldi. Lo capisco: ci sono passata. Ma se avete un profilo Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn Instagram, me lo date un piccolo share? Passo e chiudo.

story:
Effective OSGi

OSGi is the most complete and mature platform for developing modular software systems. With new tools and a simplified programming model, it is now much more approachable than in the past. With this book, I will show how to quickly accelerate your productivity using the latest techniques and tools.

The provisional title of the book is "Effective OSGi". It will not be a massive tome, describing in detail all of the low-level APIs. Rather, it will be a concise and opinionated guide to what you most need to know.


About Me

I started using OSGi in 2003 and since then have become widely known as an expert and spokesperson for the technology.

Many years ago I started writing a book "OSGi in Practice". The early draft of this book was popular, but it took the wrong approach. By starting with the lowest level details it failed to convey the spirit and beauty of OSGi. It did however demonstrate that I can write, and explain complicated concepts in an accessible way.

I have long planned to rewrite "OSGi in Practice". The time is right now, but I am busy and I have a family to feed. I am running this campaign in order to allow me to take a break from my usual commitments in order to finish the new book.


Why Now?

There is a huge opportunity for developers who understand OSGi and are able to take advantage of it. The trends driving this are:

  • The Internet of Things ("IoT"), which means that code must run on an increasingly wide range of devices, and must be easier to release, update and maintain. OSGi is very well suited to this new environment – this is where OSGi started, and it has always had a strong focus on scalability: both scaling up to massive deployments but also scaling down to small devices.
  • Cloud – Running your application in the cloud means you need to manage the delivery of the right software components to the right nodes. OSGi offers powerful infrastructure for managing this, in much more flexible ways than traditional script-heavy, push-based operations tools. Also the separate parts of your application need to discover and talk to each other – OSGi addresses this with its Remote Services specification.
  • Microservices – A recent trend that encourages fast, independent delivery of small units of code into production. This maps well onto the delivery model that OSGi has always supported, which together with Remote Services makes OSGi an excellent implementation technology for microservices.
  • OSGi Release 6 – The latest release of OSGi includes new specifications for web development, and improves and simplifies some existing specifications (such as Declarative Services). These make the development of OSGi applications significantly easier and faster.


What About...?

... Other OSGi Books

OSGi is mature and many books have been published about it. Some of them were good for their time, but are now out-of-date and confusing. There is a need for a new book that cuts through all the many possible ways to do things and shows the right and easy way.

... Java 9 Modules (Jigsaw)?

The Java 9 module system (commonly known as Jigsaw) does not present an existential threat to OSGi. In fact they are highly complementary technologies. In my book I will explain why it still makes sense to use OSGi for application modularity post-Jigsaw, and how to make them work together.


Risks & Challenges

Not every developer is cut out to be a writer. I can write – as shown by my previous book and my blog – and I know and care a lot about this technology. I really want to write this book to help people understand OSGi and use it to improve their code.

The main risk for the campaign is not reaching the funding goal. Since the purpose of the funding is to fund my time while writing, it will simply take a little longer to complete in this case.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this campaign, and please provide feedback:
  • What topics should it cover?
  • What kind of examples should be shown?
  • Aside from the obvious (copies of the book), what kinds of perks should be offered?

story:
WHY

Far too many Cambodian children lack access to the kind of education that is necessary for a productive and fulfilling life:

These statistics do not reflect the true potential of our children. Every child in Cambodia can and should achieve at a much higher level. What these statistics tell us is that there is a deeply systemic problem that severely diminishes the educational and life opportunities of Cambodian children, especially those growing up in low-income communities.

WHAT

We believe that the key ingredient to solving this problem is leadership—a local force of leaders who believe deeply that it is possible to put children growing up in poverty on a life-changing path, who know what it will take to do so, and who have the ability, experience and conviction to make it happen.

Our mission is to enlist the nation's exceptional young leaders in an effort to expand educational opportunities for all children in Cambodia.

HOW

Our solution starts with the best and brightest Cambodians who are passionate about making a difference in education. We recruit recent top university graduates, then train and place them in classrooms in high-needs schools for two years with on-going support to effect sustainable change in the form of:

1.  Increased number of high-quality and committed teachers in low-income communities across the country

2.  Improved student achievement including academic outcome, mindsets, and aspirations needed to access life-changing opportunities

3.  A future pool of lifelong leaders with conviction, experience, and commitment to expand education opportunities for all children in Cambodia

In the process we will build a coalition of stakeholders – public and private – to sustainably address educational inequity which is the most pressing problem facing this country.


Teach For Cambodia's Program Model


IMPACT AND GROWTH PLAN 

By 2018, we plan to place 80 outstanding teachers who will be serving 16,000 students across 25 schools.

We will begin with an initial cohort of 20 Fellows in the 2016-2017 school year then grow the number of incoming Fellows by 50% each year for the next three years.



FUNDRAISING GOAL

We aim to raise $40,000 by May 15th, 2016. Your support will be instrumental in helping us achieve the following:

1.  Launch recruitment activities in May 2016

2.  Select and matriculate 20 Fellows who will start teaching in November 2016

3.  Reach 4,000 students in 7 schools in the 2016-2017 academic year

4.  Unlock further funding from corporate partners and individual donors

PROGRESS TO-DATE

Over the past two years, we have achieved several important milestones:

1.  April 2014: First contact with the the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sport (MoEYS) and Teach For All Global Network


2.  September 2014-Present: Extensive consultation with MoEYS, Teach For All, and close to 100 other stakeholders including school teachers and leaders, students and parents, education specialists, universities, local and international NGOs, development partners, and potential funders

3.  October 2015: Obtained a letter of support from the Minister of Education, Youth and Sport


4.  March 2016: Secured $40,000 in funding commitment from three private donors

WHAT'S NEXT

With your support, we will complete our first round of fundraising. Our next priorities are:

1.  May-August 2016:  Recruitment and selection of Fellows

2.  June-August 2016: Evaluation and selection of placement schools

4.  September-October 2016: Training Institute 

5.  November 2016: Fellows begin teaching in classrooms


WHO

story:
Support the launch of Teen Leadership Courses (TLC), a curriculum in stress-busting meditations, communication & conflict resolution techniques, facilitation & presentation skills, and diversity training through media literacy. This curriculum will be taught in three venues: 

  1. Monthly online membership program with weekly videos and private membership discussion group, beginning on Oct. 31st, 2016.
  2. An online mentorship program: Weekly assignments, webinars & partner chats, and personalized feedback & coaching sessions tailored to each teen's strengths, challenges, and goals. The first pilot program runs for 6 months. Applications begin at Thanksgiving, with weekly assignments January-June 2017. 
  3. In-person workshops for teens, tweens, and parents in Nevada City, CA. 3, 6, or 9 month programming. Every 3rd month for teens will be an overnight, culminating in a wilderness trip experience.  

You know what it's like to have a big vision, yet be caught in the cycle of doing other things to make ends meet? This campaign will help get my vision on its feet, spread the word, and get the first month's videos into the lives of teenagers that can use them to better their lives. 


About Xylem Larla Dey and TLC:

  • While in grad school, I worked for five years with teens at Camp Augusta, a residential summer camp in Nevada City, CA. For my last two years, I ran their established teen leadership program online and in person. I augmented their curriculum to reflect my social and environmental justice background, and in response to teen feedback. I've made more adjustments, and I am getting ready to launch that program into the world as Teen Leadership Courses. Because what parent doesn't want to give their teen some TLC? 
  • In 2015, after 20 years working with youth, I completed a Masters in Education. For my Masters Project, I designed an alternative environmental high school design after researching at four established high schools with alternative techniques like service learning, apprenticeships, wilderness education, and all-school meetings. 
  • My longterm goal is to create and consult for new high schools based on the 4 A's: Academics, Arts, Apprenticeships, and Adventures. TLC's online curriculum is building towards the high school vision, generating content which will be included in the programming and culture of future high schools. 
  • My goal is to get at least 333 people to give $33, each donation sponsoring a teenager for their first month in the online membership of weekly videos and a private discussion group. This will create a vibrant community of 300+ teenagers practicing meditations and communication tools, gaining skills to launch their ideas into the world!


The $11,000 budget in this campaign goal will provide:

  • $5000 towards curriculum development
  • $3000 for business startup fees: taxes, website fees, and space rentals
  • $1000 for marketing
  • $1000 for quality documentation equipment
  • $500 towards business education
  • $500 to Indigogo fees. 
Every supporter who gives $33 or more gets: 
  • Access for the teen of their choice to their first monthly membership, including an instructional video every week, with practices and research to learn and pursue, and a private discussion group with the other 300+ teens practicing leadership skills together online! 
Other Education & Mentorship Perks include: 
  • $60 for attendance at an evening workshop
  • $100 for an hour of personal coaching with a teen or parent
  • $500 for enrollment in 6 months of monthly teen workshops
  • $900 for a 6 month personalized online teen mentorship program
  • $2000 for a 10-person, 4-hour private parenting or teen workshop   

Business education, business startup fees, and curriculum development are top funding priority in this budget, while secondary goals include marketing and equipment. Stretch goals if we meet and exceed our goal include website development, reference books, and inclusive sex educator training.   


The Impact

From volunteering at library storytimes as a child, to theater outreach in college, and 10 years in the non-profit environmental education sector including 4 years on Common Vision's Fruit Tree Tour: I've been clear for a long time that my life's purpose is working with youth. After 5 years working with teens in leadership at Camp Augusta, I am currently teaching half-time at the Nevada City School of the Arts, and working odd jobs to help make the rest of my ends meet. This campaign will allow me to work full-time with youth, which means the world to me, and to launch into the lives of teens who need some TLC. Who doesn't need TLC?  

  • For 2 years, I directed and further developed a teen leadership program for Camp Augusta, including a 9 month online mentorship program and three weeks of in-person training. I've been adapting the curriculum for a larger audience, because I see how beneficial these skills are for teens' lives. I've mentored 22 co-ed teens and 17 young women counselors, and my offerings as a teacher and mentor have grown in capacity and knowledge from their honest feedback about philosophies, content, and approach.

Here are some words I've received from teens I've mentored in the past. Help me spread my wings, to nurture more teens and help them fly:

  • "I want to thank you so much for this beautiful gift you have given me. I don't think I have ever received such thorough feedback and thought. I can see the amount of time and effort and thoughtfulness that has gone into this, and I have so much appreciation for everything you have done throughout the course of this last year." 
  • "Thank you for the guidance, love and support.  Thank you for being a mentor and inspiration in my life...  I have seen a visible difference in myself over these past 10 months..." 
  • "NVC and clean communication have made a huge impact on me.  I wasn't expecting to be so changed by these philosophies.  They've impacted my family, friends, and peers.  I see people at school reaching out to me because they feel safe when they are around me... You have inspired me to live with more empathy and compassion, not only towards others but towards myself." 
  • "You are a mentor and role model in my life, and I would be a very different person if I hadn't spent all these months learning from you.  I have seen... a visible impact in my life, and the lives of those around me.  I want to thank you for the endless hours of feedback, work, emails, and love that you gave to this program.  I love and miss you very much!"


Challenges and Risks

All startups have inherent risk. I believe this venture will fly because the curriculum is tried and true, refined by the feedback of teens and parents, and I have a large base of support among families in my hometown of 12 years. I do anticipate some challenges, and here are the plans to address them:
  • Business Education: I went to school for education, not for business. Starting a business is a new leap for me. I've been and will continue to receive free support from the Small Business Development Center of California, and will seek other allies and alliances. 
  • Business Costs: This campaign is a drop in the bucket of what it costs to run a business. I plan to apply for grants for startup businesses and female entrepreneurs. Feel free to point me towards some good ones! 
  • Low Enrollment: Certain workshops and programming will need a minimum enrollment to be financially sustainable over a longer term. The marketing budget will be tailored to promoting enrollment in courses and workshops, and free content generation will continue build the TLC mailing list to expand the reach of eligible and interested families.
  • Website Management: I'm blessed with the support of a website designer who believes in this vision and has experience running online courses. If the needs of teenleadership.org should exceed what I am able to do and what he is able to give, we will need to find a new website manager. The campaign budget will be adjusted accordingly, and if/when we are able to hit stretch funding goals they will go towards website support.
  • Challenging Feedback: While my feedback has been mainly positive, I've learned when working with teens in an honest way that encourages them towards growth, there's can be pushback from teens or parents. I have experience acknowledging and learning from this feedback as an opportunity for growth, taking it to heart, and allowing it to let me grow as an educator and gain more training when necessary. 
  • Accessibility Goals: Making TLC programming available for all youth and families who need it is at the forefront of my mind. While the first round of programming will be tuition-based while TLC is established, I aim to qualify as a vendor to offer curriculum packages and workshops through schools, and apply for grant funding for scholarships to support access for all students regardless of financial status.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can financially contribute, but you can still help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this Indigogo campaign, especially to families with teens and tweens who may be interested in TLC!
  • Like and share my facebook posts, and follow Teen Leadership Courses on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and the blog on teenleadership.org:
  • Subscribe to the TLC mailing list! http://eepurl.com/b0UgDL   THANKS and LOVE! Your support means the world to me.

Thank you for helping me be of service with my gifts. 

For the Youth and For the Earth,

~Xylem Larla Dey
story_txt:
Support the launch of Teen Leadership Courses (TLC), a curriculum in stress-busting meditations, communication & conflict resolution techniques, facilitation & presentation skills, and diversity training through media literacy. This curriculum will be taught in three venues: 



Monthly online membership program with weekly videos and private membership discussion group, beginning on Oct. 31st, 2016.


An online mentorship program: Weekly assignments, webinars & partner chats, and personalized feedback & coaching sessions tailored to each teen's strengths, challenges, and goals. The first pilot program runs for 6 months. Applications begin at Thanksgiving, with weekly assignments January-June 2017. 


In-person workshops for teens, tweens, and parents in Nevada City, CA. 3, 6, or 9 month programming. Every 3rd month for teens will be an overnight, culminating in a wilderness trip experience.  


You know what it's like to have a big vision, yet be caught in the cycle of doing other things to make ends meet? This campaign will help get my vision on its feet, spread the word, and get the first month's videos into the lives of teenagers that can use them to better their lives. 


About Xylem Larla Dey and TLC:
  
While in grad school, I worked for five years with teens at Camp Augusta, a residential summer camp in Nevada City, CA. For my last two years, I ran their established teen leadership program online and in person. I augmented their curriculum to reflect my social and environmental justice background, and in response to teen feedback. I've made more adjustments, and I am getting ready to launch that program into the world as Teen Leadership Courses. Because what parent doesn't want to give their teen some TLC? 

In 2015, after 20 years working with youth, I completed a Masters in Education. For my Masters Project, I designed an alternative environmental high school design after researching at four established high schools with alternative techniques like service learning, apprenticeships, wilderness education, and all-school meetings. 
My longterm goal is to create and consult for new high schools based on the 4 A's: Academics, Arts, Apprenticeships, and Adventures. TLC's online curriculum is building towards the high school vision, generating content which will be included in the programming and culture of future high schools.  My goal is to get at least 333 people to give $33, each donation sponsoring a teenager for their first month in the online membership of weekly videos and a private discussion group. This will create a vibrant community of 300+ teenagers practicing meditations and communication tools, gaining skills to launch their ideas into the world!
   


The $11,000 budget in this campaign goal will provide:
$5000 towards curriculum development
$3000 for business startup fees: taxes, website fees, and space rentals
$1000 for marketing
$1000 for quality documentation equipment
$500 towards business education
$500 to Indigogo fees. 
Every supporter who gives $33 or more gets: Access for the teen of their choice to their first monthly membership, including an instructional video every week, with practices and research to learn and pursue, and a private discussion group with the other 300+ teens practicing leadership skills together online! 
Other Education & Mentorship Perks include: $60 for attendance at an evening workshop
$100 for an hour of personal coaching with a teen or parent
$500 for enrollment in 6 months of monthly teen workshops
$900 for a 6 month personalized online teen mentorship program
$2000 for a 10-person, 4-hour private parenting or teen workshop   

Business education, business startup fees, and curriculum development are top funding priority in this budget, while secondary goals include marketing and equipment. Stretch goals if we meet and exceed our goal include website development, reference books, and inclusive sex educator training.   






   The Impact

From volunteering at library storytimes as a child, to theater outreach in college, and 10 years in the non-profit environmental education sector including 4 years on Common Vision's Fruit Tree Tour: I've been clear for a long time that my life's purpose is working with youth. After 5 years working with teens in leadership at Camp Augusta, I am currently teaching half-time at the Nevada City School of the Arts, and working odd jobs to help make the rest of my ends meet. This campaign will allow me to work full-time with youth, which means the world to me, and to launch into the lives of teens who need some TLC. Who doesn't need TLC?  


For 2 years, I directed and further developed a teen leadership program for Camp Augusta, including a 9 month online mentorship program and three weeks of in-person training. I've been adapting the curriculum for a larger audience, because I see how beneficial these skills are for teens' lives. I've mentored 22 co-ed teens and 17 young women counselors, and my offerings as a teacher and mentor have grown in capacity and knowledge from their honest feedback about philosophies, content, and approach.

Here are some words I've received from teens I've mentored in the past. Help me spread my wings, to nurture more teens and help them fly:  "I want to thank you so much for this beautiful gift you have given me. I don't think I have ever received such thorough feedback and thought. I can see the amount of time and effort and thoughtfulness that has gone into this, and I have so much appreciation for everything you have done throughout the course of this last year."  "Thank you for the guidance, love and support.  Thank you for being a mentor and inspiration in my life...  I have seen a visible difference in myself over these past 10 months..." 
"NVC and clean communication have made a huge impact on me.  I wasn't expecting to be so changed by these philosophies.  They've impacted my family, friends, and peers.  I see people at school reaching out to me because they feel safe when they are around me... You have inspired me to live with more empathy and compassion, not only towards others but towards myself." 
 "You are a mentor and role model in my life, and I would be a very different person if I hadn't spent all these months learning from you.  I have seen... a visible impact in my life, and the lives of those around me.  I want to thank you for the endless hours of feedback, work, emails, and love that you gave to this program.  I love and miss you very much!"




Challenges and Risks


All startups have inherent risk. I believe this venture will fly because the curriculum is tried and true, refined by the feedback of teens and parents, and I have a large base of support among families in my hometown of 12 years. I do anticipate some challenges, and here are the plans to address them:

Low Enrollment: Certain workshops and programming will need a minimum enrollment to be financially sustainable over a longer term. The marketing budget will be tailored to promoting enrollment in courses and workshops, and free content generation will continue build the TLC mailing list to expand the reach of eligible and interested families.

Website Management: I'm blessed with the support of a website designer who believes in this vision and has experience running online courses. If the needs of teenleadership.org should exceed what I am able to do and what he is able to give, we will need to find a new website manager. The campaign budget will be adjusted accordingly, and if/when we are able to hit stretch funding goals they will go towards website support.

Challenging Feedback: While my feedback has been mainly positive, I've learned when working with teens in an honest way that encourages them towards growth, there's can be pushback from teens or parents. I have experience acknowledging and learning from this feedback as an opportunity for growth, taking it to heart, and allowing it to let me grow as an educator and gain more training when necessary. 

Accessibility Goals: Making TLC programming available for all youth and families who need it is at the forefront of my mind. While the first round of programming will be tuition-based while TLC is established, I aim to qualify as a vendor to offer curriculum packages and workshops through schools, and apply for grant funding for scholarships to support access for all students regardless of financial status.

Get the word out and make some noise about this Indigogo campaign, especially to families with teens and tweens who may be interested in TLC! 
Like and share my facebook posts, and follow Teen Leadership Courses on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and the blog on teenleadership.org:

Subscribe to the TLC mailing list! http://eepurl.com/b0UgDL   THANKS and LOVE! Your support means the world to me.

story:
Short Summary

Funding Request: A 20-year old performing arts institution needs $17,500 for operating expenses, vehicle repair and facility improvements for our 2015/2016 after-school program for Washington, DC residents, 6-12 years of age. 

Budget: Facilities Maintenance & Repair: $5,000. Architectural designs for studio renovation for better use of space = $1,250; Performance equipment purchase and repair = $4,250; Repairs to donated vehicle used to transport equipment to performances and in and out of storage as needed = $3,500; Lighting for exterior of building to showcase mural $1,000; New exterior signage $2,500

Our Challenge: To maintain our studio space in a rapidly developing and popular living and recreation destination with roots in historic performing arts success, in the nation's capital.

Mission: “African and Chinese Traditional Cultural Arts of kung fu, lion and dragon dance, and drumming train participants in strength, self-reliance, personal responsibility, and excellence as a means to prepare them to live a meaningful life. 

VISION: HTCMLI has staying power because of it's support among city leaders and community participants, and as a result has become the region’s leading center of excellence for youth development. HTCMLI is entering a more mature phase to compete with monied interests that are less interested in arts and more interested in land development. 

History: The Hung Tao Choy Mei Leadership Institute was founded in 1995 by Abdur-Rahim Muhammad a native Washingtonian. President Muhammad opened the Institute at 1351 U St. NW at a time when many home owners and businesses were hesitant to invest in the area and began teaching children few thought worthy of their attention. He trained these children and sponsored their trips (over 50 local children and youth) to competitions in Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong and Mainland China and they returned home as kung fu champions holding numerous gold, silver, and bronze medals for their efforts and huge boosts to their pride and self-esteem. The Institute is recognized worldwide as one of the leading traditional martial arts organizations in the United States. “The Council of the District of Columbia recognizes and supports the Hung Tao Choy Mei Leadership Institute and in celebration of this milestone declares November 3, 2009, as the “Hung Tao Choy Mei Leadership Institute's Lion Dance and Kung Fu Champions Recognition Day” in the District of Columbia.”

The Leadership Institute produces the annual Paul Robeson "Here I Stand" Award Gala at the Lincoln Theater featuring world class entertainers and scholars such as Harry Belafonte, Danny Glover, Paul Robeson Jr., Dick Gregory, Dr. John Hope Franklin, Judith Jamison, Rita Moreno, Spike Lee, and hip hop legends “Common” and Chuck D of Public Enemy the hip hop group recently inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame. The Institute has been providing health support for DC children since 1995 and nutrition support as well as music and athletic training since 2007.

The Leadership Institute has provided children and older youth with an after- school program 5 days per week, Saturday morning and afternoon classes, full day summer camps for 50 children, performance opportunities at the Verizon Center during half time for Washington Mystics, Kennedy Center, Lincoln Theatre, Black Cat Nightclub, H Street Festival, Fiesta Asia, Funk Parade, and nearly 100 additional events around the Washington, DC metropolitan area.

The Leadership Institute has implemented a strategic framework which revolves around our integrated core values of Diversity, Creativity, Unity, Activism, Trust, Tolerance, Authenticity and Accountability. We utilize an asset based approach and shun the punitive. We focus on strengths and positive outcomes; youth voice and engagement; strategies that include all youth including those with physical and emotional challenges; community involvement and collaboration; strive to build long term commitments. Training at Hung Tao Choy Mei is “Preparation for Living a Meaningful Life.”

story:
Thank you for coming this far. For deciding to make a contribution to the Literary Freedom Project, a Bronx-based nonprofit arts organization. 

If you are grappling with indecision, ask yourself --why did I come this far, what peaked my interest to click to this point? Most likely you're a lover of books and  education. You've realized that there are cultural gaps in your life, or the lives of your neighbors, that our mission helps to fulfill. Now is the time to give!

In 2015, the Literary Freedom Project:

  • published three print issues of Mosaic that featured essays, book reviews, and interviews with such notable writers as Saeed Jones, Amanda Johnston, Naomi Jackson, Jabari Asim, Nathan McCall, Beverley Nambozo Nsengiyunva, and Mecca Jamilah Sullivan
  • developed literature-focused lesson plans for high school educators that presented BlackLivesMatter from a literary angle 
  • presented the Mosaic Literary Conference (11/21/2015) - Free
  • co-hosted the Bronx Book Fair (5/30/2015) - Free 
  • organized this summer's We Are Family Book Club, a Bronx-based reading initiative that read Emily Raboteau's Searching for Zion - Free 
  • (co)hosted numerous readings throughout New York City, including Women Writers of the Diaspora and contributors to The BreakBeat Poets: New American Poetry in the Age of Hip-Hop at the Bronx Museum - Free

The expenses add up quickly. With donations and grants we were able to "macgyver" quite a bit, but we still need your help. Your donation is key to our sustainability.

Since 2004, the Literary Freedom Project has been dedicated to supporting the literature of the African Diaspora, and to creating open access points for the public to engage books and culture.

Your gift is crucial. Please help us meet our goal and give what you can.

Ron Kavanaugh
Executive Director
Literary Freedom Project

story:
Greetings,

My name is Tatiana Lima and I am a third year law student at Georgia State University College of Law. After experiencing the problematic and traumatizing effects of the criminal justice system firsthand I knew my future would involve becoming a legal advocate.

"[R]acial disparities in the criminal-justice system threaten communities of color—disenfranchising thousands by limiting voting rights and denying equal access to employment, housing, public benefits, and education to millions more." There is much work to be done and I hope to follow in the footsteps of the great legal warriors who have come before me.

BUT I NEED YOUR HELP TO GET THERE!

Law School is expensive and up until now I have primarily relied on federal loans to finance my education. In addition to tuition and school expenses, third year law students must pay to apply for bar fitness certification (including fees to obtain requested documents, fingerprints, background checks and transcripts), a bar exam prep course, and the a fee to sit for the actual exam. Needless to say all of this adds up!

Additionally, preparation for the bar exam (May through July) requires at minimum 8-10 hours of studying per day-which is why most students do not work during this time. I also am expecting the arrival of my son in February! Any help you can offer is a blessing. No amount is too little!

Please see a breakdown of the expenses below that I am hoping to raise funds for to avoid taking out a private loan.

Exam Related Expenses

Application for Certification of Fitness to Practice Law: $410.00

Fee to obtain requested documents, fingerprints, background checks and transcripts: $75.00

Bar Prep Course: $1750.00

Bar Examination Fee:  $442.00

MPRE Exam: $80.00

Total Expenses: $2757.00

Living Expenses for Two Months

Rent: $800.00

Utilities: $400.00

Food: $300.00

Baby Expenses: $250.00

Total Estimated Cost: $1750.00

story:
Education is one indicator of future success and job earning ability. This has been studied and proven over and over again. This is why the education system is so hotly debated and so passionately argued for. Unfortunately, even as our government is trying to keep it from happening, there is a group of students who are truly being left behind their peers and the rest of society.


For the better part of the last nine years we have worked at a youth ranch (HMNB)  designed as a group home for 12 - 17 year old at-risk boys, Jessica (MA, LPC) as a Licensed Professional Counselor and Travis (M.ed) as the Vice President of Operations and Education Director (after being promoted from tutor, to full staff member, to Education Director and subsequently VP of Operations). In our time at HMNB we find that young men who come from traumatic backgrounds often develop mental health disorders (ADHD, ODD, Depression, and on and on) which greatly effect their ability to be successful in a mainstream school system. It is because of this, that America has seen group homes and residential treatment centers pop up all over the country.

Along with the traumatic experiences in their youth, we see that most of the young men are from cities, not rural America. This seemed to back up Richard Louv's idea of Nature Deprivation. What we find though, is that even with these youth programs out there, many young men are just too far behind in school by the time their parents are able to get them help. They are unable to complete their high school education and/or complete their therapeutic treatment before turning 18 and leaving their youth program.

It is with this experience that we have found a great need for a place for 18 year old boys to go and finish their high school education and learn the skills needed to be successful in their lives. A Christian School that: offers multiple paths to completing a high school diploma, where a young man can be immersed in nature, receive multiple forms of therapy from a licensed professional counselor, and where he will learn to be completely self sufficient. A place that teaches a person not only how to pass a test, but teaches how and why you can/should grow your own food,  communicate with others, be mindful of one's self and surroundings, and be all around good stewards.

What This Crowdfund Means for Our Future Clients

 This is a break down of how the funds will be used in order for us to be up and running fully operational in the summer/fall of 2016.

  • $100,000 of the total amount will allow us to purchase a bunkhouse/school building, built and designed by an Amish community, as well as furnish it with the needed furniture and appliances.
  • $70,000 will be used as a down payment for a 35 acre lot to place the bunkhouse, greenhouse(s), and small orchard on.
  • The remaining amount of money that is left after paying taxes, will be used to build at least one year around greenhouse/classroom, purchase trees and other landscaping needs, and be used for beginning operating costs.
Since this is not a get rich small business idea, but rather a business that is really about helping humanity, our perks are about the longevity of your donation.  We have three perks that will show people, and remind yourself, why you donated to our campaign. The first one is a yearly Christmas letter, letting you know what we are doing and who/how your donation has helped. We also have an option where your name will be inscribed on a brick which will be laid in the pathway up to the bunkhouse or from the bunkhouse to the greenhouses. The last perk allows you to have the naming rights to the bunkhouse/school house. These will be a continual reminder to anyone who visits or stays at our campus that you helped make the difference in these young men's lives. Want to let people know about The Academy of Natural Living in your daily life? We also have a $50 contribution perk where you get a gifted hat with our logo on it. Just look up to the right.

The Impact

Simply speaking, your campaign contribution will help change a young man's life:




Risks & Challenges

One of the challenges working with people who have mental health issues is they tend to struggle with low self worth, low self motivation, and a lack of perseverance. Change and growth is hard, which means some students may avoid and decide to fight against that growth and change. We will combat this challenge by creating a residential Christian environment where students are able to accomplish goals and discover their connection with society, nature and the world as a whole.

"A primary reason for the decline in motivation, discipline, and achievement in schools is a lack of direction, and ownership among young people. Most students have the general perception that whether or not they show up, things still will go on without them. In other words, their contribution is irrelevant." (Glenn, H. Stephen & Nelson, Jane; Raising Self-Reliant Children in a Self-Indulgent World). So The Academy of Natural Living is designed where the students are an integral part of the daily functioning of their food production, animal care, and the well being of the community; therefore giving their presence at the school purpose and worth.

The other challenge to overcome is diversification. Our goal is to expand over the next few years to include educational opportunities to high school students in our immediate community as well as adult education programs so that we can educate as many people as possible to become self sustainable stewards.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can always contribute by sharing our campaign with your friends and family. Our cause is a need that is easily seen and felt by almost every single American out there. So please, share, share, share.

After our campaign is concluded, we will also be accepting donations in the form of: building supplies, vegetable seeds, trees, labor to build our school, and scholarship money for future students; so please check back in with us towards our deadline to get involved in that way.

Operations and Education Director (after being promoted from tutor, to full staff member, to Education Director and subsequently VP of Operations). In our time at HMNB we find
that young men who come from traumatic backgrounds often develop mental 
health disorders (ADHD, ODD, Depression, and on and on) which greatly 
effect their ability to be successful in a mainstream school system. It 
is because of this, that America has seen group homes and residential 
treatment centers pop up all over the country.Along with the 
traumatic experiences in their youth, we see that most of the young men are from cities, not rural America. This 
seemed to back up Richard Louv's idea of Nature Deprivation.
 What we find though, is that even with these youth programs out there, 
many young men are just too far behind in school by the time their 
parents are able to get them help. They are unable to complete 
their high school education and/or complete their therapeutic treatment before turning 18 and leaving their youth program.It is with this experience that we have found a great need 
for a place for 18 year old boys to go and finish their high school 
education and learn the skills needed to be successful in their lives. A Christian School that: offers multiple paths to completing a high school diploma,
 where a young man can be immersed in nature, receive multiple forms of 
therapy from a licensed professional counselor, and where he will learn
 to be completely self sufficient. A place that teaches a person not only how
 to pass a test, but teaches how and why you can/should grow your own 
food,  communicate with others, be mindful of one's self and surroundings,
 and be all around good stewards.  What This Crowdfund Means for Our Future Clients 
 This is a break down of how the funds will be 
used in order for us to be up and running fully operational 
in the summer/fall of 2016.

$100,000 of the total amount will allow us to purchase a bunkhouse/school building, built and designed by an Amish community, as well as furnish it with the needed furniture and appliances.
 $70,000 will be used as a down payment for a 35 acre lot to place the bunkhouse, greenhouse(s), and small orchard on.
The
 remaining amount of money that is left after paying taxes, will be used
 to build at least one year around greenhouse/classroom, purchase trees and other landscaping needs, and be used for beginning 
operating costs.

Since this is not a get rich small business idea, but rather a business that is really about helping humanity, our perks are about the longevity of your donation.  We have three perks that will show people, and remind yourself, why you donated to our campaign. The first one is a yearly Christmas letter, letting you know what we are doing and who/how your donation has helped. We also have an option where your name will be inscribed on a brick which will be laid in the pathway up to the bunkhouse or from the bunkhouse to the greenhouses. The last perk allows you to have the naming rights to the bunkhouse/school house. These will be a continual reminder to anyone who visits or stays at our campus that you helped make the difference in these young men's lives. Want to let people know about The Academy of Natural Living in your daily life? We also have a $50 contribution perk where you get a gifted hat with our logo on it. Just look up to the right.  The Impact Simply speaking, your campaign contribution will help change a young man's life:
   Risks & Challenges  One of the challenges working with people who have mental health issues is they tend to struggle with low self worth, low self motivation, and a lack of perseverance. Change and growth is hard, which means some students may avoid and decide to fight against that growth and change. We will combat this challenge by creating a residential Christian environment where students are able to accomplish goals and discover their connection with society, nature and the world as a whole. 
"A primary reason for the decline in motivation, discipline, and achievement in schools is a lack of direction, and ownership among young people. Most students have the general perception that whether or not they show up, things still will go on without them. In other words, their contribution is irrelevant." (Glenn, H. Stephen & Nelson, Jane; Raising Self-Reliant Children in a Self-Indulgent World). So The Academy of Natural Living is designed where the students are an integral part of the daily functioning of their food production, animal care, and the well being of the community; therefore giving their presence at the school purpose and worth. 
The other challenge to overcome is diversification. Our goal is to expand over the next few years to include educational opportunities to high school students in our immediate community as well as adult education programs so that we can educate as many people as possible to become self sustainable stewards. 

  Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can always contribute by sharing our campaign with your friends and family. Our cause is a need that is easily seen and felt by almost every single American out there. So please, share, share, share. After our campaign is concluded, we will also be accepting donations in the form of: building supplies, vegetable seeds, trees, labor to build our school, and scholarship money for future students; so please check back in with us towards our deadline to get involved in that way.

story:
Wear it proudly

By stating what your dreams, passions or choices of careers  are right on your person, you can achieve them – "Cause you are a Girl".

The mission of “Cause l Am A Girl” is to reinforce a message that will empower girls of all ages in the four corners of the world to achieve their passions, goals and dreams by expressing it proudly on themselves. And not giving consent to those who tell them they cannot do it.

Why Support “Cause I Am A Girl”

In many countries, it is still believed that born as a girl is a burden for parents and girls are inferior to boys… This way of thinking needs to be banned and energy needs to be focused towards their real value and how much good girls bring to the world. Women have made great strides over the years but still there is this minority assumption in society.

We need to empower and inspire girls so that they believe in their value inside and out, and can achieve whatever they put their hearts and minds to!


Believe It. Achieve It.

By wearing the “Cause l Am A Girl” logo on themselves  with their passion  proudly, (expressing) we hope that girls come to believe it and that one day they achieve it.

A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.
Coco Chanel - Fashion Designer (1883 - 1971)

Empowerment/Affirmation

Every time a girls creates a t-shirt, a twin is sent to a Non Governmental Agency (NGO) to be distributed to a girl.  It might not be their passion, but they will know that another girl half way around the world has this goal. And by wearing it, she supports her and hopefully is inspired to find her own passion and succeed.
We hope through affirmation both girls will fulfill their potential.


    How You Can Help

    Make a small financial contribution. Share this campaign with your social network. Post campaign updates to your Facebook page.

    Anything you can do to support this effort financially or through sharing will be greatly appreciated by the "“Cause l Am A Girl -Initiative and friends of girls education /rights everywhere.

    Why we need the Funding

    We are raising funds to build a powerful digital presence that will allow girls to create their own t-shirt and automatically send another to a Non Governmental Organizations (NGO) to distribute to a girl.  To post their dreams and passion on a digital wall that will create a global community of girls that inspire and empower each other. 

    The funding will cover the following costs:

    • To promote this project via a Social Media campaign and ensure that dialog is enhance the empowerment of girls and bring awareness to our partner NGOs. (Media Strategist fees)
    • To ensure that the integrity of the brand is legally protected. (Legal fees) 
    • To build an interactive database, where girls can voice and share their dreams and passions to inspire other girls.
      (Programming fees)
    • To access girls around the world in their own language. (Translation fees)
    • To create awareness and grow interest for the initiative. (Marketing fees)

    Presently we are in dialog with Non Governmental Organization (NGO) partners. whose thematic areas are:  girls education and women's empowerment.

story:
Our Story

My name is Robert Harbison, and I'm the CEO at Howloop. I grew up in New York, but now I live in Southern California. I am a self-taught programmer who has been programming for almost nine years; five of which have been professionally. A little over a year ago, some friends and I had an idea to build a fully interactive online learning platform. Since then, I have been working day and night to build the company and product of my dreams. The more I have been working on this project, the more excited I am about it. So much so that four months ago, I quit my job to work full-time on this venture. I’m excited to get started on changing the world of E-Learning, but we need your support before we can begin.

Why We’re Here

Sure, we have the internet in its entirety, but what’s the point if there’s too much misleading information to go through? We need a place with information we can trust because the brand puts its reputation on it. That’s the basis for Howloop. Howloop is an E-Learning site where you can learn how to do almost anything. With Howloop, simply search for a video on the topic you’re looking for. Then watch one of our high quality how-to videos. The video will explain everything you’ll need to know regarding the subject. Howloop is also a great opportunity for those who love to share and educate as well. If you’re someone who likes to make high quality videos, but couldn’t make enough money with other video platforms like YouTube, then you’ll find Howloop an amazing opportunity. With a portion of money from each sale going to the uploader, you won’t have to be dependent on money from ads. With Howloop you can make enough money to not only make high quality videos but to support yourself as well. Also, a portion of all sales go to an educational charity of your choice!

We’re also looking to make our site completely interactive, letting you make the learning experience best for all learning styles. We want to make Howloop a place where you feel comfortable learning at your own pace. If you want to learn a whole language or re-learn a subject you weren’t very good at in high school, you should be able to without intense schedules or high price tags. 

The Impact

Education is one of life’s priceless gifts. However, how can we learn at the speeds necessary for us to stay competitive in the work place, school, and life in general. We all live such busy lives. The need for learning easily, affordably, and more importantly, at a quality we can rely on has never been higher. That’s why Howloop is so important! We’ve figured out the tools needed for the knowledge to stick and stay.

What We Need

The limit in what we can do is only measured in how far we get funded, that’s why your contribution is so important to us. We need to build an infrastructure and prepare for a large number of users. Look below at the chart to get a better understanding of where the money will be going. 

What You Get

 We have some incredible perks. These are truly exciting, as they give you an inside look into the applications and site in its entirety. As well as, free use to the site, client, and direct support from the team. If you want to strut your stuff, we’ll even be giving out shirts and pens! We want you to have the best learning experience possible. From how to fix your bag pipes to how to learn calculus, that’s why we emphasize quality over quantity. With that being said, help make Howloop the new standard of E-Learning.

story:
The Story

Hello! :)

Thank you so much for taking a look at my campaign. I'm Elné Pretorius (pronounced El-neigh - like a horse). I'm an actress, model and composer from Johannesburg, South Africa.

I've been very lucky to have received a partial scholarship to study Acting for Film at the New York Film Academy in the USA. With the scholarship only being partial, some of my tuition fees and all my living expenses are not covered. 

One of my biggest problems is that the exchange rate from South African Rand to US dollar is extremely high. To give you an idea, one US Dollar equals around sixteen South African Rands in the current economy, which means that it's impossible for me to come up with the money myself. I'm really worried about making massive amounts of debt. What makes things more difficult is that I'm not allowed to work in America when I'm there on a student visa, so I have no way to support myself when I'm over there.

But now I'd like to tell you about what inspired my campaign... 

I'm so in love with acting. It really is my one true passion. It's my dream to be able to do what I love so much as a career, and learning among experts in the industry and being surrounded by people who share my passion can really bring me there. I believe that, if I can study at the New York Film Academy, I can become the best actress I can be. 

I would love to ask you to support me in my efforts to make this dream come true. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this.


What I'll need to make this work...

Here's a short breakdown of what my expenses will be once I'm in New York City:

If you're still reading beyond this point I can tell you that...


Helping me out doesn't come without it's perks: 

  • Dedications: I'll be happily active on my social media pages throughout this campaign. If you show some GingerLove by donating a mere $5, I'll send you a shout-out on one of my pages :)
  • Postcards: For $15 I'll send you some GingerLove in the form of a postcard from New York!
  • T-Shirts: If you donate $50 you'll receive an awesome GingerLove campaign T-Shirt designed by yours truly.
  • Meet GingerLove. She is a happy, quirky ginger (just like me) and she's starring in a bunch of really funny and entertaining web videos just for you. The show is called The Adventures of GingerLove. This is one of the best perks!
        This part of the campaign leaves you with a lot of cool options:
        $150 gets you a short web video starring GingerLove dedicated to you.
        $250 gets you a short clip featuring YOU as a character!
        $500 gets you a video dedicated to you on your birthday or another special day      
        * You can choose which special day! 
  • Custom musical composition. One of my biggest passions is writing music for films. I would love to write a beautiful orchestration for you, and I will dedicate it to you with a very grateful heart. This perk goes for $1000.
  • Perk Combo! If you contribute $5000, you'll receive a social media shout-out, a postcard, a T-Shirt, a dedicated special day GingerLove video AND a custom musical orchestration!
  • Red carpet date. Yes, you know it. If you fund my entire campaign I'm taking you to my first-ever red carpet event when it happens! Any takers? $65,000 :P

If I don't reach my entire funding goal: 

The money that I do raise will help me to pay a part of my living costs.


The Impact that you can make:

Your contribution is a direct investment into my future. My success is made possible through your generosity. By funding this campaign, you are funding not only my dream, but my road to success.

In return I promise you that I will not take your contribution for granted. I am an extremely hard-working and dedicated person. I have worked hard my entire life, and I do not intend to stop now. Please give me a chance, and I will show you that I can do this. And hey...

I'd really like to grace your screen one day. Thanks for helping me to make that happen!


Risks & Challenges

New York is one of the most expensive cities in the world. I'd be lying if I said that I don't find this opportunity really scary, and I'm a bit worried that I'll run out of resources while I'm there. BUT it is also the most exciting thing that has ever happened to me, and I have invested my whole heart in it :)

I would like to invite you to follow me on my journey by keeping track of my social posts. I'll keep you up to date on everything that's happening, and I'd love to hear from you :)


Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you can't make a financial contribution. I would like to ask you to please share my campaign with your friends, make some noise, and pay the GingerLove forward.

Thank you!

All my love

Elné

I would like to invite you to follow me on my journey by keeping track of my social posts. I'll keep you up to date on everything that's happening, and I'd love to hear from you :)
