Elné

story:
Support Us in Transforming Preventive Care For Children Through Personalized Nutrition Advice. 


Would you do anything in your power to reduce children's risk of developing chronic diseases and obesity in the future? As parents we think we definitely would specially if it can be done through a personalized balanced diet. That's why we started BabyNome. With the help of cutting edge science, we can now find out how each child processes different nutrients based on his or her genes and tailor a diet that meets their specific needs. This personalized diet will help parents and caregivers to lower their child's risk of developing chronic diseases such as diabetes, anemia, cardiovascular diseases, or hypertension that are associated with vitamin, mineral or metabolic deficiencies. 

 is a nutrigenomics (nutrition meets genomics) technology that uses the DNA data found in a child's saliva to analyze more than 40 nutrition and metabolism traits and  generates personalized nutrition recommendations. These recommendations are presented in a nutrition report that parents and caregivers can use to address their child's specific nutritional needs and help them lower their risk of developing different chronic diseases by providing adequate amounts of vitamins and minerals. 

Learn more about BabyNome

The BabyNome computational nutrigenomics technology has been developed based on decade of scientific research and the integration of hundreds of peer-reviewed genome-wide studies worldwide linking 2000+ genetic variations (known as SNPs) to more than 200 nutritional and well-being traits. The BabyNome Personalized Nutrition Report presents the most important nutritional and metabolic traits that are implicated in preventative health.

Learn more about the Technology 

The Personalized Nutrition Report is a comprehensive 50-page report that covers more than 40 essential nutrition and metabolism traits that tell you how your child's body processes key vitamins and minerals, as well as his or her metabolism and dietary traits: 

The nutrition report has been designed by our nutrition expert specifically for children based on their predisposition level for various nutrition and metabolism traits. The report can be used to guide your child's diet and nutrition throughout her or his most developmentally-crucial childhood years.

BabyNome uses Ancestry.com for genetic testing. All the test needs is a sample of your child's saliva and the process is completely pain and hassle free. BabyNome packages are offered either with or without genetic testing, depending on whether you have already done a test for your child or not. 

If you do not have a genetic report for your child, we can order one for you for an additional $99. You will then receive a testing kit with instructions which simply asks for your child's saliva sample. Once your DNA sample has been processed (6-8 weeks), BabyNome will use the resulting genome data to provide you with your selected report package.

There are three easy steps:

  1. Order your package and Register with BabyNome 
  2. Receive a DNA testing kit  and return saliva sample to them. 
  3. Once DNA testing results are ready, view your BabyNome Total Nutrition Report on our platform within 24 hours. 
You will receive more detailed instructions for every step of the process. 

If you have already done a genetic test for your child through 23andMe or Ancestry.com, you can register your account with us and authorize our use of your child's genetic data, and pay for the reports only. We will then provide you with your selected report within 24 hours.

As co-founders of BabyNome, Raya and Ali's motivation to understand their children's health and well-being needs led to the development and launch of BabyNome Nutrigenomics Technology. They were determined to provide a service that allowed parents like themselves to have access to reliable personalized nutrition plan enabling them to make the right choices for their children's long-term health.

 


We take your child's data privacy and security very seriously and abide by the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act of 2008 and  CORPA both of which protects against unauthorized use of your child's DNA information.  

Learn more about our Privacy Policy

We are raising $25,000 to (1) optimize BabyNome's report design so that it allows parents to use the information in the most effective way; and (2) deliver the message to at-risk communities. Our campaign's fundraising goal is set based on what we would need to tackle both of these fronts simultaneously. However regardless of the amount raised, we will be able to deliver the promised perks of our campaign.  

Our goal is to make high-quality genomics analysis accessible to as many parents as possible. Our approach to pricing and delivery of reports marks a sharp departure from the current convention. Offering more than 40 nutritional and metabolism traits for under $100 (plus the cost of genetic test which cost $99) makes BabyNome an affordable investment in their child's health and well-being for a significant proportion of households with children.  

We believe this level of personalization will revolutionize the way we look at nutrition and well-being advice and allow parents to customize their approach to their children's diet and eating habits. As new scientific research becomes available, we will continue to integrate and enrich our knowledge base to update the reports and provide more predisposition analysis for well-being traits. 

   Raya Khanin, Ph.D., Co-Founder and ​Chief Scientific Officer

Raya ​is BabyNome's lead for computational genomics and scientific research. She is a senior scientist at the Memorial Sloan Kettering Hospital Bioinformatics Core and has more than 20 years of experience working with some of the world’s leading life scientists and clinicians on linking DNA data to hundreds of biological and genetic traits. As an internationally recognized scholar, Raya is the author/co-author of more than 100 peer-reviewed scientific publications with 5200+ citations on bioinformatics, computational biology and genomics. Raya received her PhD from Weizmann Institute of Science (Israel) and was a recipient of the Royal Society's Dorothy Hodgkin Fellowship (UK). ​

     Ali Mostashari, Ph.D.,Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer

​​Ali  serves as BabyNome's Chief Executive. From 2008-2014, Ali served as an Associate Professor and Program Director of Sociotechnological Systems at Stevens Institute of Technology in Hoboken, New Jersey where he led its Smart Cities Consortium. From 2004-2008, Ali was a Senior Strategic Adviser to the Assistant Secretary General for Africa at the United Nations Development Programme where he had oversight for over $1.2 billion in annual development resources. Ali has authored and co-authored of more than 80 peer-reviewed academic papers and books focused on complex systems. He received his Ph.D. from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

See our full team

 Can't contribute right now? There are a lot of other ways you can help us. 

  1. Help spread the word about our campaign on your social media
  2. Tell parents of young children in your family and friends circle about us
  3. Blog about BabyNome and this campaign

BabyNome relies on Ancestry.com and 23andMe (both companies backed by hundreds of millions of dollars of venture capital) for genetic testing data. There are always some potential supply chain and handover risks when an external service provider is used. Potential risks include change of company policy or price, a change or reinterpretation of Federal legislation limiting genomics data information provision, temporary glitches in the data transfer between these companies and  BabyNome,  and ensuring legal authority of parents to allow use of their child's data. 

However we also have identified other service providers who offer similar services that allow us to provide the same report for your child and can switch if the need arises.

Have Other Questions? 

Contact us or visit our frequently asked questions
story_txt:
Support Us in Transforming Preventive Care For Children Through Personalized Nutrition Advice. 







Would you do anything in your power to reduce children's risk of developing chronic diseases and obesity in the future? As parents we think we definitely would specially if it can be done through a personalized balanced diet. That's why we started BabyNome. With the help of cutting edge science, we can now find out how each child processes different nutrients based on his or her genes and tailor a diet that meets their specific needs. This personalized diet will help parents and caregivers to lower their child's risk of developing chronic diseases such as diabetes, anemia, cardiovascular diseases, or hypertension that are associated with vitamin, mineral or metabolic deficiencies. 








 is a nutrigenomics (nutrition meets genomics) technology that uses the DNA data found in a child's saliva to analyze more than 40 nutrition and metabolism traits and  generates personalized nutrition recommendations. These recommendations are presented in a nutrition report that parents and caregivers can use to address their child's specific nutritional needs and help them lower their risk of developing different chronic diseases by providing adequate amounts of vitamins and minerals. 
Learn more about BabyNome



The BabyNome computational nutrigenomics technology has been developed based on decade of scientific research and the integration of hundreds of peer-reviewed genome-wide studies worldwide linking 2000+ genetic variations (known as SNPs) to more than 200 nutritional and well-being traits. The BabyNome Personalized Nutrition Report presents the most important nutritional and metabolic traits that are implicated in preventative health.
Learn more about the Technology 



The Personalized Nutrition Report is a comprehensive 50-page report that covers more than 40 essential nutrition and metabolism traits that tell you how your child's body processes key vitamins and minerals, as well as his or her metabolism and dietary traits: 


The nutrition report has been designed by our nutrition expert specifically for children based on their predisposition level for various nutrition and metabolism traits. The report can be used to guide your child's diet and nutrition throughout her or his most developmentally-crucial childhood years.





















BabyNome uses Ancestry.com for genetic testing. All the test needs is a sample of your child's saliva and the process is completely pain and hassle free. BabyNome packages are offered either with or without genetic testing, depending on whether you have already done a test for your child or not. 
If you do not have a genetic report for your child, we can order one for you for an additional $99. You will then receive a testing kit with instructions which simply asks for your child's saliva sample. Once your DNA sample has been processed (6-8 weeks), BabyNome will use the resulting genome data to provide you with your selected report package.

There are three easy steps:

Order your package and Register with BabyNome 
Receive a DNA testing kit  and return saliva sample to them. 
Once DNA testing results are ready, view your BabyNome Total Nutrition Report on our platform within 24 hours. 


You will receive more detailed instructions for every step of the process. 
If you have already done a genetic test for your child through 23andMe or Ancestry.com, you can register your account with us and authorize our use of your child's genetic data, and pay for the reports only. We will then provide you with your selected report within 24 hours.






As co-founders of BabyNome, Raya and Ali's motivation to understand their children's health and well-being needs led to the development and launch of BabyNome Nutrigenomics Technology. They were determined to provide a service that allowed parents like themselves to have access to reliable personalized nutrition plan enabling them to make the right choices for their children's long-term health. 



 













We take your child's data privacy and security very seriously and abide by the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act of 2008 and  CORPA both of which protects against unauthorized use of your child's DNA information.  
Learn more about our Privacy Policy






We are raising $25,000 to (1) optimize BabyNome's report design so that it allows parents to use the information in the most effective way; and (2) deliver the message to at-risk communities. Our campaign's fundraising goal is set based on what we would need to tackle both of these fronts simultaneously. However regardless of the amount raised, we will be able to deliver the promised perks of our campaign.  

 Our goal is to make high-quality genomics analysis accessible to as many parents as possible. Our approach to pricing and delivery of reports marks a sharp departure from the current convention. Offering more than 40 nutritional and metabolism traits for under $100 (plus the cost of genetic test which cost $99) makes BabyNome an affordable investment in their child's health and well-being for a significant proportion of households with children.  
We believe this level of personalization will revolutionize the way we look at nutrition and well-being advice and allow parents to customize their approach to their children's diet and eating habits. As new scientific research becomes available, we will continue to integrate and enrich our knowledge base to update the reports and provide more predisposition analysis for well-being traits. 




   Raya Khanin, Ph.D., Co-Founder and ​Chief Scientific Officer
Raya ​is BabyNome's lead for computational genomics and scientific research. She is a senior scientist at the Memorial Sloan Kettering Hospital Bioinformatics Core and has more than 20 years of experience working with some of the world’s leading life scientists and clinicians on linking DNA data to hundreds of biological and genetic traits. As an internationally recognized scholar, Raya is the author/co-author of more than 100 peer-reviewed scientific publications with 5200+ citations on bioinformatics, computational biology and genomics. Raya received her PhD from Weizmann Institute of Science (Israel) and was a recipient of the Royal Society's Dorothy Hodgkin Fellowship (UK). ​
     Ali Mostashari, Ph.D.,Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer
​​Ali  serves as BabyNome's Chief Executive. From 2008-2014, Ali served as an Associate Professor and Program Director of Sociotechnological Systems at Stevens Institute of Technology in Hoboken, New Jersey where he led its Smart Cities Consortium. From 2004-2008, Ali was a Senior Strategic Adviser to the Assistant Secretary General for Africa at the United Nations Development Programme where he had oversight for over $1.2 billion in annual development resources. Ali has authored and co-authored of more than 80 peer-reviewed academic papers and books focused on complex systems. He received his Ph.D. from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

story:
Have you ever had a dream? "Of course" - you might say.

The ocean is made up of millions of drops, the sky is made up of thousands of stars, the world consists of 7 billion people. Just imagine: what if everyone from that 7 billion people give you $ 1? It would be great, isn`is it?
I have a big dream: to become an educated, skilled, self-sufficient person and get my education in the United States. I need your help and ask you to be the drops in my ocean and the stars in my sky!
My name is Mila, I'm 21 and I want to raise funds to pay for my education in the United States. I am from Ukraine and  love my country boundless, but I can not get a good education and priceless knowledge here. I want to be a leader in the community and in my life, to be useful for my Ukraine. I was raised by my father, who gave me a lot of breeding and I want him to be proud of his daughter.
 My one-year program of professional management costs $ 11,000, and I need to raise $ 6000 to complete its financing. This is a very good program, so I am sure I will learn a lot of useful information for my professional development.

What do I propose to you? 
In gratitude for you contributions I would like to share with you by the part of my soul. During my traveling to USA I am going to keep a diary on the basis of which I will write a book. I want to write a fascinating story about simple girl who never gives up and follows her dreams. I will describe and write about places, events, feelings, people, studying, about everything I will meet on my way. You can be the witnesses of my wonderful trip. 
Depends on your perk you can get different options: 
-all the investors will be getting copies of new parts of the story every two weeks and slideshow with the photos of my studying and living in USA, 
-for 20$ one of the characters of the story can be called by your name, 
-for 40$ one of the main characters of the story can be called by your name, 
-for 75$ you will get the printed copy of my book. 
-for 100$ you will get the printed copy of my book and 3 pounds of delicious handmade cherry cookies. 
for 125$ you can receive the printed copy of my book and wonderful handmade embroidered picture.

This is a very important event in my life, and I want to make it real. Please trust me as much as I believe in myself!

story:
Selling Hypnotically and how it AFFECT you !!

Get involved with audio and video; television and magazines; live training events.  Read on to see how you can benefit from the world’s number one hypnotist.


SHHHH........The Secret is about to get revealed to you!!
1. Get our new Book and make more crazy hypnotic sales.
2. Get our Audio and Video training for selling hypnotically.
3. Get the GOLDEN live seminar ticket. (Venues across the globe)
4. Get a Plug for your product or business at a live or TV event
5. Selling Hypnotically training delivered live to you and your team.
6. Get a Mentorship with me, Richard Barker.
I have been a Hypnotist for 20 years and worked with thousands of teams and people who are in the business of selling something. I know how to sell products and services using the power of the mind. Think about it for a second, since a very early age EVERY one of us learned the power of suggestion to some degree to be able to get what we want.

With your help, I am about to expose something that has never been done before and show you exactly how to sell more stuff and how to persuade and influence like a PRO.


  • Hi, I am Richard Barker, a world renowned professional Hypnotist. You may have seen me on the Late Late Show with James Corden on CBS or the TODAY show on NBC.  I have hypnotized over a million people both on and off television, my true passion however is the art of the sale and what happens in the mind.

  • Take this journey with me and I promise you an increase in sales and revenue. Your product or services will see a significant ROI and I will help you each step of the way.

  • With your help,I can effectively put this show on the road and make this the biggest Hypnotic Selling experience the world has ever seen. As a backer you will get some amazing perks that undoubtedly will also change your life.

Ask yourself this: Do you need to get something in your life you don't have?  Do you need to attract more of something either financial or personal?  If you want the advantage over others this is for you!  If you want to leave money on the table just walk away.

Here is what we need:

We are looking for early adopters:

  • We need  $20,000 to complete our launch of live training and video series along with television campaign.

  • You get early adopter perks that are not open to the public and include advanced copies of all materials and invites to private launch parties and seminars!

  • We will be featured on television and if you are at the highest perk you will be invited to show recordings. 

  • Our hypnotist will come and train you or your sales team.

  • Even at the lowest perk you will receive an autographed copy of this book and become part of the family.


Your Impact:

Your contribution will make a world of difference:

  • Hypnosis is trending and topical right now and in the news daily.  Celebrities and athletes are flocking to hypnosis but the business world has been slow to catch on. Our campaign is at the forefront of this trend, with your help we can push this project onto live stages and national television.

  • With your help we can set up national training events.

  • With your help we can increase the print run of our book.


Risks & Challenges:

We have already proven ourselves by appearing on ABC, NBC, FOX and CBS.  There is no guarantees but we are currently talking to producers of Fox And Friends and the Ellen Show as well as Dr Oz and others. 

Early adopters may be given an invite to the studio for taping and get a potential business plug at our promotional level or higher.

  • There are never guarantees but we have already succeeded on previous projects; we have a system and a proven track record.

  • We will work hard until every campaign backer is personally rewarded for supporting us. Simply put, we will over deliver on our promise.


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you just can't contribute right now that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!


If you come on this journey, I can guarantee you my friendship and your success. I will make an impact on your product or service and help you increase your capacity to sell or book more. Whatever your industry, I can help because all sales happen with a thought and in the mind FIRST. Once you understand this concept and learn the secrets you will be unstoppable. 


Join me on the path we are on; the next 12 months are going to be awesome and I would love to personally bring you on the ride as one of our valued backers. The sky is not the limit, it is actually the universe!!   Bigger things may happen and we would love to have you onboard.

Get involved on a small or large scale and your success will be improved and transformed!!!

The sky is not the limit, it is actually the universe!!   Bigger things may happen and we would love to have you onboard.Get involved on a small or large scale and your success will be improved and transformed!!!

story:
Hi, my friend! Thank you for stopping by,

My name is Traian and I am a 33 year-old east-european calling himself a learning architect. I worked for the past twelve years trying to transform higher education in Romania. First I was a student activist and then I co-founded the Alternative University in Bucharest (read my story here).

I love my work and I consider re-inventing universities one important milestone for humanity going forward. Contributing to this gives meaning to my life so I plan to continue for at least 10 years. Now I feel ready to shift gears and to aspire to a new level of impact. So this project came to be.  


The book


Break/Free will be a book for teenagers about universities. Its story will walk them behind the stage of the overwhelming and irresistible reputation that universities have. It will shed fresh light on their upcoming rite of passage into adulthood. My reasonable expectation is to help its teenage readers adjust their “university experience” while inside the university system.


The unreasonable hope in my heart is that small groups of brave, freedom-loving young people will be encouraged to do the unthinkable: say no to everything an established institution of higher education has to offer and create their own. I will make the case that stepping away from the beaten track can be more joyful and also more messy, exhausting and dangerous. But also, in the end, this unconventional route into adulthood can make its walkers more alive, can free them from the obsolete mental models of the present and it will empower them as adults.

The book will outline a vision for higher education where students assume the role of creators and full owners of their universities and not consumers. Its graduates can better challenge the status quo, can rebel against the broken ways and refresh society. This book will hint at a network of self-organized learning environments that unite into a game-changing, global university. This is my starting premise. I will allow the journey that follows to shape it.

I will gather stories from all continents of the world about individual learning journeys, radical learning architectures, communities, hubs, hackerspaces, rituals and neat tech tools. It will have charming characters going through breathtaking adventures. All of them real. I will include some of my own stories of the past 12 years in building The Alternative University. I will put them all together into a master narrative that gets personal and subjective. Hollywood will come begging to make a movie :-).

Didn’t they write this book already?

Deschooling Society, Pedagogy of the Oppressed or Turning Learning Right Side Up are deep critiques of the system to which I have few things to add. Excellent Sheep illuminates the particular way the elite universities train “brainy but soulless students”. Better Than College or Hacking Your Education guide young people in creating their own individual path. DIY U rounds up some of the emerging alternatives in 2010. There are many more. My contribution will be to (1) weave some of their core ideas, (2) go further by adding recent progress of the emerging radical models around the world and (3) add what I think it is a unique perspective. It was shaped by the unlikely story of spinning-off our revolted student activism into an alternative university and the fact that we were so young and inexperienced when we started. I think we have a unique voice to add to the conversation about the future of universities. If it’s just an illusion in my head, writing this book will dispel it. It is hard to live with that burden :-)


The journey


The questions to start from

My quest for inspiration and connection will be guided by questions like: How do the 7 billion people on Planet Earth live? What is important to them? How do these people get good at living life? What is the best ice cream in town? How can the 23.729 universities in the world help the two billion people under 20 to flourish and transform our world? What else is there and who else is there? What is possible next?


Where do I go

I plan to spend a year traveling to Myanmar, Malaysia, Indonesia, Australia, New Zealand, Mexico, Peru, Brazil, Venezuela, Cuba, USA, Canada, Morocco, Egypt, Oman, Russia and Moldova. On the “maybe” list I have: Uruguay, Argentina,Chile, Bolivia, Haití, DR Congo, Zimbabwe, Ghana, South Africa and going back to India.

From a list of 150 places/projects I will select some as I go, no more than 30. I want to visit a few classic universities like MIT (Media Lab) and Stanford (d.School) and some particularly innovative like ASU, Olin College or Quest University. I am most interested in the small radical experiments like Swaraj University, Thiel Fellowships, Open Masters or Deep Springs College. I will stop by some non-higher-education learning designs like Lumiar, Summerhill, Green School, AltSchool, School in the Cloud, Unreasonable Institute and Art of Learning Project. I will also look into a few edtech projects like Open Badges or edX, make it to some conferences like SXSWEdu and get involved with groups like Eco-versities, Lumina, Ashoka U and IDEO. But I will be looking for inspiration in many other places: from informal learning communities in skateparks and makerspaces to self-managed companies like Semco, indigenous tribes, countercultural movements like copyleft, occupy or free software, eco-villages or experimental towns like Auroville. See the full list here.


What do I intend to do in each country?

First, I will (1) immerse myself in the environment and participate in local daily life; live with someone local, learn about prices, read the news, walk a lot, use the public transport, make friends; talk to people on the street. As I absorb the context naturally, my focus will be to (2) discover organizations, projects, movements or traditions and then ask questions, observe, take notes and collect stories. I will look for the chance to (3) make myself useful in some way; maybe facilitate a workshop, share my story, help with farming or take on a small one-week project. Ultimately, the journey is about (4) meeting and connecting with some of the learning architects, the activists, the visionaries, the wise and enlightened and the troublemakers of this world. I will try to meet some of my heroes like John Taylor Gatto or Ricardo Semler, just to make sure they are real people :-).


And it leads to ...

I believe that the world needs to take a turn from the current direction. There are 2.3 billion people under 20 and 23.729 universities. These universities will not have enough places. Even if they did, their economic model is too expensive for many more people to go. And even if we had resources, we know that their learning model is ineffective; even counterproductive in nurturing the entrepreneurial changemakers that could steer the world in another direction. 

I see myself as part of a global tribe of people that played for a long time at the edges of higher education. Long enough to know that something radically better is possible at a big scale: universities that are inexpensive, accessible to many more and effective in nurturing people to flourish and transform their world.

I want to dedicate my next ten years to that possibility. To upgrade my work to that level, I need to upgrade myself. It is a challenge that requires a deeper level of creativity, a better awareness of the world and an ability to connect with people worldwide. There are things to learn and things to unlearn. I hope that making the journey and writing the book will also enable my transformation:  

  • from a local worldview to a big picture, global awareness;
  • from reading about people I admire to making selfies with them;
  • from Romania focused to being globally connected;
  • from busy and burned-out to being in flow and taking time for quality work;  
  • from entrepreneur to learning architect;
  • from boring explainer to charming storyteller;
  • from telling others to “learn like crazy” to walking the talk big time;  
  • from a good human being to a better human being.
In the end, my whole life is no more than a drop in the ocean. No journey will change that. But I feel that, in some way, me walking this individual path of mine is part of a bigger collective story that is being born around the world. The ocean is made out of drops. My intuition whispers to me that the world will change thanks to our mindful efforts but in a way that will surprise all of us. And so I focus on bringing my gift to the world wholeheartedly and I trust the process that it will change the world.


What do I Need


For the full version I need roughly 20 flights of 60.000 km, visas for 19 countries on 5 continents, 300 days of food, accommodation and urban transport in 30 cities. All this will get me to the core of this journey: more than 600 beers :-). Worst case, it can also be hot chocolate or water, just to sit in front of a glass for three hours and interview fascinating people or sit by myself and write. It all adds up to a total of 17.000 euros necessary to complete this journey. (see the detailed budget)


It doesn’t look like a regular travel budget. I am learning to travel the frugal way.  I can sleep in 12 bed dorms without AC. I slept on a floor in New Delhi, on a rooftop in Udaipur and in Shanghai Airport. I couchsurfed in Seattle, Shanghai, Dubai and Ho Chi Minh. Inside cities I prefer to walk if it is up to an hour. I overcame the shyness of spending 3-4 hours on a coffee so I can get wifi, plug-in and have some quiet time. No need to pity me. I find this vagabonding style of travel romantic, interesting and character building. I highly welcome and cherish any suggestion of how to spend less.


What do you get


I am determined to write a good book that would inform, fascinate, clarify and entertain its readers. I hope you will get inspired, you will want to share and recommend it and be proud to mention that you have supported this book.The same goes for all the perks: I fantasize how they will be a delight to you. Even beyond the perks, I will be hunting for opportunities to contribute back something that is meaningful to each one of my backers. Here are the specific gifts the supporters will get:  

In The Loop. If you want to buy the book later and just encourage me to do this with a gift of 1€ or 5€ - there are two options just for that. The least I can do is send you monthly updates of my progress and thank you on my website.

eBook. For a gift of 10€ you will get a nice and clean formatted ebook in pdf, mobi and epub formats so you can read it on your smartphone, tablet, kindle or laptop. I will send monthly updates and thank you on my website.

Digital Chest. Curious to peek behind the curtain? For a gift of 25€ you will get the ebook and the monthly updates plus access to a private blog with more frequent and more personal updates. Together with the ebook, you will get a nice and tidy archive of my learning journey documents, personal notes, lists, expenses, timesheets, badges, templates and extra material (interviews, bonus chapters) that did not get into the book.  

Printed book - 1st edition. For 50€ you will get all the electronic goodies but also the first edition of the printed book. It will be a special edition for this campaign supporters, limited to 200 copies. As you open it, you will find my handwritten thank you note and dedication and some cool stickers. Shipping is included.

Ambassador Combo. For a gift of 100€, you will get all the electronic goodies, one copy of the printed book for you and one copy to offer as a gift to a friend. Both of them will have a dedication in handwriting. As you browse through the book, you will find your name printed inside, on the list of supporters. Also, you will receive an invitation to a special event in Bucharest for friends and supporters. It will be something to remember.  

Memory Box. For a gift of 500€ or more, I will invite you to dinner to personally deliver a unique and personalized box. You will find there a handcrafted book with a special cover and inserts from my journal and other memories from my trip. You will also find a gift from the trip, brought specially for you with a handwritten letter from me. It will be connected with a story that was meaningful to me in this journey. It will be a symbol of your trust in my learning journey. You will symbolically own a moment of my becoming. For your friends, you will get 5 printed books and a voucher worth 500 euro that can be used for an individual counseling program (10 sessions) or attending two workshops. The topics will be “art of learning”, “becoming a learning architect” and “the big (hi)story”.

Here is one of those tables that will make me look like selling freemium software:


I also have a few tempting gifts for organizations that might want to support me:

Supporter (Organization) - 1000€

Mention as a supporter company in the book. Five printed and signed books and ebooks for all employees.

Sponsor (Organization) - 2000€

Mention as a sponsor in the book. Ten printed and signed books from the first edition and ebooks for all employees. Personalized “Art of Learning” workshop in your company, drawing from the experience of the journey and the book.

Main Sponsor (Organization) - 5000€

In addition to the regular sponsor benefits you get 10 more printed books. Your company will get enthusiastic (but elegant) recognition as a main partner in the book, in public appearances and on my website. It will be uniquely associated with sponsoring the trip to one continent. The Main Sponsor also gets 160 hours of work from my side for a personalized Learning Organization Project. It can use them to help its own efforts to develop learning agility or, alternatively, my work can be donated as CSR to a school or university.

More about Learning Organization Project: By the time I will complete the book, I would have visited and studied more than 20 learning organizations, each one having something remarkable in terms of its learning architecture. I am offering 160 hours of my time to understand an organization’s reality and contribute to it becoming more agile in terms of learning. My work can include workshops, speaking, facilitation, 1-1 sessions, design of tools and systems or help in designing and planning events. The activities can span to a maximum of one year. While traveling in the continent sponsored, I can take on an assignment to look into a particular area of interest for the sponsor and include the findings in the project. And we can get more creative than that.  

 


The Impact


My happiness. After 8 months on the road, traveling is more challenging than fun but as a whole, this learning journey is an important turning point in the pursuit of happiness and meaning in my life.

Pay it forward. Over the course of the next 10 years, I will set aside from my savings a fund at least equal to what I have received for this learning journey. From the fund, I will support at least 10 people in their self-designed learning journeys, asking them to pay if forward the same way. I hope this will encourage a tradition of community support for self-designed learning journeys.

The social impact. I know that many of you will not be motivated by getting something back. Not even a good book. Rather, by backing me in this project you expect me to come back wiser and do good work in education. I am also motivated and guided by the possible impact of my work beyond the book. Writing a good book is a start for a longer journey in the next ten years: to make that book's vision a reality.


Risks & Challenges


Traveling has its risks of accidents and disease. I have been traveling safely for the past 8 months and hope to continue this way. Not getting all the funding is another risk. I will get more creative before cutting countries or continents. I will find a way to set aside some time to work remotely or get accommodation and food in return for work. As a last resort, I will make the trip shorter in distance and/or time. The project has enough challenges on my side.

Most of the challenges and risks count towards the time it will take me to complete it. I decided to give it the time it needs. I made an optimistic estimate that reflects my current intention. If you decide to support my journey in any way, please consider also offering me the gift of time. You can do that by not taking my estimates as a promise. What I can promise is that I will complete this project, one way or another, and stay true to its original intention. Unless they offer me to be President of the United States or other opportunity to swiftly improve thousands of lives, I will not take on other projects before completing this one.  


Other Ways You Can Help


  • By giving me feedback, ideas or just encouragement for this campaign and/or the journey; [Contact me]
  • By sharing this page and adding your voice / endorsement;  
  • By donating time - a few minutes from your lunch break or more. Please let me know by completing this 1 min form;
  • By asking friends living in the cities I visit if they can host and/or offer food, especially in the expensive areas (Example: San Francisco, Boston, New York, Australia, NZ); Let me know here.
  • By providing free printing services for the first 200 copies of the book;

One last word


I am standing here after countless hours of writing about me, me, me and my turning point and my journey. My skeptical and fearful self whispers: “no one will give a shit and read this!”. And you are reading these last words. It means a lot to me.

If you end up supporting this project or not, I hope that we will meet someday and you will enjoy having me around  - by then a more kind and interesting human being. And if you turn your attention to my work again in the future, I hope you will notice a more impactful work.

But the most noble part of me wishes you well without me required in the picture. I hope that when you’ll have a turning point in your life, the people you need will be there to take notice, to listen or to read. I would love to be one of them, returning your generous gift of attention.

I'm an educational traveller from Ukraine. Two and a half years ago, I was average university student, riding the assembly line of modern life. But one day, my life has changed. 

I went abroad first time, for voluntary project to Turkey, working with ecological issues there. After I got a chance to visit a great seminar in Malta "Liberty English Camp", and met up with "Students For Liberty". This two events totally changed me, that I became a young representative of this educational NGOs in Ukraine. From that moment, I helped hundreds of Ukrainian students to develop themselves through international conferences, seminars and camps, how it was with me before. 

I'm super excited for the year ahead of me and I want to include you in my personal transformation! I feel like I'm taking charge of my life which something I've never really done before. But I'm not alone! I'm surrounded by you AMAZING FRIENDS! 



ISFLC 2016 -  is a leadership conference for libertarians, designed to inspire and to help young people find the skills necessary to take charge as a leader in their own life and it gives connections needed to create a direction in participants lives and find who they are. 

I will be surrounded by an amazing group of young leaders with the same mindset as me from whole over the world! Given the opportunity to reflect, learn, and grow in a supportive and encouraging environment, I know I will be able to tap into myself and develop a purpose for my future career! My hope is to return home and share my experiences with everyone. After this trip, broadening my perspective, and cultivating my character, I know I'll be able to help the people around me grow just as much as I have.



ALL THE FUNDS WILL GO TO SEVERAL THINGS:

  • The Plane tickets.
  • Accommodation & Food.


EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!

Seriously, I can't express how much I mean this! I know that sometimes it's really hard to reach out to people for help, let alone ask for money, but I assure you that you will be very much apart of this! 


SHARING IS CARING!

So you’re a bit down on cash? No worries, I can empathize. One of the best ways to help is simply to help promote my campaign. 

Statistically speaking, you’ve probably got a Facebook account. It would be really helpful if you’d share the link to this campaign on your profile page! 

Find this campaign interesting? Well then Pin it! 

Do you use the Twitter? Great tweet it!


THE PERKS OF BEING A FUNDER

Indiegogo campaign are about exchange and support - a hand up, not a hand out. And my project is no different. To express how appreciative I am of your support! I will send you personal letters and custom made travel gifts to show

FULL GRATITUDE  TO YOU!


THANK YOU SO MUCH 

FOR TAKING THE TIME 

TO CHECK THIS OUT 

AND SEE YOU 

:)

story:
Educate Her for Better Future

With violence escalating at unprecedented levels in the Middle East, access to quality education for young women is becoming increasingly difficult! Daughters for Life Foundation is a registered Canadian charity that provides educational programs; Scholarships, Awards, and Fellowship programs to Middle Eastern aspiring young women irrespective of ethnicity or religious affiliation. Since 2012, we have helped over 300 young women to step into better future; we need your help today to help more!

Who We Are

On January 2009, an Israeli tank shelled the home of Dr. Izzeldin Abuelaish in the Gaza Strip killing three of his daughters, Bessan, 21, Mayar, 15, and Aya, 13. It was Abuelaish’s response to the loss of his daughters that won him humanitarian awards around the world. Instead of seeking revenge or sinking into despair and hatred, he founded Daughters for Life Foundation in 2010 in memory of his daughters and seeks to honor their love of life, learning, their hopes and dreams for an educated future.

The Daughters for Life Foundation provides Scholarships, Awards, and Fellowship programs for aspiring young women living in the Middle East, to enable them to pursue studies otherwise inaccessible to them. Female students from Syria, Iraq, Palestine, Israel, Egypt, Lebanon, Jordan, etc... can access full scholarships at the graduate and undergraduate level to study in Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, and Bangladesh. The foundation also provides financial awards to assist students attending Middle Eastern Universities.

We believe that empowering young women through quality education is the key to long-lasting peace in the Middle East and the rest of the world. Our recipients are chosen not only for their academic achievements, often in the face of socio-economic adversity and hardship, but also for their character and commitment to improving the lives of girls and young women in the Middle East.

Our goal is to invest in their potential for leadership and foster their success in whatever fields they choose to pursue. 

Why This Campaign

For academic year 2016, we are planning to award 10+ girls, who are living in conflict regions such as Syria, Iraq, Palestine and elsewhere in the Middle East, FULL undergraduate scholarships to study in North America. Our scholarships cover the travel, tuition, accommodation, and food.

We need your help to get 5 of them the air tickets to get them out of Middle East to pursue better education opportunity!

The average cost of round trip air ticket from Middle East to US or Canada is $2000, so we hope to raise $10,000 for five of them.

With your help, we can help many talented young women from conflict regions, access the best education possible. We believe that investing in young women’s education is the key to long-lasting peace and better future for all of us!

story:
Fleeing terror, persecution and war, record numbers of desperate refugees continue to make treacherous journeys despite even higher risks of drowning at sea in the increasingly harsh conditions of a European winter. The“Beyond Borders Convoy" is a growing group of volunteers across Europe, providing emergency supplies and warm food at border crossings during the refugee crises. Our team, formed by Fiona Kelly, Alice Bordoloi and Alex Weston, will depart for Slovenia on the 4th of December.

Most recently we were stationed on the Austrian-German border, setting up a mobile cooking facility (from scratch) to feed refugees who had not eaten in days - including a shockingly high number of children and babies, all of whom were sleeping rough. Our experiences confirmed that there is a huge misconception amongst the general public that governments and international aid agencies are on the ground doing all the necessary work to help. The harsh reality is that this is very often not the case. Many refugees told us that they have been solely dependent on the good will of independent volunteers for their survival since arriving in Europe.

We have chosen Slovenia as our next destination because it has become the new bottleneck on the Balkan Route. We have a fully kitted mobile kitchen on board and a team of 2 professional chefs and their kitchen staff of 8 to cook and serve hot nutritious meals. Many of the refugees currently transitioning through the Slovenian camps en route to the Austrian border - babies and children included - do not have shoes or socks, and have been sleeping rough on concrete floors without food for up to 3 days at a time. Many suffer from hypothermia and other severe health conditions, and many have been subjected to severe brutality by police and armed forces along their way. "Beyond Borders" will also deliver emergency supplies (clothing, medical, sanitary items, blankets) that we have collected in our communities. We always call the emergency services immediately in the case of medical emergencies or child protection agencies in the case of unaccompanied minors. 

With your donations we will provide emergency meals at the cost of 1 EUR per meal for 10,000 people. The contributions will go towards buying red lentils, rice, fresh vegetables cooking oil and spices. We will also will buy additional water and baby formula milk for newborns and babies and make/sanitise bottles in the kitchen (Fiona, the mother of 4, will be on high alert and taking care of the mums with toddlers and babies again). We guarantee total transparency and will communicate all of our expenditure, as well as a blog on our progress on our Facebook page 'Beyond Borders Convoy' 04 Dec Slovenia. 

Our previous experience has shown us that the political situation is extremely volatile. If for some reason, the camps in Slovenia are deemed inaccessible (by the authorities) to independent volunteers on the 4th of December, we have a Plan B in place. We will partner with an organisation on the Slovenian border with Austria - by expanding their kitchens' infrastructure- with our team and equipment (honouring our commitment to the refugees, and our donors to cook 10,000 meals).

story:
How Tix Global is going to make a change

Right now in Malaysia, events are not receiving the proper exposure and necessary tools to reach their true potential.

Events are all about attendance and exposure, the more people who know about it, the more valuable the event becomes. Bigger events means better quality events as more resources and effort are invested which can then be recuperated from ticket sales and other income channels such as sponsor deals.

But what about the smaller events? The events that don't have the resources or the platform to reach out to the masses. There's where Tix Global comes in! We are building a one stop platform that boost not only their management skills but also provides the best chance of making it big through a pay per sale platform that only charges them for each ticket sold!

Now, maybe you're wondering. We already have eventbrite and peatix and Facebook Event Page and what have you. But what sets Tix Global apart is the unified effort of bringing exposure and marketing to all the events that we host on our platform through a synergy approach where traffic for Event A is also funnelled into Event B through a more organic and referral approach to exposure where even our own marketing efforts will directly benefit all the events held on the platform!

The same under-exposed locals who are craving for as much attention as the dominating, bigger international branded events. We want to empower them in building their dreams and to grant them the opportunity to support their local brothers & sisters so that they too can achieve their artistic goals.

Why We Need The Funds

We've been bootstrapping the development phase for almost half a year now with our own savings and funds but in order to really bring the platform to live, we are gonna need your help!

What 70,000 USD will do for us, Tix Global :

·  Application development

·  Programming and software development

·  User interface development

·  Back-end development

·  Marketing and operating expenses

·  Payment Gateway application and full integration

·  Email Blast integration

We implore you to help us build some traction so that with enough of a running start, we are able to attract bigger investors and receive the financial aid needed to really bring this platform to life.

The Impact...

Malaysia and Southeast Asia have so many events that are unorganized and not reaching their full audience possible, and Tix Global is the key to providing a better experience for all parties involved. Instead of looking to solve event-related problems across various platforms, coordinators can now focus on the actual event itself by leaving the management aspect up to Tix Global.

Our range of tools for event organization include:

·  Custom event page

·  Custom form creation (for any details desired)

·  Accept all payment types and provide client receipts/tickets

·  Real time analytics to track progress and respond to issues instantly

·  Email blast features integrated into the system (send automatic updates)

·  Real time check-in system and attendance tracking (lowering waiting queue)

·  Organic and user based marketing efforts 


How We Started

We are a young team of 25 that just want to make an impact on people's lives. We started right after university at 22 and in the past 3 years have come from a small 13 KM run to massive 10,000 in attendance for our upcoming event! 
When we started, we had to build everything ourselves and now we want to utilize that knowledge to help events from all around Malaysia with plans for South East Asia by bringing an affordable and efficient event management platform that will not only boost productivity but most importantly, exposure! 


From quitting our jobs at 22 to bringing massive events to Malaysia with only our wits and tenacity, read more on us here : 


http://says.com/my/lifestyle/from-kuantan-to-zombies-the-uplifting-story-of-the-24-year-olds-behind-run-for-your-lives?fb_action_ids=10153465021078136&fb_action_types=og.shares


https://vulcanpost.com/455001/slide-city-organiser-leong-delon/


Us, featured on national newspaper. 



Us, featured on national television. 


Risk & Challenges


So far, we've half way through our development stage. 
We hope to launch the platform by March 2016.
We have secured our excellent development team that has over 15 years of working experience in coding and product development.
We have secured potential marketing partners that will handle the branding and marketing of the platform early next year.
We have already confirmed arrangements with local banks in Malaysia for our secured payment gateway. 
We have secured several clients that are really keen in adopting the platform into their events next year. 

Our biggest challenge is currently financial support, without a working platform to show for our work, investors aren't too keen. But with so much already invested, ( over 50,00 USD of our own funds ), we aren't in a position to give up. 
We are currently pitching in a startup grant next month, and with several angel investors that look promising. 
Our second biggest risk is economy.
With our Country, Malaysia under heavy scrutiny, investor confidence in our currency has fallen to a new low with the National Currency of Malaysian Ringgit currently trading at over MYR 4.50 to 1 USD with some reports suggesting the ringgit will plunge to MYR 5 to 1 USD early next year.  

Final Notes


If this is not your thing, then no worries as I'm sure there are plenty of other ways you can spend your hard earned money on, but a referral or a share would be very highly appreciated. 
For everyone who helped out or wanted to help out, we thank you sincerely from the bottom of our hearts. This is our first campaign and no matter what happens, we will strive to bring this platform into reality! 
Thank you so much for your time and wish you all da best! :)

We started right after university at 22 and in the past 3 years have come from a small 13 KM run to massive 10,000 in attendance for our upcoming event! When we started, we had to build everything ourselves and now we want to utilize that knowledge to help events from all around Malaysia with plans for South East Asia by bringing an affordable and efficient event management platform that will not only boost productivity but most importantly, exposure! From quitting our jobs at 22 to bringing massive events to Malaysia with only our wits and tenacity, read more on us here : 
http://says.com/my/lifestyle/from-kuantan-to-zombies-the-uplifting-story-of-the-24-year-olds-behind-run-for-your-lives?fb_action_ids=10153465021078136&fb_action_types=og.shares
https://vulcanpost.com/455001/slide-city-organiser-leong-delon/
Us, featured on national newspaper. 


Us, featured on national television. 

    
Risk & Challenges

So far, we've half way through our development stage. 
We hope to launch the platform by March 2016.
We have secured our excellent development team that has over 15 years of working experience in coding and product development.
We have secured potential marketing partners that will handle the branding and marketing of the platform early next year.
We have already confirmed arrangements with local banks in Malaysia for our secured payment gateway. 
We have secured several clients that are really keen in adopting the platform into their events next year. 

Our biggest challenge is currently financial support, without a working platform to show for our work, investors aren't too keen. But with so much already invested, ( over 50,00 USD of our own funds ), we aren't in a position to give up. 
We are currently pitching in a startup grant next month, and with several angel investors that look promising. 
Our second biggest risk is economy.
With our Country, Malaysia under heavy scrutiny, investor confidence in our currency has fallen to a new low with the National Currency of Malaysian Ringgit currently trading at over MYR 4.50 to 1 USD with some reports suggesting the ringgit will plunge to MYR 5 to 1 USD early next year.  

Final Notes

If this is not your thing, then no worries as I'm sure there are plenty of other ways you can spend your hard earned money on, but a referral or a share would be very highly appreciated. 
For everyone who helped out or wanted to help out, we thank you sincerely from the bottom of our hearts. This is our first campaign and no matter what happens, we will strive to bring this platform into reality! 
Thank you so much for your time and wish you all da best! :)

story:
A donation of any amount gets us closer to our goal!

Please support our community youth!

2nd Annual Capoeira Tournament & Batizado

December 2nd - 4th, 2016

The Associação de Capoeira, Mestre Bimba - California, USA & the Brazilian Center for Cultural Exchange Sacramento are looking to our supportive friends, family and colleagues to help make our event a reality. Our goal is to raise $5,000. This will help cover expenses such as: travel arrangements and housing accommodations for special guests, insurance and facility rental fees, catering services, awards, among other event planning costs. We hope we can count on your support to make this year’s batizado our best one yet!

What is a batizado?

A batizado is a ­ceremony where new students are symbolically inducted into the worldwide Capoeira community. As in many aspects of Capoeira, the batizado has its own symbolism and is a very special event. Capoeiristas (people who play capoeira) from around the world and with varying levels of experience come together to teach and welcome students. In addition to receiving the first belt (corda), participants spend the weekend learning about music, dance, nutrition, and health in mini-workshops. The batizado is not a competition, but rather a special event filled with positive community activities, knowledge sharing, and appreciation of a beautiful art form.

Capoeira's Impact

 In addition to creating community, this African-Brazilian martial art and dance builds strong children physically, mentally, and morally. While playing in the roda (the circle in which the game is played), children learn to make their own decisions, both simple and complex. They develop empathy and gain healthy competitive instincts necessary in everyday life. The main goal as a teacher is to encourage and instill confidence into each student.

~MUITO OBRIGADO~

story:
Am called Mukasa Edward,am a teacher at Namakwa senior secondary school,teaching geography and physical education(Sports,Athletics). I have been doing this for 5 years now.The school has good athletes but the biggest problem we face as an institute is lack of sports equipment.Like shoes, sports kits, since most students come from humble families.


The reason am running this campaign is because am training a few students who will make great athletes in Uganda,they are promising.Uganda is known for long distance runners,we have won a number of accolades in big sporting events like the Olympics in athletics (Stephen Kiprotich) as a country.Our country is home to Akibua,Joshua Chiptegei among others.


I want you to be part of these children's future by contributing something to their cause.In case we get this funding,we shall tighten our training schedule and also give these kids motivation to train a lot harder.




Apart from money,you can help by sending us sports equipment like shoes,and kits because that is our major need as a school.
I will be glad if you help. And in case you want to talk to me,please call +256 777 10 8341, Mukasa Edward.

story:
La Dakar 2017 è una gara internazionale che inizierà il 2 Gennaio 2017 da Asuncìon, in Paraguay, per concludersi il 14 Gennaio a Buenos Aires, in Argentina, passando per la Bolivia, sede delle tappe con le altitudini più elevate che supereranno in alcuni casi i 4000 metri.

9000km di cui oltre la metà inediti, 12 tappe per 12 giorni indimenticabili. Un percorso durissimo per il centauro sardo Maurizio Sanna ma dalla grandissima visibilità internazionale per tutti coloro che faranno parte di uno dei maggiori progetti innovativi made in Sardinia.

Droni, GoPro, VR360°, Apple Watch, ma anche sistemi satellitari, innovativi occhiali da gara con GPS e visibilità sulla Community, sensori per registrare in tempo reale i dati biometrici del centauro e telecamere che ci permetteranno di vivere la gara assieme al motociclista e condividere la sua prospettiva. A tutto questo sarà associata una piattaforma 3D che ci farà rivivere e provare l'emozione di partecipare alla più famosa gara al mondo di rally automobilistico e motociclistico.

Territori nuovi e diversi da quelli europei e africani, dalla pampa ai laghi salati, passando per le vette Boliviane ma anche attraversando piantagioni, pianure e foreste dalla vegetazione lussureggiante, ingredienti base per fare della Dakar un evento da ricordare anche per questo 2017.

E soprattutto un progetto tecnologico mai tentato prima per la nostra isola dal forte impatto nei mass media di tutto il mondo.

Una moto, un pilota, un sogno. Manchi solo tu.



MAURIZIO SANNA COCCO

Classe 1959, centauro di Quartu Sant’Elena, nato a Caltanisetta da padre sardo e madre siciliana. Trasferitosi all’età di nove anni a Cagliari dove segue le orme del padre nella passione della due ruote. Giovanissimo inizia a gareggiare ed a farsi conoscere nell’ambiente motociclistico e all’età di 26 anni diventa campione sardo della classe 125. Da allora il suo impegno nelle con la due ruote non si ferma più: competizioni regionali, nazionali ed internazionali di cross, enduro e moto rally.

Maurizio Sanna Cocco guiderà una smart motorcycle dotata della tecnologie più innovative e dalla sensoristica all’avanguardia, sempre connessa di modo da poter seguire più da vicino le sue performance

…e nello zaino la Bandiera dei 4 Mori! La Sardegna a Dakar.



Terminare la DAKAR: sarebbe già una vittoria!

"La prima difficoltà e sempre reperire le risorse finanziarie. CRUEL, come sponsor principale, ha già effettuato l'iscrizione e sta creando l'evento dal punto di vista tecnologico: sito web, dispositivi IoT, visibilità su canali social, etc. per trasformare la gara in un evento multimediale per i miei supporter e appassionati in generale"

Avrò telecamere che riprenderanno la gara giorno dopo giorno, anche dal paddock a 360°, e verranno inserite nel sito dalla mia compagna, Gabriella mi seguirà nell'avventura.


È una situazione molto bella che mi cambia anche l'aspetto competitivo, l'impegno di documentare la gara per rendere partecipi amici e appassionati, mi toglie un po' di ansia della classifica.

È una gara molto difficile, dentro di te speri di finirla. Potrei ambire a un buon risultato nella mia categoria, la Veteran, ma per me sarebbe importante terminare la DAKAR: sarebbe già una vittoria!"


Il Curriculum di Maurizio

  • 1985/86 campione sardo Classe 125
  • 1988 Campione sardo Enduro
  • 1989 Campione Italiano Rally 2° di classe
  • 1990 1° di classe Rally di Sardegna e Rally del Titano 1° campionato italiano classe bicilindrica
  • 1994 1° di classe rally di Sardegna e Campionato sardo enduro
  • 1997 Dakar-Dakar 1° degli Italiani, 22° in assoluto
  • 1998 8° di classe al campionato italiano di rally
  • 2000 13° al rally dei Faraoni in Egitto e 3° nella classe marathon
  • 2005 mondiale di rally del Dubai 3° di classe
  • 2006 1° di classe al rally di Sardegna
  • 2006 partecipa al campionato mondiale di moto rally in Tunisia, Marocco ed Egitto
  • 2008 riceve il premio dalla federazione motociclistica italiana come 2° classificato nel “campionato mondiale cross country rally” over 450 rally production
  • 2010 il CONI gli consegna la medaglia d’Argento al valore atletico
  • 2013 partecipa alla SIX DAYS di Enduro (medaglia di Bronzo)


Cosa serve per partecipare a Dakar 2017

La meta è possente e per raggiungerla ha bisogno del vostro supporto. Qui di seguito le voci principali di costo da sostenere per poter partecipare alla gara:

  1. Iscrizione Gara
  2. Iscrizione assistente
  3. Assistenza meccanica
  4. Carburante moto
  5. Gomme gara
  6. Viaggio aereo x 3
  7. Kit allestimento moto
  8. Abbigliamento
  9. Attrezzatura tecnica 
  10. Iscrizione Tecnico/Operatore multimediale
  11. Vitto e alloggio team
  12. Tecnologie IoT (Apple Watch, GoPro, Sensori, etc.)

story:
GCE Lab School breaks down walls to unite school with the world.

We're raising scholarship funds to send Chicago's underserved students to GCE Lab School, where 50% of the students receive financial aid, more than any other private independent school in Chicago.

The Problem:
Low-income students do not have equal access to education and the gap is widening. We need urban schools that unite communities and position ALL students for success post high school.

Our Solution:
GCE Lab School is redefining high school education in Chicago and eliminating the opportunity gap for our students. Our 50/50 model ensures that 50% of our students receive need-based scholarships to attend GCE. This diverse learning environment unites students and communities across Chicago with amazing success. Over the past five years, our graduates have been awarded an average of $100,000 each in merit-based college scholarships.

GCE provides a transformative experience for all students. They are re-engaged in their learning and invested in their futures - successes they had not previously thought possible.

A redefined high school experience that breaks down the walls of the classroom

The traditional approach to education, with its heavy emphasis on standardized tests and siloed subjects, has failed to adapt to the changing world. At GCE Lab School, we integrate academic subjects as they occur in life. Courses such as Design & Engineering incorporate foundational math and science skills, while humanities courses, such as Equality and Rhetoric combine English and History. Students are inspired and engaged because they grasp the relevance and practical value of what they are learning. GCE’s City2ClassroomTM model then takes students out of the classroom and connects them with corporate and nonprofit industry experts. These industry partners challenge students to question their assumptions about the world around them, discuss practicalities and possibilities in the workplace and expose students to a wide range of jobs and career prospects.

GCE Lab School is a game-changer for urban education reform - designed to embrace the diversity in our communities, the power of partnerships, and the potential of our youth.

​

 

GCE Lab School has seen outstanding success among our students.

  • 80% of all graduates earned merit-based scholarships
  • 13% of graduates earned the coveted POSSE scholarship, a coveted four-year, full-ride to college.
  • Each GCE student participates in over 50 hours of community service projects every school year, strengthening the connection and relevance between school and the world.
  • Many of our students were not on track to graduate at their previous schools

We are in this together

We need you to help ensure all students have equal access to this quality education. Through your support of our scholarship program, we can support our students as they grow at GCE. Together, we are standard bearers for diminishing the inequities embedded in our education system and enriching the lives of our students.

Who We Are

GCE Lab School is partnering with UrbanX Learning, a 501(c)3 non-profit organization whose mission is to eliminate the opportunity gap for low-income urban students through the promotion of collaborative, experiential learning environments that connect low-income urban students’ academics with real-world experiences. 100% of all donations are tax deductible and go directly to funding our scholarship students.

story:
About the Competition

The FIRST Tech Challenge (FTC) is an international robotics competition for high school students. It involves a 10-person team working collaboratively over several months, assembling a robot to solve a particular competition problem set. The competition kickoff is September 10th. The competition style is a “floor game in an alliance format”.

The Team

We have started an FTC Team that is among India’s first. Our team members are in the 11th and 12th grade of the Cathedral and John Connon School, Mumbai.

We have run a Makers club in school for over a year, having built an autonomous drum kit, a speed maze-solving robot, among other projects. Each member of the team has an intense passion for science, technology, and mathematics.

The Aim

With your aid we hope to not only be able to participate in a reputed competition like FTC, but also get an opportunity to learn to think like an engineer and truly apply concepts of mechanics, which we have only read in our textbook until now. Also, we see this competition as a stepping stone to a future in science and engineering, and gain insight what it is like to work at a company involved in engineering. 

The Robot

The exact design of the robot can only be finalized upon release of the competition problem set. However, the robots in past editions of FTC have tended to be either four-wheeled or have tank treads, with various grippers, sliding shafts, hammers, lasers, and other attachments.

Funding Requirements

Participating in FTC requires purchase of various sets of parts, which have been itemized below. In addition, we require a dedicated 3D Printer and funding for filament for the printer, to print custom parts.

Perks

Perks include recognition of your support for making our team effort possible.

$250 - Personally mailed thank-you card
$500 - A small logo on our t - shirt                                                                                       
$1000  -  A large logo on our t - shirt + karaoke song of your choice

story:
In our country studying becomes harder each day because of the social and economic crisis we are passing through.

 

We are university students from Venezuela. As engineering students, we know how hard is to study by our count, without having time to go to our professor’s office, or waiting for the academic facilitators to answer our doubts.

This crisis affects directly the education on every level, professors earn too low for the work they do and students need more money every day for simply things, like printing a guide to study or even to buy essential material of study.

 

 

We believe that better education will help overcome this crisis.


Our principal aim is to simplify the hours of study for many students, by giving to them an easy way to contact professors around the country and other students with the capability to help them. Everyone who could help by answering questions, will have the opportunity to give online classes using our platform receiving money according to the hours of classes that they impart. This possibility will be able to professors and students certificated as part of a university. It will give them a chance to reduce the financial troubles that the university's community is living right now.

In Venezuela, students and faculty caught in budget-driven university closures.

  A typical professor's salary is now worth the equivalent of $35 a month. 

Higher education in Venezuela threatened as professors flee universities for better jobs.


Making real our idea will complete this common empty space in the hours of study. Giving access to a Website we had called "Uniweb" in which students would access and ask questions according to their needs, always keeping an academically subject. this questions will be answered by other students or professors. We will keep this inside the academically by asking to the new registers (students and professors) to give a certification that they belong to a Venezuelan University.

To start our project called "UniWeb" we need 3000$ this money will be used to pay for the domain and hosting of our website, and to pay for the development. In Venezuela the technology field became really expensive because of the currency control that the government have been implanted. So finding the technology that we need to develop our website and ours apps for Android and iOS will not be cheap, but it can be possible.

If we don't reach the quantity we initially need, the project "UniWeb" will not be cancelled. The platform for questions and answers is the cheaper than the one for giving the on line lessons, so this part will be realized together with the apps for the smartphones.

A huge number of professors are leaving the country looking for better opportunities and a higher salary, and the professors who are still here don't have the encouragement to impart good quality classes. This situation affects directly the students, that are always making their best to understand the lessons. But for the more we try there are always questions we cannot answer by ourselves, this is the principal reason that encouraged us to create this project.

¡We are finalists in Impact Hub Caracas!

 

So we invite you to sponsor us, believe in our idea and trust in the future of the education in Venezuela.
